description:
Stumbled upon this place and the food was amazing. Super cute and cozy, zero wait, and our server, Logan, was amazing. Attentive, friendly and upbeat. 
Didn't even get drinks... I will next time!
get the pot pie. OMG.
author: shauna o.

description:
When my bf suggested going to Fat Angel, I didn't jump on the idea because I probably subconsciously thought it implied something about myself. Fast forward two years, and my friends and I are wandering about Pac Heights and I suggest Fat Angel. We snagged the last table, I received compliments for my recommendation, and my response was that it was actually my bf's rec. Moral of the story: Don't take restaurant names too seriously, and listen to recommendations by your SO. 

The alcoholic menu is extensive and overwhelming, in a good way. They have amazing wine and beer selections from all over the world. It's somewhat pricier, but they also have less expensive options for the rest of us peasants. The cocktail menu is short but intriguing, with a beer or wine base. There is a list of rotating draft beer and wine as well.

(+) We started off with a cheese and charcuterie board ($16 + $18 for 3 meats and 3 cheeses). It was beautifully laid out, with little dabs of spicy nuts, jams, honey, and whole grain mustard to mix it up.
- Brie was quite standard and the piece was small
- Pecorino and machego were good, not too strong but subtle
- Finocchio was like a fatty salami. Tasty, but may not be the best if you're on a diet
- The spicy prosciutto spread was more like a meat jam, and was also a somewhat small quantity. If you are craving something prosciutto-y, I suggest the speck or the bresaola. Tastes deliciously cured
- The bread came in a paper bag on the side. Would have liked it on a board for Instagram purposes, and in fact I think it comes on the same board if you don't order as much stuff for your board

(++) The tomato, spicy sausage, arugula, and Parmesan flatbread ($15) turned out more impressive than your standard flatbread. The bread is so miraculously thin it's almost like eating a cracker with a myriad of toppings with contrasting flavors. I bet this is what pizza tastes like in heaven for fat angels (....get it?)

(+++) We got their popular FA chicken pot pie ($14). I'm not sure if I've ever had fancy chicken pot pie (I can only think of the frozen ones from my childhood and that my roommate in college used to microwave). But FA has created quite a gastropub-worthy version with roasted chicken and assorted veggies, spiked with sherry and tarragon, and topped with a flaky puff pastry. It's savory and herby, with contrasting textures, a tad of creaminess without being too heavy, and a bit of nostalgia.

The server was helpful in her suggestions for the charcuterie board, never rushed us (even though we were taking a long time chatting after dinner and there was a wait on the Friday), and split the check 3 ways for us. It totaled to slightly above $40 each, for a glass of wine and a lot of food.

The ambiance is vintage and cool: marble tables, a chandelier with a statement, and a small patio for better food lighting. FA is a place I would come back to, in order to try the different drinks and noms. Plus, their menu has variation and is printed daily. (at least until SF bans non-reusable menus)

My minor complaints are that my friend noticed a bit of lipstick stain left on her cup, and that there were little fruit flies including one that landed in my wine glass. Good thing I finished it quickly. 

Other tips:
- Happy hour is 4-6pm weekdays, $1 off wine/beer and $2 off flatbreads
- It's a short walk from Jtown and Social Study, so there are great options for more drinks/things to do afterwards
- Not really great for large groups since it's fairly small. I'd say not to come with more than 6ish people
- Other dishes that look amazing are the greens (it a huggggggeee  fluffy salad) and spicy mac n cheese (comes in a skillet, of course)

Fun fact: it's owned by the same group as Trestle, Stone's Throw, and Corridor, and it indeed has the same wow factor.
author: Edna C.

description:
The Mac and cheese is good.

The ceased salad is good.

But the chicken pot pie is phenomenal!  

Great food!
author: Aaron W.

description:
Back again and it's still a solid 4-stars. Service is nice, friendly and there's still many, many types of wine on tap.

What's missing? Flavored butter. That is a bummer, but hey, things change. 

Despite the differences with the menu, Fat Angel still retains it's vintage, homey vibe.
author: Abby S.

description:
I always love visiting Fat Angel before going to a concert at The Fillmore! They have a great selection of wine, beer, flatbreads, and appetizers!

My favorite dish to order here is the signature Chicken Pot Pie. It's more of a deconstructed pot pie but seriously so delicious and filling. It's perfect for sharing with another person. The Flatbread Pizzas are also delicious and the perfect pairing with any of their beers + wines! 

My only complaint is the limited staff. Usually there are only 2-3 people working and it might take a while for you to place an order. Patience is a virtue!
author: MyTien P.

description:
Great staff! Lots of choices for all types of beers and a good selection of wines. There is some food that can be ordered to have while drinking also. 
 A good place to just relax and enjoy your spirits and the wait staff there don't hover over you.
author: V. P.

description:
Let me just say, this place is solid.  I seem to drive by it a lot the last couple of years. I like how secluded it is in one of my favorite neighborhoods in this city. I finally decided to give it a try last night and was blown away!  Not because they are doing anything that is rocket science.  Mainly because the ambience and their simple menu (but very solid!!!) and extensive wine and beer list.  

Ambience: What more could you want? Candle lit, very cozy.  Love the wood furnishings and bar.  There is a big stuffed buck on the wall when you walk in.  Makes one feel like they are going back to the shire after a long days hunt. LOL

Service: Our waitress was very attentive and knowledgeable about the wine offerings when asked.  She recommended one wine and then went as far as coming back with the original recommendation as a sample as well as a revised recommendation she wanted us to try. Now that is service!  

Wine: Great selections. I had the Sauvignon Blanc and it was great! It packed a great punch as almost all CA wines should.

Food: Simple offerings but very flavorful! The food came out fast and that had me worried for a little bit but after we took the first bites those fears were gone.  They really are good at what they do, do a few things and do them well.  I had the chicken pot pie. It was delish and a healthy portion (as well as the wine pours!) The pot pie actually had chicken in it! Not like the typical SF eatery where you're to fine 2 pieces of chicken in your chicken salad. There was a lot of chicken, and perfectly cooked veggies. Not soggy.  The caesar salad was also killer.  We ordered the roasted Chinese nuts with our wine and that was a great duo.  The nuts were not chinese though. ha!  Sadly, we were too full for dessert. next time!

If you're in the weekday slump, and not looking to cook or just want to go out for a simple yet delicious meal, come to fat angel. Bring your friends or family!  Will definitely be revisiting!
author: Dario L.

description: Comfortable atmosphere and short wait for seating. Limited menu with passable charcuterie and bread. Macaroni, while small, used its cheese well and combined it with unique heat. Pot pie has a deliciously flaky crust if a bit short on the chicken.
author: P M.

description: Stopped by for the early happy hour on a weekday and was glad I did! The sausage and arugula flatbread was delicious and a great list of beers that I'm looking forward to trying more of. I also had the chicken pot pie, which was delicious but not quite what I expected. It is a little bit more like a thick chicken stew topped with a square of puff pastry. It captures the spirit of pot pie but not really the same taste. Tasty food, great service, would recommend this as a chill spot for a casual drink or bite.
author: Ada C.

description:
My new favorite spot to hit before seeing a show at the Fillmore! Their chicken pot pie is AMAZING!! It's inspired me to make my own one day...

The ambiance of Fat Angel is relaxed, simple, and classy. I can see this as a great place to grab drinks with friends or even a date. I came here on a Tuesday so it wasn't super crowded; not sure how crowded it would be on a weekend as it is a pretty small establishment. 

I love the details for this bar though... the organ and choir sign to go along with the theme... and the 99 bottles of wine displayed on the wall. 

Fat Angel also has different variety of beer and wine so it is a crowd pleaser!
author: Janet H.

description:
Nice ambience, and sufficient seating. Nice selection of beer and wine. Food wasn't bad, but wasn't spectacular. 

I'd come here again for a chill sit down to catch up with friends, but not necessarily a place to impress a date.
author: Mako U.

description:
3.5 Stars!

Checked out Fat Angel with a friend after seeing it on a "best of" wine bars in SF. Overall, Fat Angel does some things well and with some tweaking could be a great place to grab a drink in the neighborhood.

The good:
The space is super cute and when we arrived at 5:30, it was pretty empty. By the time we left around 7:30 it was packed. Definitely arrive early for a spot. The service here was also excellent and their staff gave great Recs. I really appreciated that they do tastings if you're not sure about a glass of wine. Great to try before committing to a full glass. 

The food was also tasty though portions on the charcuterie board were laughable (more on that later). Wine selection was good but they seem to have much more beer here. Happy hour glasses were only $1 off so I ordered off the regular menu and tried the Sangiovese and Tempranillo (both great reds). I tried my friend's happy hour rośe and it was really great-very refreshing.

For bites we ordered the flatbread with prosciutto, grapes and Gorgonzola. Really cracker thin crust (almost like matzo) but seriously good and $2 off for HH. The spicy mac and cheese was also one of my favorite things--I would come in again just for that!

The not so good:
I initially thought Fat Angel would be a cozy spot to catch up with a friend but it's LOUD. I mean, scream across the table, leaning in, reading lips of your dining companion, loud. Definitely wouldn't recommend if you want to have a conversation. Very lively atmosphere though (I think the pandora station was either Madonna or Lady Gaga).

We were pretty disappointed with the portion size and accompaniments for the meat and cheese plate. Four thin slices of salami and a half-moon of cheese?!? The bread was okay but with Jane bakery in the nabe, I was hoping they served Jane bread with the board (They don't. It's firebrand bakery out of Oakland). 

Lastly, I thought the price point was a bit high compared to similar wine bars in the city. When the bill came, it felt a little absurd to be paying $54+ each especially given we got there during happy hour.

Better happy hour specials would be great as well as fixing the portion sizes for the charcuterie board. Something on the walls to absorb the noise would also be nice.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Fat Angel is a great place to unwind with a small group of friends or a date. It's a small wine bar with a relaxing ambiance and chill vibes. They only serve beer and wine here, and although the list isn't huge there will probably be something for everyone. You won't have to worry about college kids tossing back Jaeger bombs either.

Our group of 7 easily got a table in the evening on a weekday night and this restaurant is perfect for sharing food with friends and enjoying each other's company. The charcuterie plate along with cheese was perfect for sharing. My favorite food item on the menu here was the chicken pot pie; it was hot and juicy inside and nice and flaky on the outside. I'd probably pass on the pretzel plate next time, but if you want something "bready" then any of the flat breads would satisfy. 

The service was top notch and everyone there really helped make our night wonderful. Overall, Fat Angel might not be the greatest place to go if you're trying to have an actual dinner, but its perfect for hanging out with friends if you're looking for a chill night.
author: Viet L.

description:
Came here for a quick bite/drinks before heading off to the Fillmore for a concert. Fat Angel is small but pretty busy establishment. The staff really great though, and even offered to let us order food at a side bar space and eat it there (despite no seats). We ended up ordering some drinks + food and took a seat in their small outdoor space while waiting for food. They turned on the outdoor heater and lights for us and it was so comfortable we just ended up hanging out there and just ordering any other items at the bar inside and bringing it out.  

They have a good variety of wines and beers to choose from. The Navarro Edelzwicker (white) was soooo goood for me (light and sweet). I think I could have sat there with friends having conversation all night with that glasses of that Navarro all night. It was so easy to sip on! The food came with lightening speed, which was great because we did have a hangry friend with us! The mac and cheese seemed to be a staple and there was also butter w/ bread, but from what I heard, it was a bit on the obscure side with hints of lemon (and capers?). It was interesting, but probably not to my friends palate! 

Overall, service was great, food was fast and decent and the space was just right for all our pre-concert needs! I would definitely be back if ever in the area!
author: Deanna S.

description:
Good food, chill vibes. 

Atmosphere attributes to so much here. They have a great selection on tap and such knowledgeable staff. It may not be alcohol, but I really enjoy getting the ginger beer here. It accompanies the meal well. 

There is a great selection of food for any occasion whether you are looking for a snack to accompany your drink or trying to have a full meal. Obviously, I'm trying to have a full meal. The kale salad is SO good. It must be all the cheese that they put on it, making it so unhealthy but I get it every time. Note: it's bigger than the size of my head (definitely shareable). 

The chicken pot pie is my friend's favorite. It has shredded chicken, the vegetable mix (peas, carrots, etc.) and two puff pastries. The sauce is thick and savory. I like to add a lot of pepper onto it. 

I've also gotten the mac and cheese, which is really rich. It's topped with breadcrumbs and put under the broiler. You can't do mac and cheese wrong. 

If I were to recommend another item, I would get one of the flatbreads!
author: Tina Y.

description: Went for some drinks and appetizers. Overall, very basic stuff and very expensive. Not planning on going back anytime soon
author: Evan M.

description: Came here before a show. Had their roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola, which was ok. felt like the ingredients didn't go together so well. Also ordered a meat and cheese plate as well. Place does get crowded, so get here early to snag a seat. The Stones Throw Pimm's Cup was the best drink here, but it was just ok. Did not like the champagne cocktail though. Service is decent. They had  lot of table seats, but wanted to keep them for large parties, so we had a seat at the bar. Overall, decent place to go before a show at The Fillmore.
author: Lisa T.

description: We were in the neighborhood for a dinner reservation and had some time to kill so we stopped at the Fat Angel for a drink.    It was surprisingly busy for 4:30 on a Saturday afternoon.    They bartender was very friendly and knowledgeable of the beers - very large variety.
author: Diane W.

description:
We came here on a slow weekday night at around 10PM to get some food and try out some wine. When we arrived they told us that the kitchen closed in about half an hour, so we sat down and looked over the menu. We asked the server what her preferences and what was good and all she did was point at the menu items and told us what was in the dishes. With absolutely no input we decided to order the chicken pot pie, pretzel with mustard and cheese sauce, the flatbread with roasted grapes and goat cheese. The food was alright and I would have to say I have honestly had a lot better elsewhere.

Chicken Pot Pie - The first bite I took was from the center and the soup was cold in the center. The puff pastry they had on top was soggy from the top to the bottom. In that first bite I got a chicken bone. The flavor was decent and the veggies were cooked well.

Flatbread - The flatbread itself was very thin and cracker like. There were areas where it was nice and crispy but then there were other areas where it was really soggy and all of the toppings just fell off. The grapes were probably the best part about the dish. They were seasoned well and had some really great flavors.

Pretzel - The shape and presentation of the pretzel was really bad, but it was probably the best tasting dish we had. It went great with the whole mustard. The cheese sauce was really think and broken and did not have a great texture.

We also ordered a glass of wine and beer. Our wine had some pieces of cork in it. With how service was going that night we decided to just take out the pieces and drink our drinks. Every time the server came by, it always felt like an inconvenience to her and that she had better things to do, even though we were 2 out of 6 people there that night.

To be honest, I would avoid coming here. There are very few places that I feel like I need to get away from, and this was one of them. I would not visit again unless the service gets better.
author: Camera P.

description: Cool little tuckes away place close by the Fillmore.  Great place to be before a short walk to the concert hall.  Great selection of beer and wine.  Service friendly and excellent.
author: Lauren S.

description:
It's a relaxed atmosphere at Fat Angels with great service - attentive, friendly, and professional staff. They genuinely want to provide the patrons with a good experience and it really shows.

The wine and beer selection had good breadth (more wine options by the glass, please!) and the menu was "hefty" enough to go with the alcohol. The kale salad was fresh and flavorful, the flat bread with arugula and sausage savory, and the chicken pot pie soothing and warm.
author: Cici T.

description: One of the better hangout happy hours in the area with delicious and cheap flatbreads (I often sub the prosciutto for arugula on the prosciutto flatbread, but all of them are tasty as is) and a great selection of happy hour wines. Relaxed but pretty atmosphere. Confession: I've never tried this spot outside the happy hour because the happy hour is so excellent.
author: Anastasia Z.

description: What a fun little wine bar!  I met friends here on a Friday night and it was the perfect place for a girls catch up. Drinks were good, but I wish they had a more extensive wine list. We had the flatbread pizza with Gorgonzola, grapes, walnuts and prosciutto...it was delicious!!!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: An after work fave- solid wine and beer list. An extensive beer list would be putting it mildly. Went with the merlot, Rutherford Napa. Always a fave. Tried their flatbread. All was good.
author: Linda H.

description: This place is sooo good from the beer/wine selection, food and service. I've dined/drank here a couple times and it never disappoints. Tonight I met a friend for dinner and I started with a delicious bottle of sour and she had a passion fruit beer. We split the trout salad which is a very large portion of greens, trout, and potatoes with delicious tangy dressing. Plenty for 3 or even 4 people. We also split the spicy tomatoe and sausage flat bread with arugula... I'm usually not a flatbread person becuase I'm like just give me real pizza but this works so well. I've had a couple of their flatbreads before and each time they're crispy and so flavorful. We also added the fried capers for $3 and they were a nice cripsy topping to the salad and pizza. Next time I'm trying the pot pie!
author: Aryn C.

description: This is my fav spot in the neighborhood. Logan is the best, he is always bubbly and positive. After moving around many cities it is really nice to find a spot that you can feel at home at.:)
author: Ingrid L.

description: Great beer selection! Coming from Ohio, I'm used to 400 craft beers on tap, something hard to find in San Francisco. On this particular night, I was craving a pumpkin beer, and I was able to find something to satisfy my thirst. Great atmosphere inside, I will have to come back and try the food, it looked delicious.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Got a 1.5 hour wait on the last attempt to visit and ended up at State provision instead. So glad decided to give this place a try again
Sunday night - plenty of empty tables \m/

Amazing service! There were 2 bartenders both amazing. The beer selection was the best I have seen , and their menu organization was easy to navigate. Loved the chicken pot pie, not a big fan of the butter (3 for $16)

Highly recommend - must try for beer lovers!
author: Anju J.

description: super cute wine bar with good food. the food portions are pretty big and filling. I recommend the kale salad--it's pretty good. And the wine selection is pretty good too!
author: Jessica K.

description: GREAT beer selection! They have an extensive list of beers and wines on their menu, and I absolutely love their beers on tap. They always have new sours, which are my favorite. Can't go wrong with any of the flatbreads, the flatbread with the spicy sausage is as it claims...spicy! But still really good (I'm also a wimp when it comes to spicy, so take that with a grain of salt). Really recommend for a first date, or for happy hour.
author: Gina B.

description: I'm not a beer drinker but thankfully, this place has a nice selection of hard root beer and ginger beer! I got the hard root beer which was excellent. For food, I got the smoked trout salad which was a TON of food for the price! I've never not been able to finish a salad but I wasn't able to this time. Good service and good value for the money. Beer drinkers will probably get more out of this place but it does have a little something for everyone!
author: Pooja C.

description:
A non-foodie friend of mine burst out laughing, uncontrollably so, when I uttered the term "gastropub," but maybe if he stopped by Fat Angel he'd understand.

Fat Angel feels like a rustic country saloon, with antique-looking furnishings, chandeliers, and a stuffed moose head, but is really a lively yet casual neighborhood pub just off the Fillmore corridor. The strongest point here is the extensive, well-curated beer menu, with solid offerings from around the world. The wine offerings have also been carefully selected.

As for the "gastropub" theme, the food offerings here are quite solid. There are a variety of small bites, some solid cheese and salumi offerings, and dependable, hearty comfort fare like the chicken pot pie, mac n' cheese, or braised beef shortrib stew. Service is also friendly and patient, especially when it comes to explaining all the choices on their menu.

A very solid place just for a few drinks, or even a date. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I love the staff here -- they're all always so nice, quick, and helpful. Don't know which beer or wine to try? Don't panic! Though the drink list may seem dauntingly long, everyone is great with recommendations. They haven't steered me wrong yet! Good music, even better food... it's no wonder I come here so often!

I recommend the bacon-y kale salad with rotisserie chicken, or trying the spicy sausage flatbread (discounted during happy hour!) if you can't decide what to order.
author: Jenni S.

description:
I decided to stop by Fat Angel to have some drinks and food with a friend, and I was pleasantly surprised by the experience.  I walked in expecting to sit at the bar, but as soon as I stepped in, I noticed that the bar is on the smaller side of things.  However, it did not take too long to get seated at a table, and I thought the service was friendly right from the start.

We ended up sharing several items including the spicy mac n' cheese, the smoked trout salad, and the pretzel.  I've never been the biggest macaroni and cheese fan, but I though Fat Angel's version was solid with a creamy mixture of cheeses (though not very spicy).  The pretzel was excellent, with a chewy yet firm texture (and given that it was from Firebrand, I am not surprised that it was amazing).  I liked that the trout salad was not overdressed, but you were still able to adequately sample the horseradish vinaigrette.  They offer a limited specialty cocktail menu, so I'd recommend sticking with the wine and beer selection.
author: Keith H.

description:
Really cool Gastropub. I had one the most amazing IPA ever (don't remember the name unfortunately). We ordered a bratwurst order, mac and cheese and a Caesar salad. Everything tasted fresh and it was well prepared. Definitively a good spot to visit if you are in San Fran. Did I say service was awesome? Cheers!

Buena parada durante una visita a la zona de Fillmore. Precios razonables y comida bastante fresca. Me tomé una de las mejores cervezas IPA que he probado. Ordenamos el bratwurst (salchicha alemana), una porción de macarrones con queso y una ensalada cesar. Todo muy bien preparado. Mencioné que el servicio fue muy bueno? Salud!!
author: Hugo d.

description: Logan is the best! So great and soooo handsome! Literally the most amazing bartender! He works thurs to Sunday. Always ask for him he's so great!!!
author: Liz H.

description: One of the best happy hours in town! Great price and selection. Of wine and beer. $5 flatbreads are so good! Skip everything else (including dinner) and come here instead! Some outdoor seating, but the open air setting inside is just as nice.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Fat Angel is a relaxed-yet-cool wine bar/gastropub, perfect for a quick drink or a few solid bites. The boy and I dropped by before a nearby dinner last weekend, and had a really great time.

THE HIGHLIGHTS.
+ Friendly, helpful staff
+ Quality, hand-mixed cocktails (seriously)
+ Outrageously awesome selection of local beers and wines
+ Very cool, trendy interiors (loved sitting at the marble bar!)

I can't speak for the food, but there were many happy customers noshing away behind us.

One note (unrelated to Fat Angel) - if you're a dog owner, don't just tie up your overly dependent black Labrador Retriever in front of the place, and leave it there while it's RAINING. Just because it has a water bowl doesn't make you a good pet owner. Either sit outside with your pet or leave it at home, don't be negligent because you want to get a drink.
author: Claire S.

description:
I had some time to kill before dinner, so I met up some friends at Fat Angel for a drink. I got there a little before 6pm, so I was able to grab some seats at the bar. It was Thursday, February 25th.

*Stones throw's pimm's cup: housemade pimm's & ginger beer ($9)
*Crement de loire: domaine claude branger 'eclipse' muscadet, france ($13 glass)
*Lambrusco grasparossa: barbolini 'lancillotto' castelvetro, italy ($9 glass)

I wanted a glass of bubbly so I got the crement de loire. My girlfriend got the glass of lambrusco. It was a bubbly red. As a fan of red wine, I ended up liking her glass more. Another friend joined us and he got the pimm's cup. It was refreshing, but it was a little too sweet for me.

I'd love to come back for their food. I was actually tempted to order something to snack on while we were drinking, but I restrained since we were going to dinner.

Great place for wine. I will definitely be back to try their food.
author: Elena N.

description:
Was pretty excited to try Fat Angel out, but the bartender completed ruined any chance of that happening. I got there a few minutes earlier than a friend and all the bar seats were taken, so I decided to sit by the window. The bartender called me over and told me I couldn't sit there unless I was eating dinner. Totally fair, except half the place was empty. So I told him I would immediately get up if he needed the chair. Surprisingly, he said "no, can't do that."

After a bit more back and forth with no real explanation of their "rule", and still in shock that I couldn't sit for a few minutes in a place that had plenty of open seating, I left and met my friend across the street at Sheba Piano Lounge where they were happy to have us.
author: Vinay A.

description:
Fat Angel's food menu is simple, it's wine and beer menu extensive. If interested in food and drinks that borders on the unfamiliar, look somewhere else. The reason why I love Fat Angel is that it succeeds in what may quaint neighborhood jaunts fail to do: keep things simple and classy. Fat Angel serves up tastes and an ambiance that is comfortable and recognizable. This restaurant doesn't attempt to be something it's not.

Since I discovered this place over a year ago, I visit the establishment about once per month. Of all San Francisco restaurants, this would be my most visited and the place I most often take friends for a light, casual dinner. My friends always leave commenting how much they are "surprised" by the food and ambiance of this hidden gem of a bar/restaurant. 

My 'go-to' meal here is the Fat Angel Chicken Pot Pie, with roasted carrots, chicken, sherry and tarragon ($14). Their bread is less like a biscuit, more like a croissant. I think the light, flakey texture of bread choice is key for this dish. The contents themselves are thick and creamy, without leaving you stuffed. When I need to eat emotionally, I crave this chicken pot pie.

Some other dishes I have tried that I have enjoyed greatly are the Spicy Mac N' Cheese, with gruyère, cheddar and parmiggiano-reggiano ($12), the Baby Kale, minus bacon, marcona almonds and Parmesan ($12). 

As for drinks, I encourage you to be adventurous and try something new every time. I am never disappointed. 

The service here is impeccable. The bar and wait staff is a tightly-knit family. If you show your face here often enough, they'll recognize you, remember your tastes and give you recommendations for navigating their beer and wine lists. The team is also lightning fast at delivering your food, checking up on you, and bringing you the bill whenever ready. 

As has been mentioned in other reviews, this place should be listed as a bar, not a restaurant. Think of it as a bar with bites on par. 

There's limited seating here, with most tables set for two. Perfect for a date night; not ideal for a family dinner.
author: Kimberlee P.

description:
Great bartenders and the atmosphere is great. It's kinda small but a great date spot too. They have happy hour from M-F 4:30-6PM. I believe for bottle of wine its about $4 dollars off, 1$ off draft, and $2 off flat bread. 

I've heard their chicken pot pie was good but wasn't able to try it. The cheese and meat plate was really good too. Can't go wrong with that.
author: Jenn L.

description: You know, I reeeeeeeaally have wanted to love this place since it's super close to where we live and it has so much potential to be a regular spot to come and enjoy food and libations, but I gotta say it's left me a little bit bummed out each time. After coming here multiple times randomly over the last couple of years with my lady, I've honestly yet to experience anyone who is a genuinely friendly, warm or fuzzy personality. Whether it be bartenders or servers, everyone just has seemed a bit on edge or curt or gruff during our visits. At first I thought it was an anomaly but it's been more than a couple times now and it's really the one thing that's kept me from coming back regularly. Maybe they are really sweet and I'm just catching them on a bad day? Everytime? I dunno. I've tried to give the benefit of the doubt but they all seem really stressed to me for the most part. Also, I think their seating policy is a tad too uptight. I get that they have limited space, but in my experience, they will not seat you until your entire party has arrived regardless of if they're having a slow night. Every restaurant is different and I know this isn't a completely unique policy, but from a patron's perspective it can be frustrating and I'm merely recommending a little bit of flexibility. If 3 out of 4 people are present and hungry and ready to start spending our money at your establishment, why make us stand around?? This isn't really in one of the high traffic, tourist-dense areas of town. Admittedly, it's been a few months since I've been in so perhaps they've loosened up. Aside from that, they have great beer and wine options, nice ambience, a great outdoor seating space when the weather isn't too windy and some pretty yummy food offerings. I will say I'd like to see a few more menu options, however. Their choices seem a bit limited imho, but whatever. I have no idea how much kitchen space they have to work with. Willing to give another try sometime down the road but would probably be the last if the general vibe remains what it has been previously. We'll see.
author: Kareem C.

description: Great beer and wine selection; bartenders are friendly and offer samples in case you're stuck between a few choices. Very intimate setting, great candle lighting, and location is tucked away from the crowds. We had the spicy Mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, kale salad, and asparagus olive flatbread. I'm normally very picky about my Mac and cheese and it was okay that didn't have that richness to it. The flat bread crust was a little too thin almost like a water salt cracker. However, the kale salad and chicken pot pie were amazing and I couldn't stop eating it. Overall, great place!
author: Celia B.

description:
Pot pie to go was on-point!  Good portion size, enough I think for 2 people!  The filing was a good comfort food,  tasted like your mother's chicken noodle soup but thicker.  The flakey buttery crust was sooo good!  It maintained is light crispness as I finished the pie slowly.   

The lady who took my order at the bar was very nice

I'd probably come back again if I was in the area!
author: Tina A.

description: I really enjoyed myself! The pot pie was to die for. My server could not have been better! We came late but service did not make me feel rushed. Logan  was so attentive and made sure I got exactly what I wanted. Thank you so much I will definitely be back
author: Stacey G.

description: We live down the block from this small steakhouse & finally went to check itbout last night and were grateful. Our waitress/bartender Liz helped us out with a few suggestions and were happy we listened. We started with mac & cheese (so good btw & a bit spicy ) then had the tomatoe flatbread with the smoked trout salad. I have never had a fiah salad and was sceptical, but am happy i did it bc it was soo good! The place ia timy , but romantic ambiance and very pretty inside.
author: Shira T.

description: Romantic mood lighting, cozy space for a date. Great service. Draft beer AND draft wine along with a long list for bottles.  Enough said. I'd come back for sure.
author: Jenny P.

description:
remember that lousy pickup line like "somebody call heaven, there's an angel on the loose!"?

well i invented a new sorryazz line: "somebody call prosciutto, there's a fat angel on the loose!"

smh and y'all wonder why i'm single :p

it definitely can't have anything to do with netflix n chill coughbingewatchlukecageseason1cough

which is why delivery happened that night

(^_^) Grape Prosciutto Flatbread $13 (http://bit.ly/2eHzxqB)
crackery crust like st louis pizza
overall salty despite grapes; fun #livemas

(-_^) Sausage Plate $15 (http://bit.ly/2eSGkuS)
one of the sausages was so dry #twss

good thing i'm not into the westworld remake but i did catch up on black mirror
author: Dan B.

description:
Hidden neighborhood gem!

The drink selection is top notch, food is great, ambiance is warm and intimate, and staff is as friendly as they come. This is a go-to spot for me for so many occasions (dinner with a friend, date night, etc.) and I recommend it anytime someone is looking for a bar/restaurant in Lower Pac Heights. One night, we showed up close to closing and enjoyed a drink while seated at the bar. The bartender let us stay as she cleaned up and poured us tastes of some of the more unique wines they have. That experience reflected the friendly neighborhood atmosphere I love so much about Fat Angel!
author: Emily F.

description: Great spot for a Friday afternoon drink! On a visit to SF to hang out with a buddy, he recommended this place to grab some appetizers and some sour beer. We arrived in the late afternoon, early evening. The place was already fairly busy But we were quickly seated by the pleasant hostess on the front patio. The weather was perfect as we, conversation and people watched. We enjoyed a flatbread and some beverages. The flatbread was cooked perfectly, fresh toppings but the crispy crunch at the end. This was the first time I've ever had a sour but it matched very well with the flatbread. Even though it was busy, we didn't feel rushed to finish as others were waiting.
author: Frank T.

description: I'm doing a roadtrip to Seattle and San Francisco was one of my stops... 'Fat Angel' is about an 8 minute walk from the hotel I was staying at and it was an amazing experience. All the bartenders were very kind and attentive...they had a wide selection of beer and wine and a small food menu with great options!! I had the Scrilla beer which was hoppy and bitter and very smooth I definitely recommend it.
author: Rosa Adriana A.

description:
The chicken pot pie here is delicious!!! The puff pastry was flaky/buttery and the inside was very creamy. The only thing is that I wished the pot pie was a little hotter, it got cold pretty quickly. 

I also loved their flatbread! The flatbread crust tasted like baked Parmesan chips. There is a large selection of beer. 

The place is a little small, so there might be a wait, but you can put your name on a wait list through Yelp. 

Would definitely come here again for their flat bread and Mac and cheese.
author: Jennifer K.

description: So good! Great atmosphere and amazing food. The service was perfect and the food delicious (kale salad and chicken pot pie are the way to go). We both tried different types of cider, both very well done, cold, and refreshing. Then we got the creme brûlée - dear lord that was so good. Ultimately you can't beat a relaxed atmosphere and fresh food. Easily one of my favorite places now.
author: Shadiah G.

description:
How could I resist going somewhere called Fat Angel? Cool vibe. Love the decor. Right when I walked in, I learned that my whole party must be present to be seated. The seats at the bar were taken, so I just stood awkwardly by the entrance. The waitress handed me a menu but then I was ignored by the bartender. Eventually I ordered an IPA from their small beer list.

Once my friends had arrived and we were finally seated, it took a REALLY long time for us to be able to order, get our food, then ultimately pay for everything. This place was severely understaffed when we went. Poor waitress was the only one working the floor and occasionally the bartender would help out. It was an annoying experience.

I ordered the spicy mac n cheese, which was pretty good! Went well with my IPA. I would be down to give Fat Angel another try but I really did not enjoy my first time here.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
This place is a hidden gem! My friend and I stumbled upon this place and we were looking for a place to grab happy hour, and I am so glad we ended up here!

The space is small and intimate, but in a nice and cozy way. Not in a cramped, overcrowded way. It has an upscale, but easy-going feel to it and I love the look inside. It feels like a vintage gastropub. We sat at the bar and were just planning on having a simple glass of wine and some olives to munch on....but we ended up being there for over 3 hours!!! Our bartender was so friendly and welcoming. We drank wine all night and she suggested a flatbread from their menu that we NEVER would have considered but it was amazing! The flatbread we got was roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto with gorgonzola. Soooo good! The flavors came together so well and it was perfect to have with wine.

This is the perfect place to come to for some wine and cheese. Their flatbreads are delicious and perfect for sharing. And the atmosphere is so intimate and cozy. Cannot wait to come back.
author: Chisholm T.

description: This place is the perfect preshow drinks and light food spot. Very respectable beer list with nightly specials and some great cheese board, salad and skillet entrees. Very small and not a lot of tables so arrive early to enjoy the libations!
author: May O.

description:
The very first time I came here, I ordered 3 meats, 3 cheeses, 1 butter for an amazing charcuterie board. This place made me FALL IN LOVE with charcuterie boards. Now every time I go to a restaurant with one on the menu, I always order it. Always. 

Second time here was more recent. 
I remember the butter being softer and easier to spread last time. Also way more flavorful and delicious. Last time we ordered the maple bacon and this time the chill garlic. High key disappointing this time. Butter was hard. Their menu clearly states "Served w/ warm" but it was definitely cold butter. They gave us little bread (Firebrand levain) The bread wasn't tasty and slightly burnt. 

Salad. Romaine, fried capers, w/ house caesar dressing (raw egg used) add roast chicken
- overall not good. not enough flavor in their dressing. not enough dressing. large portion. chicken was dry and flavorless. 

Flatbread. Roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola
- I tried some. It was okay. I don't think the roasted red grapes were all that roasted. They were like regular grapes sliced in half. 

Plates. FA's chicken pot pie - roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon 
- This was good. My friend loved it. FYI...lots and lots of tarragon. Which I enjoy but some people might not.
author: Ness H.

description:
Never had such bad service at an SF bar (/restaurant) before. Granted, it was Friday night, but we honestly only ever saw one person working the entire restaurant AND behind the bar. She looked stressed and overworked, but she was at least pleasant and helpful. Though, when I finally got to her, she suggested I push my way past an entire group of people to squeeze up to the bar......it would have been super rude. But, she was nice enough to let me get service at the other end of the bar where things were much clearer.

When I finally got service, she was very helpful, and the beer selection was solid. But, none of my friends got drinks because they weren't as capable at flagging down the one employee here. I'm grateful to that poor overworked waitress, but I also feel bad for her!
author: Chris S.

description:
Visited them due to "Top 10 Mac 'n Cheese Spots" according to SF The Official Guide! 

Swoosh! Nope... not by a long shot. Decent but definitely NOT in the Top10!

But the good... Great Beer & Wine list. Clean 'n Cozy and friendly barkeeps.
author: Madhusudhan R.

description:
Great place for date night! Large wine and beer selection, and delicious food!
I'm a sucker for chicken pot pie, so I knew I had to order it.

The pot pie filling was probably the best pot pie filling I've ever had. Super savory without being too salty. It was amazing! I wasn't a huge fan of the puff pastry crust, but it was still good.

The sliders were good too. Will be back!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Boyfriend and I came here on St. Patty's for dinner. Supposedly was going to meet up with friends, but they all kinda flaked out last min. So ended up being a date night for us two. No complains necessarily. :)

Fat Angel is a pretty tiny place, but we got seated pretty fast once we confirmed that it was just going to be the two of us. We sat next to the window side by side where we can do people watching. 

We ordered:

Sliders - yummy!
Mac&Cheese- pretty good.
Honey butter w/ bread- nom!
Meat & cheese- pretty good. Bf seemed to liked it. 
2 different dessert wines were pretty strong.

Overall it was pretty good. Service was pretty friendly & fast.  There was an odd thing that happened right before we left. This dude came up to us wanting a napkin. Then we see him giving to another dude outside. Pretty weird.
author: Amy C.

description:
Amazing waitress, she easily made my dining experience pleasant. The atmosphere was nice. I sat outside on a beautiful night. 

They were out of the first two drinks I tried to order. Their homemade potpie was decent. They have fantastic beer options. I really liked the 13.5% alc "What about them apples" honey cider, it was strong and smooth, and unlike any cider I've ever had.

The strongly recommended maple-bacon butter kinda grossed me out and made me queasy. They kindly swapped it out for their garlic chili butter with fresh bread for me (as they did not have regular butter available believe it or not). I again thought it was kinda gross, but nibbled a bit at it out of politeness, and of course paid for it. These cubes of flavored butter reminded me a bit of bouillon cubes with a pasty texture. Maybe it's just me. But all-in-all, I'd come back again.
author: Andrew G.

description: Wine was great! The waitress seemed knowledgable about their products. We also had food here as well. It was good but I wouldn't say that it was amazing. If you're looking for a fun place with wonderful wine and some apps this is your place!
author: Megan L.

description:
Pleasantly surprised. Seriously. Sausage flat-bread was really, really tasty. Granted I was famished, but that's neither here nor there. Crust was thin, yet spongy enough to provide a good mouth-feel. Toppings were excellente.

Beer selection had some stuff I don't normally see. YMMV. I'm not really into wine, but everyone else seemed to be. That's gotta count for something, right?

We ended up sitting outside which was good for people watching. It can get pretty loud inside, though. Just a fair warning.

Yes, yes, I'll go back. And I'll tell all my friends. Even write to my congressperson and so on. But don't take MY word for it!
author: Aren A.

description:
First of all - Fat Angel is in the Stones Throw / Trestle restaurant fam, so of course, it deserves a visit. My first time at Fat Angel was delightful. My boyfriend and I got seated in one of the corner tables and each had a glass. The setting was romantic with soft music and amazing service. Since Fat Angel is about a 30 second walk from my apartment, I was happy to find a bar that could become go-to.

My second time at Fat Angel (the reason for -1 star) was not quite as amazing. Service definitely needs work. The waitress we sat my party of 4 was rude, condescending and slow. As a sucker for customer service, I'm almost tempted to deduct 2 stars... 

The wine & beer selection is great here. The wine are all great, but I wouldn't say it's unique to Fat Angel. Beer selection, also amazing - especially the Stouts. Have yet to try the cocktails - although I'm sure they're great based on my experience at Stones.
author: Gina T.

description: stopped in since we were early for a reservation near by. I was really impressed with the selection of beers. we were short on time so we just got a couple glasses of the pinot noir on draft but are already planning on coming back to sample the brews
author: Melissa R.

description:
Fat Angel is in the Stones Throw Restaurant group so I was expecting something wonderful from the Fat Angel.  Instead I got something that was a disappointment.   

Their menu would suggest that you are going to get well-prepared comfort food at a comfortable price.  That wasn't the case for me.

The smoke trout salad came in an immense bowl and the trout was good.  However, the greens and especially the horseradish vinaigrette was too much of an OK thing that seemed designed to encourage, even force you to drink copiously.  The salad was also a bit one dimensional as once you got past the trout there was just greens, greens, greens.   Some cherry tomatoes or carrots, something, anything, would have helped.

The chicken pot pie was a huge disappointment.  Between two layers of crust was a gloppy filling that contained almost no chicken.  Just some carrots and whatever they used to thicken the filling.  

Service was extraordinary.  The two young ladies attending the bar and tables were stretched to the limit as the room was quite full, yet they did their job with aplomb.  Bravo to the servers.  Without them this would have been a one star review.
author: David D.

description: Best bar in the city. Huge beer selection, and excellent salads. Ask for Eleanor; she is the queen of our hearts.
author: Meg W.

description:
Praise the Lord, hallelujah!

I haven't gone to church in a long time, but I sing praises when it is warranted. Fat Angel makes me sing from the heart.

This sweet, angelic spot exudes upscale lodge with a casual chic feel: marble bar, pew style booth seating and a handsome wall holding some crafted brews and carefully chosen vino. Don't mind the imposing Moosehead hanging above, Rocky and Bullwinkle totally approve.

Fat Angel seamlessly blends fantastic wine bar food with excellent tipples. The menu is 90% alcohol (as it should be!) beers are arranged according to your taste: light, crisp, heavy, dark. Same for the wines and for those who aren't feeling both, they offer several aperitifs as well. 

It felt a little stuffy inside because of the rain, otherwise, I can imagine sitting here for hours on a warm SF night with the bay windows wide open. A crisp and zesty Picpoul was affordably priced at $8/glass.  My gf loves Riesling and this one from Kabinett is a richer style with sweetness in the end.  Of course, you can't go wrong with a Hefeweizen (Ayinger) or a dark stout like Double Chocolate Stout from England or a breakfast stout from Mikeller Bar (the Danes KNOW beer!)

All this imbibing made us hungry: we devoured an excellent meat board with speck, salami and duck terrine. On the board were also FLAVORED BUTTERS like maple bacon and Philz coffee. You wouldn't be able to resist spreading these on toast! The flatbread pizzas are pleasingly light, even with rich toppings such as gorgonzola, prosciutto and grapes on it. The chicken pot pie had a really flaky crust, but I didn't taste anything special about the tarragon cream sauce. 

Hark the herald angels sing and glory to ... the genius who brought Fat Angel to San Francisco. Let's say Amen to that!
author: Janice C.

description:
Off the beaten path in western addition, you have Fat Angel.

Small & charming, it's a great neighborhood spot for a quick meal & some vino.  Perfect for a date or a quiet night out w your peeps.

Props for the cheese plate.  It was generous & included nuts & honey.  

I've gone in early.  And I've gone in late.  When I went in early, it went from nearly empty to completely full in seemingly no time at all.  It was totally tame when I went in towards the end of the night, though.  FYI.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
This place is awesome. 

Extensive beer list (100+ super local beers) - check
Friendly elk greeting from the wall - check
(optional) Christmas tree with Polaroid pictures of the patrons - check

The super friendly gals working at the bar will seat you quickly in this intimite but yet lively place. You might be surprised that the beer/wine selection takes about 90% of the menu but this is a wine bar after all. However, also come here for the food as it's delicious!

The FLATBREAD PIZZA comes in various styles (Firebrand sourdough baguette and whole grain mustard with chorizo, duck salami, genoa, pheasant terrine, speck, or soppressata, $5-$28) and is worth every penny - most delicious topped sourdough I've had in a while, and super crispy.

The SOURDOUGH & BUTTER ($5) satisfies in a special kinda way - have you tried Philz Cofffee butter or Maple Bacon butter? I bet you haven't. Go order.

Finally, the CHICKEN POT PIE (roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon, $13) was creamy and had a sweet hint to it. Marvelous.

Fat Angel - a pleasant surprise in the lower Fillmore area. Stay where you are, angel. I'll be back.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Awesome service. Our server was very kind and on top of it. I don't know her name but I want her to get recognition- tall, short hair, tatted, lefty. Super nice!

Chicken pot pie & fish salad was tasty! 

The female bartender was very nice as well. 

Old school GOOD music! 

Will def be back!!
author: Tina H.

description:
Holy smokes, the food here is SO darn delicious. Best chicken pot pie and flatbread I've ever had. Also, be sure to order some sweet wines toward the end of your dinner!

The only reason why I'm giving this place a 4-star is because it can get incredibly loud toward dinner time / after work. I had to literally yell across the table to tell my friend a story. In a way, it's a good thing because EVERYONE is there to chat and you won't have any awkward silences. It gets super busy around the bar as well. I would recommend getting a seat early if you can!
author: Jenny H.

description:
Very cute place. Great for date night. I've been a few times. Weekends are pretty busy, I recommend week nights. 

Cheese and meat boards are super fun. (Kind of build your own type of deal)

Chicken pot pie is comforting and hearty.
Sliders are tasty and satisfying. 

Beer list is never ending, wine on tap a plus.

Check it out!
author: Rachel T.

description:
We came here directly after a matinee showing at the Kabuki in Japantown, right as the pub was opening so we had our pick of seats and it wasn't crowded at all (so a good time to show up is right at 4pm). With a wide range of beer, cider and cocktails to choose from, plus small plates of all sorts, we were quite overwhelmed with what to choose from. We settled on a range of beers and cocktails and splurged on the sausage flatbread, the pretzel with cheese sauce, and the spicy mac & cheese.

Suffice to say, the food was absolutely delicious and we came out pretty full and tipsy. 

A few observations to make note of: 
* watch the prices on the drinks. There's a wide range of beers and ciders that go from an easy $9 to well over $20 due to sizes and alcohol percent and it's easy to not notice.
* spicy mac&cheese isn't really spicy. I'm super sensitive to heat and yeah... this was not spicy at all. 
* if you're careful on the drink costs, it's actually really decently priced overall (came to about $60 for the two of us and that was with two drinks apiece).

We'd definitely be happy to return for more samplings of food and drinks.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
We ordered take out so that definitely had an effect in that the pot pie wasn't as hot, right out of the oven. 

That being recognized, the chicken pot pie was decent but I've had much better in other places (not in SF). 

The salad was Fresh and crisp
author: Ron M.

description:
We came here on a Saturday night about 6pm and it was still about a half hour wait to seat five of us. It's a much smaller restaurant (seats maybe 30 people) and has an intimate vibe. We saw quite a few dates while we were there. Aside from the restaurant, there is also a bar located at the front if you just want to stop by for a drink or two.

Food (5/5) To be completely honest, the sausage, tomato, and arugula flatbread that I ordered was probably one of the best flatbread that I have ever tasted. It had a thin crust and was topped with delicious spicy sausage. I should also mention that the flatbread is a very generous portion and I was able to take half of it home for tomorrow's breakfast (SCORE!). My friends also really loved the sliders, chicken pot pie, and mac and cheese.

Drinks (4/5) The drink menu is quite large, but I was surprised that it cost me $13 for a 12oz bottled beer...I mean I love me some good beer but that is a hefty price for something I can buy in the store.

Overall I'd say the food was awesome and the beer was great. They've got wine, beer, and something for everyone.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Crowded bar/restaurant close to Fillmore/Japantown

With the dim red heat lamps outside the entrance, the place always looked like a party spot whenever I stop by. When I finally had a chance to visit, it turns out the decor inside is quite interesting as well, with a wood/nature/animal theme. There is a large selection of beer, wine, and cocktails--the tall poppy I got was definitely nice, with a distinct flavor that I haven't tasted before.

The food items are also equally satisfying, though not cheap--the cheese blocks and the salami items are savory, and aromatic. Also, everyone pretty much orders the mac&cheese, which is cooked just right with a crusty layer of cheese near the center of the plate. mmmmm

The price is definitely on the mid-to-high range, so be aware before stepping in.

Overall, a pretty good place to visit once in a while with friends
author: Henry L.

description: Amazing beer list full of weird, funky, and wonderful brews from around the world. Bar staff is incredibly knowledgeable and if you have any questions about a particular style or a specific brew, or just need some recommendations on what to try they are more than happy to break things down for you. Great little patio area, too, though the bar is where you want to be. Good selection of California and international wines with a broad choice of styles to choose from. Food is fantastic, too, which will make things difficult for you if you happen to find yourself over here while waiting for your table at State Bird Provisions.
author: Owen P.

description: We had an amazing time tonight before our show at The Fillmore. We ordered a half bottle of the Malbec (so delicious) with a meat/cheese plate (Brie was incredible, and I'm still thinking about the mustard on the plate!) and spicy Mac and cheese - it was the perfect meal. Couldn't have asked for better service. Logan treated us so well, is the main reason we give this rating 5 stars,  and also why we will 100% be coming back for another date night aoon!
author: Katie H.

description:
Okay, this is my 4th meal of that crazy Sunday. I am pretty positive that I wasn't even hungry until I walked into this restaurant..
The lighting was pretty dim. The waitress was very patient regarding all of the questions about beer my friends threw at her. 
We had their signature chicken pot pie.. Have to say even better than my grandma's!! (I know!! Ouch!! Sorry granny!!!) the puff pastry was buttery and crusty!! The filling has thick and flavorful. (Somehow I felt the potatoes were a bit undercooked..hmm..) 
And the kale truffle flatbread was phenomenal, maybe I have bias on anything truffle..@.@.. 
Smoked trout salad is another item I enjoyed a lot. The horseradish vinaigrette was light, but the salad was tossed so well, every single bite will pick up all the flavors. 
And their Mac n Cheese.. Hmmmm... Spicy!! I am not a fan of Mac n cheese.. But couldn't help having couple of scoops here!!

Love this place! Recommend!!
author: Yann M.

description:
I love to wine and dine with Fat Angel!  

Their flatbread pizza with gorgonzola, walnut, prosciutto and topped with roasted grapes, is deliciously amazing!  Pair it with their grand selections of fine wine, such as their Manto Negro/Callet from Spain, which had hints of cocoa, toffee and cherry blend, then the meal would be splendidly perfect to the palate!  

Their freshly baked Chicken Pot Pie that is served piping hot from the oven, is surely homely and that crisp and flaky crust, is comfort to the soul!

They serve up beer as well, just in case you prefer not to dine over wine! 

I simply can't ask for better company to pair a meal and wine over with, than with Fat Angel!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Super cute joint. Such friendly service. 5 Star digs for sure. It's a must visit spot.
author: Alexandra R.

description:
OH MY GOD. THE CHICKEN POT PIE! THE BEST CHICKEN POT PIE OF EVERYONES LIFE. 

Get the pot pie. I know they had a really great beer list but nothing matters besides the chicken pot pie!
author: Sarah D.

description: I have to admit I'm not a beer drinker but Fat Angel has converted me. I had A Golden State of Mind on tap with my dinner then a chocolate beer with dessert. Both beers were smooth and perfect with the food. My friend and I shared a kale salad and the chicken pot pie. We had chocolate cake for dessert. The atmosphere and service were real easy and enjoyable.
author: Amy D.

description: It hurts to do this, because I love their chicken pot pie, but I feel as if I must... I ordered from here last Thursday and found a large bug crawling underneath my pizza. Damn shame because I really liked this place :(.
author: Blake V.

description:
I figured I should write a more comprehensive review for fat angel considering it's one if my favorite spots. This place is what a gastro pub should be. Great beer and wine selection and delicious consistent food. It is quite small and very popular.  The combination of small and popular is actually the major drawback of the place.  They do not take reservations so wait times can be upwards of 1-2 hours at times if you want a table for dinner.  You can put your name on a list and they will text you when a table becomes available, but this system may not be ideal for some. Also considering that some people order food and then sit at tables for hours drinking after dinner makes it difficult for the staff to accurately predict wait times.  Also since they have outdoor seating, weather becomes a variable in that on nice days their seating capacity almost doubles.  

The staff is always very friendly and do their best to accommodate given the limitations listed above.  They are understandably in a tricky situation and there is no great way to make everyone happy!  

When you walk in there is a chalkboard that lists the beer and wine on tap. This is an ever changing selection which is great. Occasionally they run out of beers and the selection of tap beer can be limited. They make up for this with a huge selection of bottled beers listed by type in their menu. 

Just about everything on the food menu is awesome. My favorites are the maple bacon butter, kale salad with chicken, all of the flat breads, and the sliders. These all seem to pair perfectly with the beer.
author: Paul W.

description:
Friendly staff +
Food +
Ambiance +
Beer selection + 
What a happy accidental find! I googled "SF Mac and cheese" after a disappointing Mac and cheese experience around the corner. Once you have a Mac and cheese craving, it's hard to stifle without satisfaction! Fat Angel popped up in an article listing where you find the best Mac and cheese in SF. They were not wrong!!! Omg! 

Not to mention the friendly staff and amazing beer selection will have me coming back here often now that I've found it.
author: Trisha D.

description: I have come here several times. There's always good beer on tap, and the flatbreads are great! Mac and cheese is good too! Come for the happy hour special and save big on flatbreads!
author: Adam W.

description:
Came in on a Friday night around 8:30 and had to wait about 30 min for a spot. They'll take your phone number and text you when it's ready so you don't have to physically be there. 

We ended up getting seated at the bar, which was fine. But it took about 20 min until someone acknowledged us (only about 3 ladies were working). We were able to sample some of the wines before we decided on what glass to take. The server was super friendly and knowledgable. I noticed it's the same price to drink wines by the glass versus buying a bottle, so it allows you to try multiple kinds! And the pours are generous! 

For food we ordered the wild mushroom flatbread with truffle oil and a salad and added rotisserie chicken for $3. 

The endive salad was a hefty portion! I do wish there was a bit more chicken throughout, but it was tender and flavorful. I enjoyed that it wasn't overly done, but bf found it to be too sweet for his tastes. 

The flatbread was delicious as well! Almost a cracker crust with bits of pecorino cheese. 

Prices are a tad bit high for what you get, but I think you're paying more for the location and vibe.
author: Noelle H.

description: Just received an order delivered to my home via Caviar.  The flatbread pizza and Cesar salad was one of the best I've ever had from ANY restaurant in SF.  I would highly recommend. And definitely look forward to my next order.
author: Pamela K.

description:
Ate here before a show at the Filmore, which is right around the block. Line out the door was a bit intimidating but moved faster than we expected. The wait to be seated inside was really long so we opted to order at the bar and grab a table outside. The bar area inside was super packed but had full menu service, although I think it was just full of people waiting for their table. 

Beer selection is insane, overwhelming even. The food was bomb! The menu is pretty small, not a ton of options but almost everything on it looked good. I had a delicata squash flatbread that was amazing and my friend had the spicy Mac and cheese. Definitely on the pricey side but it's SF. I would check this place out again if I'm over in that area!
author: Lauren L.

description:
So excited that I got to make an excuse to go out to the Filmore to explore! We ended up at Fat Angel because of the great reviews and their interesting menu.

This place is pretty small and I don't know what the crowds are like on the weekends, but on a Monday night there was still a wait around 8PM.  

I started out with the local cider from San Bruno. It was a typical, crisp cider but for some reason it was really really good! Definitely recommend it if you like ciders! 

For food, we got the pretzel to start. The cheese and mustard dipping sauces that came out with the pretzel were amazing; I wish I could get some to take home! The pretzel was served warm and it was a great starter to pair with our drinks. For the main courses, we got the asparagus flatbread and the spicy mac n cheese. Both were pretty good! The asparagus was very fresh and the kalamata olives added a nice tangy touch to the flatbread. The mac n cheese was a little spicy so beware! But it was still very creamy and delicious :) 

I want to come back again for happy hour to explore their tremendous drinks menu and maybe try some of their cheese plates!
author: Malika R.

description:
Delicious and elegant hole in the wall in the Fillmore area...great place to order a few small plates and kick back with some glasses of wine.  That's exactly what we did.

We splurged on the mac n cheese and chicken pot pie and it was well worth it.  Both dishes were made uniquely with delicious flavors.  Can't go to a wine bar without a meat and cheese plate!  I can't recall exactly which cheeses we chose but I know I had a delicious blue in there.  Yum.  

Pick up a couple of glasses of wine and you're good to go.  Cute little place with great food...4 stars.
author: Jen W.

description:
This place is located right across the street from a friends apartment, so he recommended us to go here! It was a Saturday night around 10ish when we got there. Inside was still relatively crowded but we were still able to get seating after a short wait.

We ordered the spicy Mac & cheese ($13) which was just as good as all the other Yelpers claimed! (Yay I'm joining the bandwagon) I do think it's a bit pricey, the plate is rather small but it is pretty dense so it will fill you up especially if you're not sharing. The sliders ($13) were also really good!! Definitely recommend that. We also got a cheese plate..it's served with bread and jelly. 

For drinks, I can only speak for myself. I got the Sauvignon blanc (2013) and it tasted like crap. I couldn't finish it :( and I hate wasting alcohol.

The ambience of this place is casual! Kinda dark inside. The decorations are cool. The bathroom is nice and clean too!! There's even decorations inside. This is a plus for me, somebody who has a small bladder and spends much of their time running to the bathroom. :)

Overall great experience, just pricey. $80+ for 3 people.
author: Emily C.

description:
This was a decent place to meet up for drinks.  They have a pretty small space, maybe 8 tables or so and about 10 seats at the bar.  I got there around 7 and the wait was about 20 minutes for dinner.  They had a few tables outside so we grabbed beers and sat down until our table was ready.  You also have the option of exploring the neighboring stores and bars since you get a text letting you know when your table is ready.
Once seated, we ordered a few of the items that were recommended by other reviewers - the maple bacon butter, spicy sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie.  I would say the flatbread was my favorite, it had a good combination of ingredients.  Unfortunately, the chicken pot pie had some flavor in there that tasted cherry-like which I didn't really appreciate that permeated the whole dish.  And the butter was interesting but it is served rock hard and they give it to you with cold bread, so it's not very easy to spread.  I'm not sure I'd order it again.
Overall, I'd say that if I were to come back, it would probably be just for drinks.
author: Gloria N.

description: Really cozy bar/restaurant with an awesome and knowledgeable staff. Great bar food that is unique and unpretentious. Great for a date or catch up with friends.
author: Roman H.

description: Bad service the waitress had an attitude and asked me to chill because I was ready to order and when we decided just to have a glass of wine she came by a second time and made another sarcastic comment  "oh you don't want anything because you seemed overly excited " and walked away I would  avoid this place if you want good service
author: C D.

description: Great beer and wine selection, and very good albeit menu.  Friendly staff with good waitlist management system.  But the wait can be very long.
author: D.J. M.

description:
What a neighborhood gem. Like a good Yelper, I observed from Yelp friends' check-ins that Fat Angel was/is the place to go. I've walked by it many times especially on Saturdays when the Fillmore Farmers' Market takes place. Now I know what all the rage is about. It's low key, the food is good, and the patrons are locals. Not that this place needs another glowing review (as there are many already), but here are my two cents.

I walked in promptly at 7 on Sunday night to join some friends for dinner. They've been here before and agreed to my recommendation. Clearly, they were also happy former patrons. One of my friends noted their wine selection is among the best, and I saw that as well. They have an extensive wine menu... but I wasn't there for wine. I was there for other libations. So, I ordered the Pimm's Cup: lemonade, Pimms #1, and cava. This came with plenty of ice (which I personally enjoy). Very refreshing, and had just enough bite and alcoholic "zing!" for a Sunday evening. 

We decided to share a charcuterie platter which was, no doubt, a fantastic idea. The prime selection of meats and cheeses came with spiced and candied nuts, various jams, and mustard. Loved it. Oh, and duh! It came with copious amounts of bread. How could I forget THAT?! 

We also shared the endive, apple, candied walnuts, and gorgonzola salad with roasted chicken shreds (+$3). This was a delicious and heaping amount of greens and fruit, and very much needed with all the meats and cheeses we were consuming! And well, did I mention we needed salad to also balance the very decadent mac & cheese? That mac & cheese: I want to just lift that hot plate and put it right onto my face. It consisted of three cheeses: gruyere, cheddar, and parmigiano-reggiano. The bread crumbs on top and the spice of cayenne pepper really made this mac & cheese distinctive from others. Granted, I've had bread crumbs on mac & cheese before, but this was toasted to perfection and the spice cut through the creamy richness of the dish. 

The service: solid. The servers were friendly and quite personable. While my friends and I were very much engaged in deep conversations (at one point we were talking about economics... I mean, who does that on a Sunday night?... [We do.]), I noticed how efficient and attentive the service was. I'm glad I was able to experience a meal at Fat Angel. I intend to come back for dinner or perhaps a casual drink on their petite patio out front. Give this spot a try. It's heavenly! (Womp. Womp.)
author: James Z.

description:
Small place with a long wait but generally worth it.  Terrific food, decent beer selection, and friendly service; that's a nice trifecta.

While we waited for our table (about 40 mins), we tried their charcuterie plate with a nice assortment of cheeses.  It staved off our hunger well and paired well with the dark Belgian beers we were trying.

When we finally sat down, we were still ravenous and the four of us ordered almost everything on the menu:

1) Flatbread with roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola - epic, still can remember the savory flavor
2) Flatbread with tomato, spicy sausage & arugula w/ parmesan - equally epic, the flavors came together so well
3) Mac n' Cheese with gruyère, cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, cayenne - spicy, creamy goodness. Yum.
4) Chicken pot pie with roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon - solid, hearty pot pie.  No complaints. 
5) Sliders with beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli - only misfire of the whole meal, meat was dry and not really flavorful and the trimmings didn't make up for it.  

Overall, really impressed.  If only they had more tables!
author: Saminda W.

description:
Don't do the fried capers.

Marinate in the olives. They're amazing.

Go for the flatbread. Gorgonzola, grapes, walnuts.

Say yes to the mac and cheese, blessed with spice  action. So. Damn. Good:)!
author: Gabriela W.

description:
What a great experience.
From the moment we walked in, the service, the food, it was all on point.
One of the best meals I have had out in a while. We split everything and it was perfect.
:: fried capers - crispy, salty bites
:: spiced nuts - sweet and delicious
:: smoked trout salad - the best I've ever had and huge. The purple potatoes are a show stopper popping out on the sides of the wooden bowl it's served in.
::  asparagus, kalamata olive, pine nut and mascarpone flat bread. So good. Not heavy on the bread or the cheese. Every bite was a delight.

I'm not in this neighborhood often...but when I am...I'm eating at Fat Angel.
author: Katie S.

description:
I used to have a recurring dream that I owned a restaurant in Moscow that was interior decorated like a hunting lodge. Every night I was shaken down by mafia-governement workers, threatening to revoke my health permit unless I give them a cut of my profits. It was a beautiful place, very dark with a brown and mahogany color scheme. This was before the whole lodge thing was en vogue. I'd like to think that my dreamscape is ahead of the times.

Fat Angel kind of looks like the place in my dreams, but it's lighter, better decorated, and just cooler, without being too cool. There are animals overhead, a pipe organ, a beautiful bar, and, in contrast to my dingy and dreary nightmare, it's light filled and sunny-even if the streets are shrouded in fog. 

I could see myself here on the regular. Wine on tap-in particular a robust Pinot. There are beers for people who speak of Trappist monks and hidden abbeys-special brews from round the world of which I know nothing, but whose stories are told by the lips of those who know. The food is warm, and stands alone from the libations. When a patron ordered a bread pudding, the whole place smelled wonderful. I like places that are small enough that you are attune to what others are enjoying. Fat Angel passes that test. Everyone was piqued by this warm and fragrant dessert, which evoked as many memories as that damn Proustian madeline. Warm and spiced apples can always tap into your past.

There will be no shake downs at Fat Angel. The people here are truly lovely.
author: Joanna M.

description:
Our group stumbled in hungry and wanting more drink. Fat Angel delivered on both fronts. 

We ate the spicy mac n' cheese, tried the maple bacon & lemon sage butters, and ate a prosciutto fig flatbread. Everything was unique, mind-blowingly good, and something I couldn't make in my own kitchen in a million years. The variety of beers is also impressive, but what I loved about Fat Angel and what elevated it to 5 stars for me, was that they also offered a $3 can of Hamm's. Because sometimes you just want some Hamm's with your boojie flatbreads. 

A gem in Japantown for sure, check this place out right away.
author: Andres B.

description:
Walking in with my 3 girlfriends we were immediately given exceptional service.  2 people served us and were really friendly.  I regret not getting their names.  But they were so nice and attentive and tried to be as helpful as possible!

Looking at the menu, I was amused that 90% of the items were alcoholic beverages.  I came for the food...which can be found on the last page, hehe.

So here's what my girlfriends and I shared:

FLATBREAD - $13 ($2 off during Happy Hour)
Tomatoes, basil, spicy sausage, & arugula w/ ricotta
Although simple, this was amazing.  I love the subtle spice of the sausage, the thin crispyness of the crust (which was not at all greasy), and the arugula that paried so well along with the ricotta.  All the ingredients was just the right amount and this plate was a great one for sharing.  I loved it!

MAC 'N CHEESE - $11
Gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano
I came here for this dish right here.  I"m happy that it was so spicey like many people thought.  If anything I tasted no spice which was fine.  I loved how the top layer was crispy...and yes this dish was quite greacy...but hey its why I love mac n cheese!  Be careful though, it comes out SUPER hot!  This ooey-gooey cheesy dish was a fave!


F.A.'S CHICKEN POT PIE - $12
Roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon 
I was quite impressed with this one mainly because it didn't look like a pie.  It looked like there was a thick flakey buttery thing of pastry on top and beneath the filling.  Otherwise the filling was out in the open so you see exactly what you're getting.  Just your standard chicken pot pie filling but what made it unique was the "crust".  Yum!

3 SLIDERS - $10
Beef, caramelized onions, bacon, Irish cheddar, aioli
Oh so tasty!  Simple but I appreciate it not being dry.  I love the little pickled peppers it came with...it compliments it SO well.  I felt the aioli tasted like ranch dressing..but its not a complaint.  I enjoyed it.  

Its unfortunate I didn't try any drinks since I feel its their main thing...but I'm happy to have tried their food because it was amazing.
