Parking was fairly easy for me (I came around 5:45pm and stayed until 6pm since its free after that).  The restaurant itself is quite small, intimate, but not jam packed.  It does become a full house and I felt we got lucky finding an empty table immediately.  Great food, great company, and exceptional service...whats there to complain?
author: Tu-Anh N.

description: Menu was 7 pages of beer, wine, and booze options and 1 page of food options. But you don't need choices when all the food on the menu is amazingly delicious. Covers all the bases and is fun.
author: Briana C.

description:
This place is awesome.  The Mac and cheese, sliders, and pot pie are amazing. The atmosphere is great. The selection of beer is dizzying ( there's five pages front
and back, just for the beer menu). The staff is extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Jessica behind the bar is great!! Definitely coming back
author: Chris A.

description:
This is a gastropub, so there are certain things you expect.

1. Decor that is en pointe, but odd/industrial enough to seem edgy.  Doll arm coat hangers = check!

2. Food that is basic but flavorful, and with enough twist to (again) seem edgy.  French bread with flavored butter (maple bacon, Philz coffee, etc) = check!

3. Delicious hand crafted cocktails served at higher prices than the size/effort warrants.  Pimm's Cup = check!

4. Waiting for a table, even at a seemingly non-traditional time.  45 minute wait = check!  At least they text you when your table is ready so you can either enjoy their bar (more Pimm's, please!) or walk around the area and view other establishments.

This was a great place.  The food isn't hugely filling for the price point, but you can order lots, feel rich, and semi-full.  A great evening all around.
author: Jes G.

description:
A quick review of what we ordered:
Fried capers love them
Garlic chili butter
Maple bacon butter not quite sweet enough but ample amounts of bacon
Meat dish with caprese, duck salami, and duck liver pate with mustard
Spicy Mac n cheese not so spicy
Chicken pot pie really good. Not too salty but perfect blend of creamy and quality ingredients
Not heaping but very filling
Large selection of drinks
Old stockale hoppy strong flavor lingers on the palate
Sparkling mead strong oaky flavor not too sweet but compliments the food well

Would return. Good for date night.
author: Randell J.

description:
I love, love, love Fat Angel. It is a hidden (or not so hidden) gem of San Francisco. It is right off of Fillmore, it is a great spot if you are in the neighborhood. I've been going for about four years, and every time I go I find another great menu item. Mind you the menu is only one page (we aren't talking Cheesecake Factory selections) so hard to believe that I haven't tried it all. But on my last visit I discovered the Chicken Pot Pie. Divine! It may have been my first time trying it, but it certainly won't be my last. It is an open bowl of Chicken, carrots, peas, potatoes and the perfect amount of gravy and spices with a nice layer of buttery, flakey crust on the bottom and backed to perfection on the top. Man, I want to go back today just to try it again. It is almost sweet (in a good way) so I do recommend sprinkling with salt and pepper. 

They always have a kick bootie beer selection. And definitely keep them on the radar during sf beer week. Every evening they have a different delicious offering. I sampled five great Paradox beers and on another night 5 Bruery beers poured from bottles. (They had fifteen hard to find beers to choose from, so I had to narrow it down to one sample of five.)

Our fall back food options have always been the bread with flavored butters. The most recent flavors were Bernaise, Chive, Chili, Maple Bacon and Molasses. You can try one for $5.50, three for $15 or all five for I think $25. That is a lot of butter, but I did feel compelled to try them all once and take home the left overs. This last time the Bernaise butter was my favorite. Delish.

We also love their flatbreads, toppings change seasonally. Most recently we tried the butternut squash and kale. Perfect!

And the mac n cheese, is great. Has a tangy hardier taste with the perfect amount of sauce to crunch ratio.

Sometimes the prices can get a little steep if you don't pay attention when ordering, you think it may be a quick bite of food and a beer from your local gastropub, and next thing you know your tab is $90. But you can't blame them for having too many awesome things to order! 

I would like to have cold ice water, luke warm water is the worst. And a few veggie sides and sweet options. But this place is a great go to spot.
author: Victoria O.

description: Great selection of beers and wine, some unique and high end ones, and the food was amazing. We had chicken pot pie and asparagus flatbread with beer and wine. Both were so fresh and well flavored that I still thought about them for a few days. Could get crowded in the evening, but worth waiting for a bit and coming back.
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
Sure, their website leaves much to be desired but this place was such a treat! Tons and tons of beers on tap and their food, though the menu wasn't any thing out of the ordinary, was fantastic.

Fat Angel is quite a small venue so I wouldn't plan on bringing more than 1 or 2 other people if you want to be comfortable. Though its small, there are generally only 2-3 people working during dining service. The servers are super friendly, but it can take a moment to get things done. I would definitely order everything at once.

The sliders were really good. The meat is flattened so it comes off as a white castle slider but of San Francisco caliber, of course.

That tomato spicy sausage flatbread put a huge smile on my face.

And that maple bacon butter put a smile in my heart.

Would recommend, would return!
author: Peter T.

description:
We ate here last night, after finding it on Yelp. 
They have an extraordinary menu of beer and wine. We had the pretzel and cheese to start. Followed by the chicken pot pie and spicy Mac and cheese. 
The food was good!
The service was a bit slow from beginning to end. We had to ask for a box and check after waiting a really long time!! I was surprised as its a pretty small restaurant and figured they'd want us to scoot out (people were waiting and they don't take reservations).
After  a night of drinking (we're on holiday) it was perfect comfort food. Would happily recommend.
author: Leanne E.

description:
August 4, 2014

Wonderful little place with an exciting menu to go along with a really good selection of craft beers and wine on tap. We were looking for a light meal and started with an order of the Sweet and Spicy Chinese Nuts. Then we ordered 3 sides of BUTTER! That's right, Fat Angel has flavored butters with endless bread. We had the Maple Bacon, Honey and Lemon Caper Sage butters. Amazingly good! We then proceeded to order their Mac & Cheese and Sliders. Everything was quite good.
author: Dave W.

description:
Stopped by here for some quick drinks before a concert at the Fillmore.

Didn't eat anything here, but loved the organic and fairytale-feel of the atmosphere! Ambiance was magical with their candlelight lighting and delicious aromas from the kitchen.

The spot is quite small with a narrow bar section and closely-arranged tables for diners. This would be a perfect spot for date night or a toned-down girls night with friends. 

I do want to give a HUGE 5 stars to the bartender and (seemingly) host who's name is Derek. He's an absolute top-notch bartender here focused on providing high-quality service to ALL customers. He really helped me find the beer that I wanted by letting me taste beer after beer on their tap list--props to you good sir! I also work in the hospitality industry, so I KNOW A GREAT BARTENDER/SERVER when I interact with one.

I'd love to come here for the food next time, and considering the incredible service my friends and I had with Derek, there will be a round 2.
author: Jodi H.

description:
I have decided to do a small update to my review. Coming here again after a long time I was a bit worried that it wouldn't be the same. 
I didn't receive the same waiter as last time but had a girl named Stephanie who was equally amazing. The place was rather busy but she kept it a priority to check on us and keep a very happy and engaging attitude. Also something I like to take note of is that she poured a perfect beer for all three of my choice, I was impressed.
They also got a bit more fancy with their cheese and meat plate.

Coming here again set me at ease knowing i didn't need the same waiter to experience what I believe to be one of the best gastropubs around.  The choices are hands down the best and the service continues to amaze. Thank you once again for a great night.

(side note this place is like a hub for match.com dates...what's up with that.)

also still no update to a Gluten free beer but I can't blame them that much with the options being so depressing.
author: B H.

description: If you're craving beer, wine, and comfort food, look no further than Fat Angel. It will more than deliver on your expectations. My dining partner and I shared some Maple Bacon Butter. It was great; I definitely want to come back to try other flavors like Garlic Chili and Honey. We also got Sliders, a Basil Pesto Flatbread, and a Spicy Mac n' Cheese. This sounds completely unexciting, but everything we tried was really superb. Thanks for the great meal, Fat Angel!
author: Mark C.

description: Ah sweet Fat Angel you are delicious! We ordered really well and enjoyed the kale salad, spicy sausage flatbread, and mac n' cheese...all were winners and would easily order again. It is quite a small venue but it was fairly easy to get a seat and the service was great. I will be back!
author: Derek S.

description:
Cozy spot with a great draft beer list and wine on tap. They also sell "digestive" drinks, which are pretty neat. It's small, so be warned: If you are looking to eat, you may wait. If you are looking to drink, you may be cramped.

I haven't had the food, but this is certainly a good place to sip a beverage or two on your way out or your way back home.
author: Nick K.

description:
This place is cute with a good selection of wine on tap.
I thoroughly enjoyed their mac n cheese (we ordered 2).
Why only 3 stars? Slow slow slow service. It took us forever to get a table and forever to get the check settled. 
I say go for a drink but leave it at that. (State Bird Provisions is right around the corner!)
author: Angela D.

description:
Tons of wonderful wine and beers on draught!

The trout salad with horseradish dressing is like no other. I could eat this every day.  The kale salad is also amazing.

Skip the spicy mac and cheese.  The heat comes from cayenne, but it ends us tasting like tabasco sauce, which just isn't that interesting to me. 

There is wonderful outdoor seating in front with heat lamps and a view of the palm trees across the street.  So very California. 

I love this place and am quickly becoming a regular!
author: Jaching H.

description:
I aim for variety when it comes to food/drink, especially since our fair city lends itself well to culinary discovery. However, when it comes to establishments that do it well (and consistently), I am a creature of habit. 

Fat Angel does not have an extensive menu, but what they do have is a well-balanced selection of basics. The outlined food categories nicely fit one page... and it covers the necessities: Appetizers (Angel's Share), Cheese, Meat, Butter, Greens, Flatbread, Plates. The kale salad is unmatched - marcona almonds,  bacon, and the right touch of champagne dressing. No arguments about the chicken pot pie, as it is exactly how I envision a perfect savory pie to be (probably used a cup full of butter to have reached said perfection, but who's caring?). The spicy mac/cheese is pure bliss on a mini skillet. Still want more, you say? The Grape/Gorgonzola/Prosciutto flatbread is the way to go.

Are you judging my diet yet? Did you miss the part about me crushing on a salad? 

Oh the beers. Amazing beers on tap that rotate frequently based on season and featured microbrews. Some of the best variety offered in SF, but you end up liking one - drink up, as chances are that beer will be gone in 2 days and it may be while until they get another limited batch. They also have an excellent selection of bottled beers that covers a range of palates. Wine on tap more your groove? I've only tried the Sauvignon Blanc (Martella?) and Pinot Noir (Copain), both decent, but in a place like Fat Angel - with all the beer selections and so little time? Go for the brew. 

The staff knows their stuff. Friendly, fun, and - I'll emphasize this - patient. You in need of figuring out what kind to get, given the otherwise intimidating selection? Engage them in conversation, and they'll make several recommendations (armed with samples)... after which you complete your selection and indulge happily. Let this be a lesson to other establishments: It pays to have a crew who is knowledgeable and passionate about the very things the place stands for. Need I spell out why? Because they generate fans who, not only (willingly) shell out $XX regularly for food and drinks, but ones who give gratitude over a public space like Yelp - even at the risk of getting a longer wait for a table on a Friday night.
author: Cham M.

description:
Had my last meal here before I headed off to Taiwan!

My boyfriend, my mom and I arrived around 5 PM and we were the only ones there, which was nice because we had the undivided attention of the servers. We ordered the sausage flatbread, the endive salad and the smoked trout with greens. My mom also ordered a coffee which was freshly made, one cup at a time. It was delicious!

The food didn't take long to come out but at first we thought they had forgotten to give us the additional chicken we ordered for the endive salad. They didn't forget, they just brought it out later so no problem there. I really enjoyed the sausage flatbread because the bread was really thin and the arugula went really well with the sausage and tomato. I think I ate about half of it by myself lol. The endive salad was pretty good but I wouldn't recommend ordering the chicken as a side, because it was pretty dry. The trout on the other hand was very tasty, and the greens were delicious.

We didn't order any drinks (aside from the coffee), so I can't comment on that except for the fact that 75% of the menu encompassed libations which was interesting. It also can be a bit difficult to flag down your server once it gets busy; my mom needed another coffee and she had to go up to the bar to let them know.
author: Sam F.

description:
Now *this* is a gastropub... high-quality libations AND food. It's unassumingly cool yet cozy: there's something about their old-school chalkboard menus and fabulous chandeliers that speaks to me -- even that big ol' deer head mounted on the wall seems charming in this space. And the awesome service (Juliet is my fave there) is just the cherry on top.

The microbrews are awesome; the flatbreads are tasty; and the salads are HUGE. Outdoor seating is lovely during the warmer days, but the tiny little inside (especially the bar) is really a great place to sit and eat a bite, too. They've got a fabulous selection of wine (you gotta love a place that has wine on tap) if you're in a vino kinda mood, which very well might strike given the romantic atmosphere.

Overall, a great little spot to sit, sip, and simply enjoy. I'll be back!
author: Eunice E.

description: Have been here twice now and am a big fan. The first time my group and I enjoyed the cheese plate, Caesar salad and sausage flat bread. The servers are very knowledgeable- ours helped us choose wine and cheese. The second time we sampled the spicy mac 'n cheese and chicken pot pie. Both delicious but heavy and rich. Perfect for two of us to share- although we didn't quite finish either item. Will be back again and again!
author: Alyssa C.

description: Huge portions. I had 1/2 salad and I still couldn't finish it! Great beer selection and wine list (if not a little overwhelming). The flatbread pizzas looked really yummy. Cute place!
author: suzi p.

description: I had only the Spicy Mac and Cheese but can attest to its tastiness. The service was excellent: friendly, prompt, and knowledgable. My only complaint about Fat Angel is the noise level, which is ear-splitting once folks start drinking--and drinking is much of the appeal of this wine/beer bar.
author: Nanucktucktuc K.

description:
Besides the long wait and pack of people, definitely a great place to chill and have glorified bar food.

They have tons of beer and drink choices. The drafts are good and I love that they told you a little about it to see if you'd like it. The workers are definitely on it and friendly, which makes the waiting a little better. 

The chicken pot pie is delicioussssssss! The crispy cheese layer on top and the creamy chicken on bottom. So juicy and flavorful.

The truffle flat bread with sausage is definitely yummy but seriously no truffle taste. You guys run out or something??

Would def come back to try more of the menu. 

I left a little more fat. Thanks.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I really enjoyed having drinks & dinner at Fat Angel! I had been wanting to go for a while.

The neighborhood where it's located is lively, the decor cozy, the staff friendly (they make you feel like you're at home!) and the drinks menu is so long! There are so many kinds of beers and wines from different parts of the world. There's definitely a bit of everything of everyone!

I had the Pinot Gris from Oregon and really enjoyed it. My friends had red wines from pitchers and huge German beers they all liked.

Between 4 people, we shared a the spicy sausage flatbread (huge, like a squared pizza basically & definitely good for 4!), the spicy mac & cheese (best mac & cheese I've had in a while!), 2 big soft pretzels and a huge Kale salad. The salads are realllllly huge and impossible to eat by yourself even if you tried :-D I love greens, so I was happy!

I loved the atmosphere, we will be back!
author: Leslie S.

description:
My fiance and I have been here twice now, and as a self-proclaimed beer snob, he happens to think that Fat Angel has the best beer selection in San Francisco. I happen to agree. We had great experiences eating and drinking at Fat Angel and will definitely be returning often. Their space is curated perfectly, and even in the small space, they do have adequate seating. The staff is very friendly and they do a good job managing the bar/register/wait list. They have a great mix of indoor and outdoor seating, as well as a waiting area for people who haven't been seated yet. 

Their beer list is rare and extensive. Pages and pages of beer that is rare/hard to find, all at relatively good prices. They have an eclectic mix of beer and wine, and there's always something new and interesting to try on their draft board. 

Their food is spectacular. We've tried the pretzel, a bunch of their cheeses and meats, the baby kale salad, the mushroom flatbread, and the mac 'n' cheese. Their portions and large and everything tastes great. Their pretzel is one of my favorites in the city, and their kale salad rivals Darwin's, which is quite a feat. The only "meh" dish is the mac 'n' cheese; the sauce is kinda watery and the pasta could be more al dente. 

Fat Angel is a great date night spot, or just a place to grab a special beer. We love it here!
author: Regina L.

description:
Molasses brown sugar butter?  Yes, please.  Creamy, delicious spicy mac n cheese?  I really shouldn't, but hey, I can start my diet tomorrow... Sliders?  Well, only if they're good (and yes, they are!).  

In summary: truly satisfying comfort food!  Lengthy selection of beer (there's gotta be something for everyone in this drink menu). Friendly staff. Outdoor tables. Good times.
author: Riz W.

description:
Fabulous spot for an easy-going, but upscale dining experience. 
I didn't eat a meal here, although looking around, the food looked delicious and artistically plated.
I enjoyed a couple bottles of rose and a cheese board with a friend. 
We sat outside, gorgeous Friday late afternoon/evening sunset.
The service was friendly, fun and just the right amount of attention. 
The cheeses (we chose 6 different kinds) were great in variety, small sizes, but seemed just right, with 6 different jams and spicy, sweet nuts and bread.
The inside was classy, too. 
Really enjoyed this place.
author: Debbie C.

description: Fatty heaven. Bread and cheese and bread and cheese. Had a cheese board, mac and cheese (omg so good), romaine salad and 3 of the flavored butters. The mac and cheese is to DIE for. Didn't have any drinks but the menu looked great. Def wear your stretchy pants / muumuu.
author: Leila L.

description: Wife and I stopped by after a day in the city just for a glass of wine but stayed for dinner as this the Fat Angel was so warm and welcoming.  Service was attentive and helpful, bringing several tastes of wines before we committed without attitude or complaint.  We shared the cheese plate, smoked trout salad and chicken pot pie and everything was great.....try the Ptit Cab Sauvignon they have on tap - excellent !
author: Wylie T.

description:
Came here for my birthday and loved every second of my dining experience! 

Eleanor (I think that's her name), our server, was insightful about the menu and knew what wine paired well with each of their dishes. We got the Mac and Cheese, Chicken Pot Pie, and some red wine on tap which was a HUGE PLUS!
author: Kat M.

description:
Tuesday night, lookin' for a place to grab a bite to eat before our 7:30 show at Yoshi's. 

Enter: Fat Angel

They advertise on their signboards that they serve "comfort food," and based on what we ate that night, we can attest to it.

-The trout salad ($13, with fried capers and horseradish vinaigrette!) came in a ginormous bowl of greens--it had a smoky flavor, but not too overpowering.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=XZ_CcFthXlHWNsBuHMDA-A#XZ_CcFthXlHWNsBuHMDA-A
-And the spicy mac and cheese ($12)? Score. It had a kick to it, and made a nice addition to the salad
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=_8Kn54WNyVzDO16hkUhldQ#_8Kn54WNyVzDO16hkUhldQ

-Beers ($1 off for happy hour at 7p is a great plus!): http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/jr7SvnjeveE-xnq66ztvTA/l.jpg
the Rugbrod from the Brewery ($8.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?userid=CxWcGXtQSRJn6_C241xC9A#11IDrbb8j88xBG_L7Z6RRQ
the Moscow rye Russian imperial stout by Midnight Sun ($8): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?userid=CxWcGXtQSRJn6_C241xC9A#7hm0cVcqEhgBeRWl4J57CQ

The ambiance seemed like standard gastropub fare. The lights were turned down low (great for dates), but the tables felt too close to one another. I could've probably reached over to the folks next to us and copped some of their bread. 

Next time I'd look forward to tasting the flatbread, butters, and another couple of the great number of beers in their selection.
author: Angelica D.

description:
Even better than I remembered! The grape, gorgonzola, walnut, proscuitto flatbread is heaven on a wooden platter (made by a fat angel, of course!) A great match for my herbal beer from Mill Valley, or the draught Pinot Noir that followed. 

You could plop this place in Portland and no one would bat an eye. It's got that antiquey, hunter's lodge meets grandpa's library feel to it. And the music is always right on, sexy and soulful just like the wines. 

Our waitress was fantastic too! There is something really special about never having an empty glass, and she made this happen even with a full house to manage. Fat Angel to the rescue!
author: Nique F.

description: After drinking lots of red wine, eating charcuterie and rich cheese i could have just taken a nap right at the table. Loved the variety of butter to choose from to eat with the sourdough bread and mustard. The flatbreads are light and indulgent yet not as much as the mac n cheese with gruyere and cheddar. Absolutely share and wash it down with more wine. I've been back several times since for girls night and date night. Fat Angel is a great place for both. It's just hard to get a seat if you're not there early in the evening.  Best if your party is small.
author: Samantha L.

description: They have butter on the menu....served with a side of bread.  BUTTER!  And Preston wine on tap.  Yesssss!
author: Megan H.

description: Cute spot to stop by and grab a drink and/or some bites to eat. I was only here for the drinks, and they were pretty full when we got there around 7pm on a Saturday. There was some standing room available at the bar, but that's a small area (the place itself isn't that big and gives off more of a "cozy" vibe), so luckily we were able to grab one of the last remaining tables outside. They have an extensive list of bottled beers to choose from, and also a good variety of beers on tap, wines, and cocktails to choose from. I opted to try the Ottekolong (13 oz, $8.75) on draft, which was a good beer. My friends got cocktails (around $9/each) which they enjoyed. Our server was friendly and service was fast, so no complaints there. I will hopefully be back at some point for drinks, and get to try their food. Parking in this area is usually tough, but street parking spots are available.
author: Amy D.

description:
I came here for my 22nd birthday with 6 other friends. It's a small place but they did our best to accommodate our needs. We had our table in the back and our server really explained all of the cheese and meat selections that we had a question about.

I wanted to save her some trouble by splitting up the bill before she took our orders and she had no issue doing so. 

The FOOD IS INSANE. My friend and I shared the spicy mac and cheese, their famous chicken pot pie, and a platter of meats, cheese, and butter. I was highly impressed and extremely satisfied.

I was also dove into their creamy creme brule with a perfect hard sugar top that wasn't burnt. It was really sweet that I received a free dessert for my birthday.

I'm definitely coming back and taking all of my friends.
author: Dawn T.

description:
This place should be a girl's best friend.  Wine (on draft) and cheese (x6).  Not to mention bread & multiple types of butter.

We pretty much tried everything.  Champagne cocktail for $10 was delicious. Half-bottle of wine for $20 netted 3 full glasses. Also tried truffled cheese, truffled wild boar salami, spicy salami, hard cow cheese, humboldt's fog goat cheese , and duck liver mousse(my fave).  

Maple bacon butter was delicious. they had about 5 other variations of butter to try too. Whipped and light. It almost doesn't feel like you're ingesting a million calories!

Endless bags of bread slices and baguette slices.  We were 80% full based on the charcuterie platter we made ourselves. 

Kale salad was also delicious, as well as the mac & cheese (could have been spicier). Sliders were good too - the bread was a softer, more croissant-like bun with sesame seeds. 

Would come back again but maybe try an additional butter and not do the mac & cheese. It was good but nothing special.
author: Alice Z.

description:
I truly enjoy unpretentious eateries that serve solid food and have a good variety of unique beers and great wines. Fat Angel is exactly that.

The place is fairly small, so when we showed up around 7:30pm on a weekday, we were made to wait about 20 minutes. Not a problem as we ordered a drink at the bar, and stood outside, away from the crowds and in the fresh air.

When we were seated, we were thanked for our patience, and ordered:
+Mac 'n' cheese ($11): with gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, it was incredibly good. My date raised his eyebrows at me as I scooped out every last bit of it. No shame in my game.
+Meat and cheese plate: we opted for three of the cow cheeses ($5 each, 3 for $14, 6 for $27) and three of the meats: salametto, hot coppa, and Calabrese ($5.25 each, 3 for $15, or 6 for $28). It was served with a sourdough baguette, some fig, grain mustard, and various chutneys. Delicious! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=eIDeQK14cP_qW7fHxFnvzw#UayBZRG-y-54WkbI71tgSg)
+Beer and wine ONLY, but take advantage of the specials on the board, or simply ask for recommendations. They were more than happy to let me sample a few (much appreciated). I chose a tasty pinot and the date opted for a hoppy IPA.

Super pleased with the service. A satisfactory meal for about $50? Works for me.
author: Adena B.

description: Lovely place to grab a drink and quick, delicious meal before a show at the Filmore.
author: Amy B.

description:
What a great spot - I wish I had a neighborhood bar like this. It's a small little place where seating is reserved for people who are dining, so bar patrons are limited to about a half-dozen bar stools. 

They have an extensive menu of beers on tap and by the bottle and wines also. The bartenders gave good, honest recommendations (one of them steered my friend away from a beer that he wouldn't recommend) and were really friendly and responsive. 

It's the perfect place to pop in for a drink (or two) while you're waiting for your table at State Bird Provisions.
author: Wendy L.

description: Good environment, nice little outside patio/seating area... and really good boysenberry sour beer.
author: Sarah D.

description:
Enjoyed our night out here. Found it on Yelp after attending Sake Day in Japantown nearby. Just a short walk. Was super busy and the hostess quoted us 45 mins. She was spot on. Hung out in the nearby park and they texted us over. 

Sat at the bar, would have rather gotten a table but it was still fun. Flavored butter was a must have. We had the lemon sage and caper one, as they were out of the bacon maple, but it was amazing. 

Watch out for the spice in the Mac and Cheese. It'll getcha.  

Beer list was good. Service was prompt. Food seemed to be geared towards small plates and shareable food. Great for a night out but may want to give it some thought if you want just "dinner".
author: Brian B.

description:
This place is hipster hell.

I saw the good online reviews here and thought this place would be cool to try. So a friend and I go and started looking at the menu. There was an extensive beer selection, but it was super pricey. They actually were offering a bottle of beer for $35. You read that right, $35. For. A. Bottle. Of. Beer. No thanks. The food wasn't bad, but overall not a place I would recommend or go to again. Next time I'll go to Toranado and Rosamunde's next door. Toranado has a bigger beer selection and a nicer vibe.
author: Rebecca J.

description:
Yeah it's kinda awesome.  They have a massive beer selection and miniscule amounts of seating, which makes you wonder if this place isn't in fact a giant beer storage facility with a small dining room attached.    And a nice dining room it is!  Cozy, dimly lit, check the photos, you get the idea.

Anyway, I had the Brontide, which is a smokey dark saison that was very well balanced and generally wonderful.  Also their big pretzel is a classic to accompany anything.  Will definitely be back.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Second time here and it's still great. Definitely a small place for a small group of people. The focus here is mostly on the libations part... Obviously from the name :) The food is pretty good though (just a bit on the expensive side for what you get). Even though it is pricey, it's worth it to get a couple of the small plates (especially the meats and cheeses) since it pairs really well with the drinks. Also, keep in mind, the menu changes every now and then, so it's kind of a different experience (at least from the two times I've been there).

They have a bunch of beers on tap and a vast selection of wine and bottled beer. They have everything from cheap to like... almost $72 for a bottle of beer (didn't really pay attention to the wines because we weren't really there for wine). The second time I've went here, we had just gotten out of a very beery brunch at 21st Amendment, so we didn't really order much alcohol; only Drake's 2013 Jolly Rodger Imperial American Black Ale (how awesome is that name). It was the last bottle though... but damn that was good. Highly recommend it... if you can find it somewhere else XD

We ordered the lemon caper sage butter (maple bacon is better), sliders (meh), mac and cheese (yum!), and a meat plate with salchichon, two slices of duck liver pâté ('cause we're so fancy), speck, duck salami, and truffled wild boar. The meat plate was definitely better this time around (don't remember the last one we had), and you get a brown bag filled to the brim with bread (which is crazy yummy). The meat plate also comes with a great mustard which brings it all together. Would definitely avoid the sliders though... came out a little soggy... and honestly not very unique/flavorful. The mac and cheese comes in a tiny little cast iron with these awesome breadcrumbs on top.

I like this place for the random selection and the chill atmosphere. Luckily the second time we went, it was waaaaaaaaaaay quieter (we were the only ones in the resturant, minus some of the tables outside) and it was great to hang out with a couple friends. It did start to fill up a little bit by 6 pm (halfish full) but by then we were pretty sated and happy.

Would come back, would recommend, but really the attraction here is the drink! The staff is super friendly too. Definitely has hipster written all over it :D
author: Denise C.

description: Really cool bar with a good beer selection. It's good to come with a friend to have a conversation in a simply nice place.
author: Jack M.

description:
Came here for dinner with a friend and was not disappointed.  The beer and wine selection is QUITE extensive and is organized by flavor (with alcohol percentages!) so if you like beer and wine, definitely check this place out.  I got the chicken pot pie, which I thought was pretty good.  I wasn't amazed though.  

I'll definitely come back here for some beers if I'm in the area, and if I'm getting drinks I'll probably grab a small bite to eat too.
author: Keith C.

description:
This is the snobbiest restaurant in the city. I gave this restaurant the benefit of the doubt many times but I just can't get over the fact that the wait staff just don't give a shit about its customers. Expect to wait at least 10 minutes or more before you get noticed by the wait staff. The manager Laura doesn't give a hoot about your opinions since they will still get customers for the mere fact that it's in a great location.

For the record, I live in the Fillmore Center, literally in the same building as the restaurant. I walk my dog in front of this place on a daily basis, multiple times per day. I suppose I am invisible to these idiots. I hate this place with a passion. DO NOT EVER DINE HERE.
author: JD K.

description:
I've been going there for years, the experience I got is almost as good, let's start by the Pros:
-excellent draft beer, selection is changing every week. Among the best place in the city to get quality draft beer that come from all over the world.
-They have outside tables so you can enjoy so fresh air

Why I said my experience changed? Because:
-staff changed and is not as "goofy-weird" which gave some personality to this place
-It's getting too popular and impossible to get a spot

Now the cons:
-TOO LOUD
-Food is good but way overpriced for the portions
author: Sylvain K.

description: Good Wine, good food with good portions. Couldn't ask for more.  The restaurant itself is on the smaller end but when I went around 8pm on a weekday we did not have to wait to get seated.  Not sure how crowded it gets at busier times.  Their salads are delicious and come in a great portion size.  We ordered a flatbread and the chicken pot pie and all was good. The meals are full of flavor so you'll need water and wine ;) to wash it all down!
author: Jessica H.

description: This place was great, snacks were good and drinks were good. We got the pretzel with the whole grain mustard and cheese sauce which was delish. They also have a butter section! a butter section! which I think every place should have. For whatever reason I thought the butter was going to be melted for dipping but it came out like normal butter that they usually provide with bread and it was very cold and hard to cut through. I would have liked it to have been softer but if you are patient and give it a minute or two it should be fine. We have no patience and inhale our food so that is more of an "us" problem.  It is also very small so I wouldn't recommend it for large parties but the ambiance is really nice and casual.
author: Samantha J.

description: Such an ADORABLE classy place! I love the wine here!! I HIGHLY recommend the Melon de Bourgogue- so crisp light and tasty!! I will definitely return
author: Erin T.

description:
Impressive selection of alcohol - first half of the menu lists the options and it is extensive!
As I care about food more - we ordered the trout salad which had beets in it (yum, I think they substituted the horseradish for it - good call), the spicy Mac n cheese, and the arugula sausage flatbread. All were so tasty. My favorite was the Mac and cheese which was just right in spice. Service was polite, quick, and fantastic - creme brûlée on the house topped off our meal.
author: Patricia S.

description:
Fat Angel Food & Libation

The name itself is already enough to make you want to go to this restaurant. I particularly delighted in their spicy mac n cheese.

I don't know what else to say, just that Fat Angel is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in SF!
author: Isabele B.

description: This place is so awesome. Nice people, bright sun light. Normal seats. So many beers and wine on tap, I'm overwhelmed! But thankfully the bartender is knowledgeable and nice, which goes a long way in sf. Food is delicious too. My new favorite spot!
author: Kristin S.

description:
This is a great place for small bites and trying new beers. It's small and quaint and right off of fillmore. My coworker who has lived in SF for so long took me here and he has good taste in food and knows what he likes so I trusted him and wasn't disappointed. He got a sour beer and if was my first time trying one and it was good! They often have new selection of alcohol that come in so its a fun place to sample. We got a cream beer and a porter. 

Limited about of seating but the atmosphere is cozy. Very dim but a fun atmosphere for a date night. 

Food: flat bread, spicy Mac and cheese, chicken pot pie, sliders. My favorite were the sliders and flat bread!
author: Kristin C.

description:
I went back again and everything I had felt Mediocre so I guess it's either hit or miss because the first time I ate here it was wonderful.  

For this review I came during Happy Hours with 2 people.  We had aa arugula salad that was wonderful.  However, the mac and cheese wasn't as spicy and tastey this time and the last flat bread on the list with these sausage was not good at all.  

It just taste like some cheap $5 sausage frozen pizza.  :(  I'm never ordering that one again gross and sad.
author: Juila L.

description:
I recently visited this little pub/restaurant before a concert at the Fillmore on a Tuesday night. I had read in reviews that getting a table could take a while so my wife and I arrived a little before the dinner rush, around 5:45, and got to take our pick of several open tables. I should mention that when we left about an hour later all the tables were taken and there was a short line at the door of people waiting for a table to open up. 

The vibe of the place when we first arrived very different than when we left....
If you want to avoid a wait, get there early but don't be surprised if it feels a little like you're eating in a library until it fills up. If you don't want to feel like the loudest person in the place, arrive when it's full and it'll feel more fun, making the atmospheric difference alone worth the wait.

The food at Fat Angel is good, but definitely an after thought. The menu is ten pages of alcoholic beverages and a page at the end of food. We had the pot pies and Caesar salad, one of only two entrees they offer (the other being mac and cheese) and both of were very good. The downside to the small menu is there's a good chance they wouldn't have anything you'd like. Best to check the menu online first.

So.....were I to go there again, I'd arrive a little later and order the same thing.

Oh, and don't bring your kids here. There's nothing here for them. Just FYI
author: Tom N.

description:
WINE ON TAP?!?!?

I'm NO wine connoisseur, but the mental image I get is being poured a glass from a cardboard box of Franzia that has a harsh vinegary finish. *cringes* 

Boy, did Fat Angel prove me wrong...my 2009 Pinot Noir Canihan Sonoma, CA ($9.50/glass) is the BEST RED WINE I'VE EVER HAD!!! It was soft, seamlessly smooth and juicy with vibrant berry and aromatic floral tones. It trumps my favorite (now former) 2007 Montelena Estate Cabernet Sauvignon at Press Club ($27.50/glass). For someone that needs 6-8 shots of Goose to get a good buzz, two glasses were enough to give me the giggles. Talk about a bang for your buck!

Don't forget to pair your fabulous glass of draft wine or beer with one of their delectable flatbreads. My friend and I split the Roasted Grapes, Walnuts, Prosciutto w/ Gorgonzola ($9) which was mouth-watering. With a slightly blistered crust, the flatbread was warm and crunchy with the perfect balance of salty, savory, smoky, nutty and pungency with a sweet tang. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/W0mlelgnkSPU3ELhyzkXHA?select=pJm9j_ek_W13h61ae_pCVg

Initially, I was skeptical about their draft wines but don't knock it till you try it. SERIOUSLY...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
The line at State Bird Provisions was unacceptably long, so we wandered around the corner and voila -- beer, snacks, and tables without a wait.

I don't have a lot to add that others haven't said recently. Kale salad was great and the portion was huge. Mac and cheese was spicy and the portion was huge. Sliders and pate were delicious. Wish they had fries - then it would be perfect.
author: Kate F.

description:
Fat Angel has one of those names where you sort of want to go just because it's called Fat Angel. Like, what type of product does a place called Fat Angel serve?
Since I've recently become a developing bourbon connoisseur, now whenever I think of angels and a gastropub, I think of "angel's share" which is a term that describes the evaporated liquid of processing bourbon in a barrel (before it's ultimately bottled after however long it stays in a barrel). Because of this knowledge, I thought this might be a bourbon joint. It's actually a wine bar.

This is a small joint that doesn't get crowded right away, but usually does about an hour and a half into the restaurants opening. So, if you can't get a table at State Bird Provisions around the corner, this is an alternative for some people who want to eat ASAP.

The macaroni and cheese is amazing. The crumbs on top make the dish 3 times better. This is the only dish of food I tried. The other dishes on the menu sounded amazing though.

The drinks are expensive so don't binge here (a beer might cost you $10). I ordered this one sour bourbon beer and it clearly said it was $8 on the chalkboard but the bartender charged me $10. He fixed it for me but it's always annoying when that happens.

Overall, nice place to grab a drink before heading off to do something else on Fillmore.
author: Marlon T.

description: Just off Fillmore Street, Fat Angel offers comfort food in a classy environment.  The golden chubby angel that hangs outside the restaurant adds to the ambiance of this place.  Although small, there is some patio seating that is perfect for people watching.  There is wine on tap, but also by the bottle.  As for food, I like the spicy mac n' cheese.  My friend boasted that it was the best mac n' cheese she had ever had - I'm not sure I would go that far, but it is pretty awesome.  Depending on your taste buds, you may or may not find it spicy.  I (and my wonder bread upbringing) would tell you that it is spicy, but nothing you can't handle. Staff is super nice.  We had to wait a couple of minutes for a table, but they got us started with some wine while we waited.
author: Stephanie V.

description:
Had been wanting to try this spot for awhile now. Located in a nice little nook near Fillmore Street, Fat Angel boasts a great beer menu and some delish gastropub eats.

The wait is long, and they don't take resys, so come early and don't be that hungry. Also, with SF weather, bring either a jacket and sit outside (much shorter wait time, and they have heat lamps), or wait longer for the inside tables. It's a tiny space so waits can me 1.5-2 hours long depending on party size.

We started off with fried capers. These were interesting -- deep fried, so the insides were hollow, and the outsides were crunchy. It was delicious, but super salty (capers, duh).

Next, we noshed on the chocolate cinnamon butter. This was served with a great rye bread, and was so delicious. Like cinnamoney-nutella. Spread like butter, and was soft.

Then we had 2 flatbreads: (1) Roasted red grape, walnut, & prosciutto w/ Gorgonzola, which was lovely. The roasted grapes are a favorite thing of mine that not many places do. It adds a hint of sweet to something that feels savory. It's great. (2) Wild mushroom and white truffle oil w/pecorino. This was also delicious, and better than the roasted red grape flatbread. Both flatbreads were super thin -- think nacho chip with pizza-like toppings. Very tasty and not too heavy.

Then we had the Mac n'cheese - gruyere, cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, cayenne. Was a nice, homey mac and cheese. The Fa's chicken pot pie - roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon - was also super homey. The toasted filo dough on top was a great touch, which you break into pieces and eat with the insides of the pot pie.

Finally we had a great cheese board, which our server picked. Service overall was nice, with servers being very beer and food knowledgeable, and eager to help.

Had a delightful meal with great friends, and would definitely come back.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Cute little place with some very pretty deco but the food is pretty bad...maybe it depends on the day/hour because I saw some good looking food here on yelp..in reality it tasted like it was thawed from the freezer and hastily reheated. 
Over priced.
Happy hour $1 off? Try again Fat Angel. That's not quite happy enough.
author: c.love n.

description:
Wow, I was impressed by Fat Angel. I've only been there once, but I know what I like. Fat Angel is simple and comfortable, yet classy and gourmet.

I was in the mood for a good beer, I ordered a La Moneuse Saison on draft for my first. It was excellent, love good Belgian beers.

I ordered the House Marinated Olives which are Castelvetrano Olives,  my all-time favorite!! They are large, light green olives that are hearty and light. A must if you are a sucker for olives.

Next up, we shared the Cheese Platter. This is an easy appetizer for groups. Pick the 5 Cheese platter - it comes with jams and accents to mix and match on your toasted bread. Yummm... 

I ordered another beer for the dinner portion of our meal and went with the Christoffel Blond. A nice refreshing German Pilsner. 

For dinner, my friend and I split the wild mushroom & white truffle oil w/ pecorino flat bread and the Endive, apple, candied walnuts, gorgonzola w/ cider vinaigrette salad.

I highly recommend Fat Angel for the beer enthusiast. Here is a copy of the libations - http://www.fatangelsf.com/libations/

Everything was perfect. I love dinners like this. A little of this and that, all quality and very tasty. I can't wait to bring other friends here. There is so much to try and that's a tasty thing.
author: Rebekah T.

description: I wish I could give this place more stars, I really do. But the service was lacking tonight. It took almost an hour for us to get our food because they messed up our order. We ordered a bottle of wine but had to ask for a refill every time we were done. The food itself was very good. We ordered the kale salad and prosciutto flatbread. The bread was perfectly crunchy. I would have been appeased by the service if they had comped our order or even a free dessert. But we barely got an apology.
author: Raha G.

description:
Only been to this place once but I was impressed. They've got a good variety of beer, I was pleasantly surprised by their selection. My buddy got the curieux, it was absolutely delicious; don't you just love it when your beers are delicious? From what I remember the curieux was a bit creamy, and fruity, give it a try if that sounds up your alley, you won't be disappointed. 

For foods I got the chicken pot pie. The pie isn't like your traditional chicken pot pie with the chicken stuffing inside of the pie. This one here all of the filling is out in the bowl, and you've got your piece of pie/bread floatin' on 'modest mouse' style in the middle. It was good, and while not what I expected I wouldn't hesitate to get it again if/when I dine here again.
author: David C.

description:
Beer/wine selection: outstanding 

Customer service: 1 million gold star points to infinity (so so so good for real)

Olives: Yes please

Romantic: Hell yes

Cozy: Handled 

Chocolate cake: Perfect

Hot Tea: In it's own press ftw 

I came off my Yelp cleanse to give this place five stars. Tucked away gem. No more details for you! Just go!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
To be clear, I can't comment on the food. 

Fat Angel is incredibly charming, and it has an incredible beer list. What it lacks is service. 

First off, we were quoted a 40-minute wait -- not bad for 7:30 on a Saturday -- but that 40 minutes quickly turned into an hour wait. With no end in sight, we patiently sat at the bar... For another 15 minutes. 

Just as we were nearing our breaking point, a couple who had JUST walked in was seated immediately. As it turned out, the front patio -- which had been mostly empty durning our wait -- was first-come-first-served, that just isn't disclosed. The hostess made it seem like we should have known that on our own. 

Overall, this is a great place for a beer, but it would appear that they treat guests like cattle -- herded when convenient, and unremarkable. We won't go back to find out what we missed.
author: Caroline C.

description:
Really like this place:

- Huge beer and wine selection.

- House marinated olives (4) -- SO GOOD. They're Calvestrano olives (those giant, juicy, plump, forest green-colored ones -- my absolute fav) and they taste heavenly.

- Meat + cheese (6 for 28) -- We combined a bunch to make a charcuterie plate. Everything was really good, the duck salami and genoa especially stood out.

- 3 sliders (12) -- These were okay. Nothing special.

- Chicken pot pie (13) -- More like a deconstructed pot pie. The portions were huge, and this was delicious. Probably because it had like a pound of butter and cream in it (not listed in the ingredients), and as a lactard, I did not appreciate the after-effects.

This place is cozy, tasteful, and intimate, but gets crowded really fast. There is outdoor seating with heat lamps, but it still gets a little chilly. They don't seat your party until everyone is there.

Tip: They don't take reservations, but you can download the NoWait app and put your name down when they open (4 PM).
author: Cynthia W.

description:
With only one table taken in the entire restaurant, the host would only let us sit by the door, which was open, on a very cold day. I asked again, because I was really cold, and he said that was the only table for 3 he had and it was a very popular place, so they wouldn't be able to accommodate us.
It was 5:30pm, and I'm sure we would've finished eating before their claimed rush would come in...
author: Sergio F.

description: It took us 4000 hours to order as there's so many delicious options available that we weren't accustomed to, but we ended up getting three cheese and three meat, the Kale salad with chicken was BEYOND incredible (and a huge serving too!), and the arugula flatbread just sealed the deal. Love this spot! Great atmosphere though a little elbow-to-elbow, but that's typical in most of SF. We'll totally go back!
author: Erin W.

description:
Great place to go for a late night dinner and beers.
I say this because I am certain it gets really busy at peak hours.
We arrived at 8:30pm and were quickly seated.

Great food and great beers!!!
author: Peter B.

description:
This is a super cute and cosy restaurant that I had a chance to come w/ my bff and her bf (ha that's a mouthful ...) recently when we got together for dinner. 

By cute and cozy I mean this place is TINY. We were sitting 3 at a table and I was feeling like a giant of sorts. Because the place is small, it usually smells like olive oil and fried things as the kitchen just drifts into the air of the place ... but the bar is cute and their selection of wine and beer is quite extensive.

The thing that surprised me the most, actually, was the fact that they had a large beer list. Who knew, I thought this was a wine bar!

The wait staff are very friendly, and very knowledgable, but seem somewhat rushed since they were sort of looking like they wanted us to get out of there every time we finished a bottle ... but aside from that everything was good. I did enjoy the flat bread, the mac and cheese (yum!), and the deconstructed chicken pot pie. Recommended for a date, especially since it's so dark you can't really see ;) haha ...
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Great place for a first date... Nice and cozy, romantic, intimate atmosphere. 

Greens (Trout)- HUGE bowl of salad. Fried capers were unique, surprisingly addicting.

Chicken Pot Pie- Must order. Much bigger portion than I expected. Very rich.

Spicy Mac n Cheese- Wow... Surprised with a sharp, pungent flavor upon first bite. Loved it.
author: Colleen W.

description:
YUM YUM YUM! I just moved to San Francisco this past weekend and Fat Angle is probably one of my favorite places to eat thus far! Located just across the street from my apartment it is very convenient for me to eat there.

They have a great selection of beer! Organized by type, some of these bottles can get quite pricey $30+ so be careful when ordering. But if you like beer they are sure to have something you like!

The food is delicious!  They have a small menu, so in the few times I've been I have been able to try a majority of the items:

Flavored Butters, Cheese, and Meats served with bread -- Almost like a charcuterie platter. It all comes out together on a platter served with bread. I loved the meats and cheeses. Awesome quality and the saltiness goes well when drinking.

Chicken Pot Pie - Delicious! A bowl filled with creamy chicken and veggies (carrots and peas) topped with a crispy crust. Not too doughy since the crust isn't completely surrounding the pie.

Burger Sliders -- My favorite thing here! Juicy meat with some amazing aioli. Also goes great with the pickled jalapenos which are served on the side.

Mac n' Cheese - Cheesy with a kick. The heat seems to linger for awhile, but it is so good.

Flat Breads - Extremely thin crust! Thin and crispy!

Great place to grab some beers and delicious food. My only complaint is that the restaurant is really small, so sometimes the wait can be long.
author: Richard P.

description:
When looking for a place to grab a bite before a show at the Fillmore, Fat Angel showed up near the top of the list during a Yelp search.  Noticing that they were a gastropub with a fine beer list made the choice easy for me.

After parking nearby with my friend P, we made a beeline here to quench our thirst and grab a bite. Unfortunately, there was a small crowd of people jamming the doorway and we thought we might be out of luck. After all, the place is really tiny. 

Undaunted, we squeezed through to the bar to find several open spaces. I guess everyone really wanted a table.  We didn't.

The draft beer list here (written on chalkboard) was FANTASTIC: all microbrews, including two IPAs, a golden ale, a porter, a weiss beer, a brown ale. a double IPA and even a sour beer.  The bottle list was much longer; The waiter said the total count was over 100!  So many choices that we couldn't decide, and so we left. (yeah right)

The menu was short but we found what we wanted quickly: sliders for me, and chicken pot pie for my buddy P.  Unfortunately, it took about 15 mins to get someone to take our orders. (Staff was very thin.) At least we had tasty beers in front of us and some time to examine the cool decor, including the large glass chandelier (echoes of the nearby Fillmore?) and the back of the bar, which appeared to be made out of an old church organ...pretty Cool actually.

Once we ordered, the food arrived quickly. We both enjoyed our meals and our second, tasty brew.  The night was off to a good start.  By the time we paid up and left, the outside crowd had doubled, and even bar seats were in demand. We were glad we had arrived when we did.

5 stars for the perfect pre-show dinner and excellent beer selection; 1 star off for the spotty service.
author: Dan B.

description:
I wish I had room to try the food, it smelled divine!
We came here after eating in the city center and before a show at the Fillmore, it was perfect!  A patron who was holding a few seats let us take them (we asked a few times to make sure it was okay), the stools are made of old tractor wheels!  
The ambiance/decor was great, a rustic, vintage, watering hole that would seem to be popular in the days of Billy the Kid but with a modern flare and elegant features.  Not only were the stools made of old wheels but the bar was an old organ, the bathroom had a very nice style to it and it smelled pretty darn good (especially for the area around the Fillmore), and there is a gorgeous chandelier casting a dim light over the room.
We each had a few wines on tap and each of the bartenders were pretty friendly.  The wine was quite delicious and I got a Sav Blac, it was surprising to me that I didn't change to a red since I'm not a white wine lover.  They also had bottled beer and cider (Crispin the Saint was an option), plus tap.
Overall, I would come back here in a heartbeat, especially if I am headed to the Fillmore- the food seemed divine, the drinks were great, and the service was splendid.  If they take reservations I suggest you make one, we were here on Thanksgiving's Eve and it was at about 80% capacity.
author: Sara N.

description:
We won't be back there. The food was decent but the service was terrible. We ordered, among other things, the sliders. We were disappointed by them: The patty was small compared to the bun, overcooked and the sauce wasn't very good. We each had one and left the third one untouched. I told the waiter that we had a nice meal that was let down by the sliders. There comes the weird part. The waiter became very defensive and started offering a partial refund of the sliders. His argument was that we ate two and left one, so he could refund us 33% of the sliders. WTF is this? I didn't ask for any refund and was not expecting one. But offering a refund of 33% of $10 is just a joke. I told him so, and he went to talk to his manager. He came back and told us that we will be completely refunded.

So, decent food (overall) and good beverages, but terrible service.
author: Benoit T.

description: Beer selection was decent. Not very many taps. Food was very expensive. Venue is tiny. The crowd there was an odd mix... It was mostly upper middle-aged people who desperately wanted everyone around them to think they were intellectually superior (clearly very annoying to listen to).
author: Lindsay T.

description: Nice little bistro that we will visit again. Huz had chicken pot pie and I had trout salad. Both were Tady with generous portions. Great chill vibe and service.
author: Cydney B.

description:
This is a great little place that does a few dishes really well!

Best:
Mac n cheese
Chicken pot pie

Atmosphere: intimate, dim lighting and trendy

I will come here again!
author: Daniela J.

description:
I love Fat Angel! The place is adorable and their food is really good. My partner and I ordered some butters to start (their menu features five flavored butters), which are served with bread and are absolutely amazing. We ordered three, which is way too much for two people, but we really enjoyed trying them! We chose the bernaise, the chile garlic, and the lemon caper sage butters -- all were delicious, and it was difficult to decide which was the best.

For our entrees, I had the kalamata and asparagus flatbread. My partner had the chicken potpie. Both were delicious and very well-priced. Looking back, I suppose they weren't totally remarkable, but we were both very happy with the food.

Their drinks are great, too! I'll definitely be back.
author: John F.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night after my boyfriends work.  It's a small cozy place which serves a good collection of beers and wines.  It wasn't crowded during the time we came here--we thought it would be considering it was happy hour.  We were greeted and seated right away by their friendly staff.  

Bf had red wine and I had white wine--prices where reasonable.  We ordered cheese plates: truffle tremor--MmmmMmmm --delicious! Nuvola di Pecora, and Vella dry Jack.--they were all good.  

For the meat platter we tried:  loukanika, Finicchiona and Piccante Salami.  Our server was very helpful with suggesting which meat to try.  They were all very tasty.  

We also ordered their roasted red grapes, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola flatbread.--it was different.  I didn't cAre for the roasted grapes at all.  The prosciutto didn't taste any close to a prosciutto :( bf and I were somewhat disappointed.  We didn't finished our flat bread and asked for it to go--our server took to the back so he can box it up and to come out few minutes later to tell us that he dropped our left over flatbread in the trash--at least he was honest about it.  He gave us 1/2 off the price and offered to fire up another one if we were still hungry..I said no and thank you.

We'd come back again and try their other food on their menu soon.
author: Junaline G.

description: Drinks are top notch! Small place, so find your seating or wait.. Mac and cheese is prob the best around!! Really love this place and have been back a few times, I even craved the Mac so badly when in town once I got it to go for the drive home ;)
author: Patrick B.

description:
fat angel is like everything i want in a local establishment - lots of cheese, homemade bread, fresh local salads, artisan bar bites (sliders, flatbreads and the like), charcuterie, an extensive beer/cider/wine list and taxidermy on the wall. i absolutely love this place!

yes, it's bordering the sketchiness that is the western addition but its tucked away so you almost forget where you are.

the wait is sometimes a little too long to justify, but if you catch them at a good time you'll be happy you stopped by.

besides the flavored butters, charcuterie and cheese offerings - the kale salad, sliders and gorgonzola flatbread are absolutely delicious. you've gotta order those!
author: Mandy A.

description:
Hrm... was it just me? So many people rave about this place and I came with high expectations but I was a little disappointed... I guess I expected everything to taste a lot better but nothing really was to my liking.

Polenta fries: first few bites was good... sorta seemed like I was forcing myself to eat it... the taste was a bit weird to me, kinda tastes like a lot of olive oil, and found myself drowning the fries in ketchup to kind of make it taste better... When the fries became cool... it tasted just awful. Wasn't a fan.

Tomatoes, basil, spicy sausage flat bread: this was pretty good. I really liked the ricotta and sausage!

Mac n cheese: The toppings were delicious and perfect but below the toppings seemed really dry... a bit hard to swallow? Regardless, the toppings made up for it, I guess.

Sliders: no no no! First bite was SOOO GOOD... then it just felt really oily and buttery and eck... made me feel a bit sick after.

Chicken pot pie: I've had better... a bit too thick and creamy for my taste.

I dont know... I really wish I could give this place more stars but I really wasn't impressed. Maybe it was just an off day for the kitchen... I'd like to come back and give it another go though. (:

Really nice ambiance though!
author: Nadeen H.

description: Best wine and food place in the city. Warm and cozy atmosphere with delicious draft wine and beer. The smoked salmon salad, sliders, and spicy mac and cheese are delicious.
author: Eryn D.

description:
I would give this place a solid four stars if it wasn't for the rude male host working the front. If the outside seats are "first come, first serve", do not tell me you lost a few customers due to me taking one chair from the other table because you are one who told me to check the outside seating and to take whatever's available -_- He made me feel horrible and I could have been approached in a more friendly manner. 

I came here with a party of three on a busy Friday night and I can't wait to visit this place again minus the rude host. The chicken pot pie really blew me away and leftovers we're just as amazing. They have a endless list of beers, wines and bar food. This is a fun place to grab some drinks with friends and just hang out. I do not recommend large parties here.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Mac & cheese here is sinful
Skipping it is a mistake
That's why the angel is fat
... wine headache.

Wine and scrumptious food to go with it are my weakness. Hence I liked this place so much I came two nights in a row!

The food here is yummy enough to stand alone. Now that I've tried their amazing mac & cheese and the chicken pot pie (kind of salty), I'd love to sample their antipasti and organic butter.

As with any other small wine bar, the extensive wine list is unique and has been put together bottle by bottle by the co-owners. I got to chat with one of them about their business venture and the story behind it (the inspiration for the name "Fat Angel" actually came from China of all places). If Cyrick isn't too busy, you should flag him down, he's awesome!

The décor is like chapel meets speakeasy. Or maybe it just feels that way since you're sitting in a church pew staring at an organ... downing a bottle of tempranillo. The intimate space is mood-lit by candles and chandeliers--super date-appropriate. Just watch out for slow service on a busy night. If time is not a factor for you, however, then feel free to spend all evening in this cozy little spot, which I'm really glad is thriving in its home in the heart of the Fillmore.
author: Kate V.

description: Came here late for some drinks. Feels like a French cafe.  Very much like it. No cocktails, however, so I drank alone since my wife was on a roll with cocktails that night.
author: Marco H.

description: The kale salad was killer as was the bread w/ lemon caper butter. These guys love their capers!
author: Erin S.

description: More interested in appearing to cater to the upper echelon of the PAC heights people. Less interested in actually serving people who are interested in dining at their establishment.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Came here on a random Friday evening, and it was quite crowded. We managed to squeeze in a seat for four before the crowd got really crazy. We ordered: 

Maple Bacon butter and bread
Mac 'n Cheese
Charcuterie platter
3 Sliders + 1

Everything tasted good, and they have a wide selection of beer and wine. Just beware the crowd! 

In fact, the place was so crowded that the server mixed up our bill with someone else's. The server ended up comping a few dishes. SCORE!
author: Audrey L.

description:
I'm so glad my bf found this place on Yelp! We had some last minute changes during our SF getaway and wanted some delicious food in our bellies :)

We got lucky with parking and quickly found our way to the quaint little pub. About a 10 minute wait and had a look at the menu even though we already knew what we were going to have. Unfortunately, we were seated on a two-top with 3 people, but moved after a few dishes came out when the table next to us left. 

Polenta fries with garlic aioli and spicy ketchup: So bomb! Fried to perfection. The garlic aioli was nice and creamy and the ketchup had just the right kick. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=v9nx_p9ngsUFMTeRQL3_2Q

Salame nostrano and hot copa (??): Originally ordered just the salame but because the "order took so long" (I didn't think it was too long of a wait o_O) one of the owners gave us the other meat on the house! Don't remember if it was the hot copa or not, but it was delicioso~ The meats come with whole grain mustard and bread. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=u_QTAXoXAyNA2PmWqzwApw

Red grape, gorgonzola, walnut, proscuitto flatbread: The right size for the three of us. Generous amount of all ingredients and a classic combo done right. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=WmeropcwqBspDObJjgk-8A

Mac n cheese: Creamy and good portion, given the other things we also ordered. We were stuffed and I had to beast it out for the last few bites.http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-san-francisco?select=v6j6QhxBbF2D93-rv_IRyQ

All the Yelp reviews are testament to the owners' passion and dedication to Fat Angel. They really enjoy doing what they do and are happy to help you make your food/beverage selection. My only regret is not getting anything to drink because they have a wide selection of beers and wines.
author: Natasha P.

description: Cozy, cute, little place. Kitchen closed at 1030pm on Thursday. Salami was good with tasty dijon mustard. Bread wasn't crispy. Mac'ncheese was ok, I've had better, add some lobster to it. The mother puncher IPA was also ok. I would come back, not for the Mac n cheese though.
author: Mauricio C.

description:
Cozy and consistent, Fat Angel is my go-to spot for wine and comfort food. Their carafes of wine and simple yet delicious food is best served with good friends over reflective conversations. 

Although the restaurant itself is not "fat" by any means as there always seems to be a wait for a table in the cramped quarters, the hostess is super friendly and will offer to text you when a table is available. If you are seeking delicious flatbread, super decadent selections of charcuterie and cheeses, a good list of wines and beers that are priced very well, than it's definitely worth the wait!
author: Sue L.

description: I went here for the first time after work for some wine and cheese and that's exactly what I got. I was very satisfied. The two servers that helped us were so kind and helpful. I usually order my go to Pinot pior. But, it was a warmer day in SF per usual so the server, a younger gentleman helped me pick a sparking red wine that was served cold. Amazing. We ordered the meat dish and finished it off with the spicy Mac and cheese! The Mac and cheese is to die for!  I highly recommend. I was very pleased. Kudos!
author: Seema S.

description:
Pretty impressed with the Mac-N-Cheese. I mean, it's not like grandma used to make, but what is... right? Still, it was good. Kinda had a zinger feel to it. Or maybe that was the Mikkeller sour I had, which was equally delicious. 
My friend got the salmon salad. It was also really good. Chunks of potato(e), and a tasty vinaigrette. She had the Coronado 18th Anniversary (two, actually), which was delectable.
Everyone on the staff was very friendly and attentive. 
I definitely recommend this place!
author: Rich P.

description:
* Cheese served w/ organic Firebrand bread and seasonal accents ($5 each or 5 for $21: Wagon Wheel  NorCal semi-firm cow, Roaring 40's Blue, Tasmanian semi-soft cow, Dante  Wisconsin semi-firm sheep, Toma  NorCal semi-firm cow, Mt. Tam  NorCal soft cow, Goat Gouda  NorCal semi-firm goat) - Delicious! The blue is very strong and wonderful. The seasonal jams are amazing, and I loved the sweet almond. A little pricey though.

* Mac n' Cheese (gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano  $11) - Loved this! The pasta is soft, the cheese strong
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Well-informed and helpful staff in a sophisticated, classy, yet warm and intimate little place. With an extensive, long list of beers and wines, and a unique menu of finger foods and bar snacks, I was lost in the experience and forgot about my date for a second. The possibilities are endless!

What was so delicious: cheese platters with jelly, flat-bread pizza w/ prosciutto, grape, walnut, and Gorgonzola, double IPA (thanks for recommending a great side), and the vibe. I loved all the uncommon ingredients.

Definitely showing some friends this place. Oh, it's nice.
author: J J.

description:
I have ordered their Chicken/Kale salad via UberEats, and every time it is delicious - the salad is a HUGE portion of fresh kale, the shredded chicken is nice white meat, and the almonds in the salad give it a very nice crunch. I supplement their nice tart dressing with a squeeze of fresh lemon from my kitchen.

Excellent, will order again. Here's an Uber link that will get you free rides and discounts: 

https://www.uber.com/invite/6m9pv
author: William P.

description:
I've been here a few times just for drinks with friends, but last night went here for food as well. We shared some truffle flavored goat's cheese and some duck liver pate to start. Then we shared a mushroom flatbread and the sliders. The sliders were particularly tasty, but all the food was good. We also shared a half bottle of their on-top sauv blanc wine.

The service was friendly and prompt, and the place has a very cool mellow crowd.
author: Jordan C.

description: I absolutely love this place!  The chicken pot pie I obsessed bout days after dining here.  Even the caeser salad was amazing.  Eclectic beer list too for beers that are from different country's.
author: Jeanette W.

description: Very cramped in here but the food is so delicious. Must try their Mac n cheese, sausage flatbread, and chicken pot pie. A huge beer selection (and wine) and friendly staff!
author: Joyce C.

description: Delicious comfort food and extensive beer list in a cozy setting. Wait staff is really friendly too. Great for date night or a small group, but it is a very small venue. Must try: flatbread, Mac n cheese, charcuterie platter.
author: Natasha F.

description:
Hmmm...what actually made it to the table was good...it was just not satisfying as a meal. We ordered cheese and meat and then a pot pie to split. The cheese and meat came. Had to go to the counter 3 times to ask for stuff and only the bread came. Meaning

Ordered 2nd glass of wine twice, entree never even came. Had to go to the counter and ask for the bill with no pot pie since it never came. Both the entree and the wine didn't come... until we asked for the check and then suddenly wine orders were fulfilled and you could find the waitress. 

When we ordered there were 2 others in the restaurant. The people next to us who arrived during our charcuterie got their meal...as well as half of the other people who came in after us.

Food and wine is good if you get some.
The service is going to kill this business.
author: Marz W.

description:
It's got a whole section on the menu for sour beers. I'm sold. 

The food is pretty damn good. I've had quite a bit off their menu--the highlights are the different butters and the salads, which are seriously gigantic. I ordered the chicken pot pie the last time I was there. The portion was pleasing, and I initially was really enjoying it, but the more I ate, the more I felt like it tasted like the pot pies I used to make in the ovens. So, there's your docked star--the pot pie isn't the best thing on the menu. 

Great bar though, and bartenders are super knowledgable. Also I love wine on tap.
author: Allison S.

description:
Their drinks are awesome. The only reason why I didn't give Fat Angel 5 stars is because I didn't have the opportunity to try their food (I came here AFTER dinner elsewhere), though looking at pictures, I know I'll have to come back to try their mac & cheese. 

Tip: Come here if you're a beer connoisseur. Their menu of brewskis is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! Whether you like them light, dark, hoppy, etc., you name it, there's a brew for you. Not to mention, our server (I believe his name was Derek) was SUPER helpful in describing all the special notes of each beer on the menu; it certainly makes their long list of beers less intimidating. :)
author: Helen W.

description: Has the intimate feel of a little Paris bistro. Staff is polite and has good and experienced recommendations. One thing I would say is that the cheese plate is a little overpriced for how small the portions are.
author: Erika B.

description:
I can't believe i waited so long to try the food at Fat Angel.

They had a good list of beer & wine. And an excellent menu of small plates and comfort foods - i love the combination.

My friend and I shared a salad, mac & cheese and the chicken pot pie - everything was delicious! We were really looking forward to the mac & cheese, which was good. but the chicken pot pie totally stole the show. The chicken is tender and the pot pie crust is thin, crispy and there's a bit of cheese baked on to the crust too..HmmMmmMMmmMm so good!
author: Terry C.

description:
I've been here a few times, but this past weekend was review worthy. Thanks to the Ramen fest, the entire area outside of my appt was flooded by starving people who didn't want to wait in a 4 hour line for ramen. Oh man. We wandered until we realized we had 30m until Fat Angel opened, so we sat and waited, so SF.


Cut to 5m before 4, and the waitress on staff comes out to set up the outdoor seating area, and lets us know she is the only one working at the time. Poor girl, there are about 40 of us waiting at this point, and the kitchen doesn't open until 5. 

We enter and sit in the corner, while the restaurant fills. The waitress and her barback are running around, taking everyone's orders - it was so fluid and efficient. She did a wonderful job and the staff (of two, haha) was attentive and quick. 

We had our drink and appetizer about 15m after being seated, and by the time we were done with our appetizer (pretzel and garlic chili butter YUM!) she came around and took our dinner order. 

I got the pot pie, which was amazing, and my husband got the grape flatbread - delicious. I ordered a lavender/black currant cider, which I cannot stop raving about. It was sweet and light, I kept thinking it was a sangria. We followed up that beverage with the sparkling mead - it was an interesting flavor, and effervescent, by the time I went to swallow, it had already turned into bubbles. Highly potent to boot.

All in all, it was a potentially disastrous day that was handled with professionalism and speed. If japantown is taken over by foodies, I would definitely do this again.
