Only negative is that they seem to have rounded up everything that was on the bill, which made our meal ~$20 more than I had anticipated. Kind of a downer, but things happen I guess?
author: T M.

description:
Quiet possibly the greatest place to take a date in the city. Edit for hyperbole but you get the idea. This has to be one of my favorite places in the city and had to give them a proper yelp review finally. The combination of atmosphere, cost, quality of food and drinks make it a no brainier five star that anyone venturing in the Fillmore area should try.

The highlight of Fat Angel for me is the food. It is a relatively small menu but everything on it is worth taking a shot at. The areas they excel in are the salads and the flat-breads. I had never encountered this combination of flavors before I came here and was shocked they could get such quality food to come out of that small kitchen. 

Seriously all four salads are delicious. My personal favorites being the kale salad and the endive salad. Also the portions on the salads are HUGE. They should be shared by two people and shouldn't even be attempted by one person. They aren't expensive and will fill you up. The Flat breads are even better. Every time I look at the menu I want to try something else but I always, always get the roasted red grape and walnut flat bread. It is just so savory and a perfect combination of sweet and salty. I rely on my date to order one of the others so I can at least try it but it is a halfhearted attempt at best. 

Another positive is the service time. The turnaround on food is one of the best I have had in the city and the quality is always consistent. Shout out to whoever is back there whipping up the food.

By this time you are completely full and realize you haven't even gotten to the main dishes. I have had the sliders and the mac and cheese which are both great as well. The mac and cheese is very spicy so be forewarned if you aren't used to that. 

This place also holds its own as a bar as well. There is a stuff drink menu with plenty of options for the beer aficionados. The wine is pretty varied as well but may not satisfy the wine heads of SF. 

The customer service is great at Fat Angel as well. With easy pay at the bar and personally calling you when your table is ready are great perks. 

Also full disclosure I am in love with the bartender/waitress.I don't know her name but she has short hair and tattoos and is the woman of my dreams.  I am sure she is married or taken but I am professing my love for her here. 

The negatives that could knock off some stars for others are just how small Fat Angel is. It is a really tiny and intimate place and can get crowded on most nights by around 8 or 9pm. I am talking standing room only at the bar and freezing your butt off by choosing to sit at the outside tables because nothing is available inside. Be prepared for a wait time but its never too long. Also the small place leads to some really really close table set ups. You are in the other couples conversation no matter what so be prepared for people watching as you will be two inches from someone else. 

Fat Angel may have an odd name but as one of my first introductions to social life in SF I couldn't have had a better experience. The service has not dipped in the three years I have been in SF and I would venture to say it won't when you make your way out there as well. 

Fillmore has a gem that serves a perfect wine and candlelight home with food that leaves you coming back for more. Also if you know the waitress tell her she is awesome and has a fan club. This is the place I suggest whenever dinner is up to me so I am sure I will see you there.
author: Nick R.

description:
Tonight I went to hop into my car and found my window busted and my stuff ransacked. So I was sad, called all the people I needed to call to report everything, taped it up, and then needed something to calm me down and lift my spirits. 

A friend had told me he'd had a really nice evening at Fat Angel the other weekend, so I made my way over and snuggled up to the bar. I was one of those annoying people who wasn't sure whether I wanted a draft Syrah or draft Stout, so I made the bartender help me figure it out. Star #1 is for the fact that they had both draft Syrah and 2 stouts (among other fantastic drink options), and Star #2 is for the sweet bartender who was patient enough to help me find my way to a fantastic stout that hit the spot.

Wanting to eat my feelings -- but just a little -- I then made the bartender help me decide between a cheese plate and a butter plate. I went with the Chocolate Cinnamon butter with toasted bread, which earned Star #3 because it. was. perfection.

Star #4 is for the ambience. I felt totally comfortable writing birthday cards to family and friends while sitting at the bar with my stout and butter. Laid back, not too pretentious -- unless you were one of the fancy pretentious people there, then I guess it could be your scene, too. What I'm saying is, the place is as fancy or low-key as you wanna make it, which I really appreciated.

Star #5 is because I left so happy that I almost forgot about my busted window.
author: Theresa P.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. The atmosphere is great and cozy, the service is good and their menu looks really appetizing. 
However, I have subtracted two stars because of the food. We ordered the baby kale salad and the prosciutto flatbread which looked very promising. Th salad was drenched in dressing which made it very salty and heavy. The next dish - the flatbread was even worse. The cheese was definitely the main ingredient and it was so much that you can hardly taste the bread or any of the other ingredients. If you are a relatively healthy eater like me, I wouldn't recommend the place.
The only reason I would return to to the Fat Angel is for a drink - its still a pretty nice place for a glass of wine or beer.
author: Mirela S.

description:
Date & Time:  Friday February 5, 2010 @ 6pm
Dining Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Good Mix of  Unpretentious Neighborhood Peeps Dining Solo & Couples in North Face Vests
Vibe:  Casual & Charming    
Music:  Cool Mix of Alternative & Jazz- Sarah Vaghn & Etta James 
Decor:  Rustic & Cozy.  Candle-Lit,  Wooden Bar, Ornate Chandeliers, Train Station Benches, Leather Club Chairs. 
Service:  The Owners are Nice, Genuine & Earnest.  The Best Ever.
Imbibe:  Extensive Wine List.  We had Beer & Espresso to Top off The Meal
Devour:  Complimentary Homemade Cured Olives, Bread Served in Lunch Bag, Plate of Sopressata & Hot Coppa w/ Housemade Jelly & Nuts, Chicken Pot Pie, Sliders, Mac & Cheese
Total:  $53.65
Note:  My Top Pick
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
Had this place bookmarked for a while, finally had a chance to try it Thursday 5/3/12. Walked right in with a friend of mine around 7pm.  Nice dark and intimate atmosphere; perfect for a date, or catching up with an old friend.  

I'll cut right to the chase. Here's what we ordered...

-House Olives $4
Simple marinade of olive oil and maybe garlic. No variety, only the green olives not pitted. Where my Kalamata's at?! Got very redundant, needed more herbs. 

-Maple bacon butter w/ bread $4.50
Some wheat bread and maple bacon butter. Maple Bacon butter was interesting. Overall meh. I was sold with the maple bacon butter. 

http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/5Y4U38GnSAnCCilmu1FYMA/l.jpg

-Wipeout Lager 23oz $8.50
Nice full bodied dark beer. 

-Peter Brown Ale 23oz $8.50

-Sliders $10 for 3, we added $3 for 1 more. 
Delicious!! Bun was soft, bacon, caramelized onions, aioli. Came together so nicely, best slider I have ever had, hands down.    

-3 cured meats ( duck salami, speck, chorizo)  $15. 
Duck salami was melt in your mouth, chorizo was a bit oily, but the mustard and bread countered it nicely. Had to ask for more mustard, they only give you a small half dollar sized dollop. Tons of those little baguettes.  This was perfect. 

http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Ki2pbk7yjAcndoxGFaDo0Q/l.jpg

Conclusion: We ordered a lot, since it was our first time, we wanted to get a taste of everything.  Next time I come back, which will be very soon, i'm going to order the sliders, 3 meats and a few beers.  Skip the apps, olives, bread, go straight for the good stuff! 

Total was $58.05 for two, before tax.  Quite reasonable, given how much we ordered. I definitely recommend this spot.    

http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/pQB3F47NBrCFblW-qKVJJg/l.jpg

-1 star for the waitress explaining to me that butter is churned milk.  I won't go into that, but thank you; I now know what butter is.
author: Randy N.

description:
CUTE PLACE!

I have always wanted to try this place and I'm glad I did for my bday. Definitely small so try not to go with more than 4! We had 6 ppl, which is doable but pushing it, especially if you are going to be ordering lots of things!

A memorable beer for us was the Witch's Wit! Yummy and light.
Chicken pot pie was yummy. Mac n cheese was ok.
Flatbreads were yummy, the one with grapes and walnuts was good.
we had the meat and cheese platter. good nibble food.
maple bacon and philz coffee butter, interesting!

would definitely come again with a group of girls or just the bf!
author: Christine M.

description:
There are so many reasons why one might not go to Fat Angel: it's small and popular, which means finding seating might be impossible for groups of more than two; it's really more of a bar than restaurant, so if you expect to meet for dinner here, you might leave hungry after a few strips of prosciutto and a bite of Mac and cheese; parking in this neighborhood is horrible; and  you might accidentally buy a $41 bottle of obscure holiday beer.

But there are also many reasons why you should try this place out anyways, such as the great, cozy atmosphere and extensive wine and beer offerings. But most of all, go for the service. I've never seen such warm, helpful, unpretentious servers in such a trendy spot. They'll seat you without your whole party, practically rearrange the entire restaurant to accommodate a group, and never pressure lingering guests to leave, despite the constant demand.
author: Susan S.

description:
I was here with my friend exploring new restaurants. We decided to give it a shot since the restaurant is always packed. We ordered a chicken pot pie, pizza and wine.
I love their chicken pie, so creamy!! And the pizza is so crunchy! If you are a wine drinker,  you have definitely drop by here!
author: Joanna H.

description:
OH MY DEAR.

Went here last night around 6:30 before a show at the Fillmore. Completely impressed and completely DEPRESSED at the fact that I never knew this palce existed!

We got some great beers--i got a sour something--i know this is awful but i don't remember what it was--my bf ordered it for me. Beers were good but nothing compared to the food--we split everything:

3 cheese for $14
-Truffle Tremor (My favorite--so good!)
-Vella Dry Jack  NorCal hard cow--like a sharper Jack cheese, also very good
-Some kind of Gouda--also delicious
It came with a nice jam pairing and organic crustinis

GREAT DEAL AND SO DELICIOUS

Mac n' Cheese - gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano  $11
This was delicious and the breaded topping was great as well! The pasta was a perfect texture too

3 Sliders - beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli  10
Holy Cow these were tender, juicy, and that aoili sauce has crack in it i swear. Was a little sad that it came with 3 sliders and i was with 2 others so I could only eat one....

All in all, a great experience but I would definitely recommend getting there before 630/7 because it got PACKED while we were sitting there.
author: An-Nhien L.

description: Stopped in for an after dinner drink. Really nice draft and bottled beer list with local favorites and some other rarer craft beers as well. The place is very small so I was relegated to standing room at the bar. Met some folks who were also out of town (like I was) visiting their son. Food looked scrumptious but I did not have any. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Would love to return for dinner someday.
author: Steven J.

description: Dat cheese plate doe.  MMMMM.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I happened to walk in this bar and wine place. This is quite a cozy joint and the staff is super friendly.
They have a good selection of beer and wine. My friend and I tried their Cab Sauv, Cab Franc and Pinot Noir. It has pretty decent wine selection. They ate basically known for their 100+ beer selection.
We did not get to try their food.
The place has a little outdoor seating. The environment is quite casual. And the staff is quite friendly. Did not get to try the food but will definitely give it a go next time.
author: Kirandeep K.

description:
**GOOD COMFORT FOODS AND GOOD WINES**

Perfect place to grab a few bites and quench your wine thirst before hitting an 8PM performance at Yoshi's.

Small, comfortable, and chill.

Flat breads, sliders, and mac cheese were ordered. 

I liked the flat breads the best. Thin, flavored well with the gourmet cheese and mushrooms.

I had a refreshing Reisling which went well with the small plates.

The staff was friendly and efficient. 

Food came out quickly.

It was not a wine bar. 

Beers and other appealing cocktails were also on the menu.

Check out the overhead chalkboard for ideas and specials, too.

RECOMMEND for FILLMORE.
author: Betty N.

description:
THE GOOD
-Ambiance is fantastic. I love the decor and it was really warm and cozy.
-The mac & cheese was awesome. By far the best thing we had. 

THE BAD
-I don't know my cheeses but my date was not impressed with their cheese selection.
-This place is incredibly small and they don't take reservations so be prepared to wait a while.
-Street parking is a bitch. 

THE UGLY
- I had to ask for my Pimms Cup three times. They forgot completely the first two times I asked.
- I'm 95% sure I left my favorite scarf here and my date called them a million times during their open hours and it took them days to finally answer. No scarf to be found. 
- Worst bread pudding ever. It was doughy and tasted strongly of flour. It was disgusting.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1094.

A good place to come by for a pre-dinner drink and / or snacks when you are in the area. Or if you just ate and want somewhere to go and chill.

We were waiting for our walk-in table at State Bird so we decided to grab a glass of wine and some appetizers here. They have a good selection of wines and a variety of cured meats and smaller dishes.

The vibe was casual and the place was quite busy. A small place but with enough tables and chairs in addition to a bar seating area and a few outside seats) that are in the back of the street makes it a great place to avoid all the foot traffic outside but bustling inside.
author: T L.

description: Cozy? You mean cramped. But overall, I get you and your charm, Fat Angel. I like your vibe and taste generally. Portions are wowzers generous on their menu items, from the massive (and delicious!) kale salad to the mac'n'cheese plate to the flatbreads. Because the libations menu is so large, I won't comment much more than saying you're bound to find something you like to drink here: a hearty beer, a sophisticated wine, etc. Check the chalkboard atop the bar for what's happening, or ask your server about what's on draft. Finally, this restaurant doesn't take reservations, by the way; snuggle in early, or wait in a line. Also, only one bathroom for everyone, staff and customers.
author: Allison C.

description: This place is really close to my apartment, which is already a big plus. But the chicken pot pie is what really gets my attention. So delicious! And very pretty on the plate, too. Aside from the pot pie, I also got some slices of bresaola as a starter. The bread they had to go with the meat was good (not amazing but solid). One of these days I'm going to go back and try the Mac and cheese... but it will be hard to turn away from that pot pie.....
author: Farah F.

description:
Fat Angle turned our ordinary Thursday into an awesome Thursday. Service was great, beer selection - amazing, food - delicious. We couldn't have asked for more.

They don't take reservations but we only had to wait 10 minutes to sit at the bar. The beer list was a comical mixture of modern day brewing but the bartender was great with recommendations and tastings of ones I was interested in.

My wife and I have eaten here twice now and haven been let down. A kale salad and chicken pot pie made for a perfect dinner on a cold rainy day or any day. Thanks Fat Angel. Until we meet again.
author: Mike C.

description:
This place has great rustic food: e.g. mushroom flatbread, spicy mac and cheese, and beer selection is beyond. My friends said the wine selection was also great. The server gave us samples and talked about the types of beers as we were trying to figure out what we were wanting. It's a mellow, hip and smart crowd.

There is an attention to detail here that makes Fat Angel worth regular visits to explore the menu.
author: Kelli N.

description: Cute little spot we stumbled on after being chased out of 1300 Fillmore by a rude hostess and a terrible prix fixe valentines menu.  Great selection of beers and wine, all reasonably priced. Food was great. Waiter made a mistake with the timing of the food so one came out way too early, but was kind enough to take one meal off the bill which was hugely unnecessary but greatly appreciated and noted. Would recommend this place for some drinks to anyone in the area.
author: Jess Z.

description:
I can't comment on the food because we just came to grab a glass of wine before our dinner at State Bird Provisions. 

Very nice selection of wines and beers. If you're in the area and need a quick sip or a few hours of quench thirsting to accomplish, Fat Angel is worth the visit.
author: Binh D.

description:
Hidden, low-key, small wine bar I really enjoyed. 

Cost to worth it rating: 3.5 (~10/glass)
Return worthiness: yes

Highlights:
- Atmosphere: more like a coffee shop or a pub than a wine bar cause there wasn't a hint of pretentiousness. It's just a comfortable spot to grab a seat at a bare wooden table and enjoy a few drinks. 
- Selection: good for both wines by the glass as well as beers
- Descriptions: conversational personality infused in the text using words anyone can understand. Categories like "Chubby and Satisfying" and "Bright and Juicy" were fun to see. 
- Pretzel: warm, soft, and salt

Lowlights: 
- Hidden: unassuming on a side street of Filmore. I wouldn't imagine it was such a cool place, but I did my standard yelp check before I walked in and gave it a try.

I'd love to come back and spend more time drinking here as well as getting to try their food. Mac and cheese was calling my name.
author: Eve K.

description:
I thought they had happy hour but I guess not and they don't serve food until 5:30. 

We came here early knowing that we have slightly a lot of people and the place is small, I mean really small! 

I'll admit, the food was really good. I especially enjoyed the pot pie and the sliders. The Mac and cheese was a bit spicy for my preference. 

You may wonder, if I enjoyed the food so much, why am I only giving it 2 stars? Well, let me tell you, it's because the waitress was lame!! She was not friendly at all, when we asked her for some opinions on beer since it was our first time here, she seemed a little annoyed but nothing too obvious. Although, her true colors came out later. I understand that it was a Friday evening and it was quite busy in there, but like I said, this place was small!!! When I was literally waving to her for her attention, she just kept not looking our way at all and we took up like 1/5 of the place! She had ignored us multiple times to the point where we were gonna just walk out and not pay our bills but that's not the kind of people we are. Instead of trying to catch her attention and waving our arms around like idiots, we just went up to the bar to pay. She basically ruined our nice experienced here with her lack of service.
author: Mimi P.

description:
This place is fantastic. Came here randomly a few weeks ago. A friend and I had been searching for another wine bar, but when we couldn't find it, we stumbled upon this one instead. The selection of beers was very impressive, but what caught my eye - and captured my heart - was the fact they have WINE ON TAP. Let me repeat that again.. Fat Angel has WINE ON TAP. I thought draft wine only existed in my version of heaven.

Anyway, we had to wait quite a long time to be seated, which is perhaps the only downside. It was a Wednesday night. It was around 8. And it was packed. Just elbowing our way to the bar to put our names on the waiting list was tricky. We must have been lucky to arrive at exactly the same time as everyone else, because by the time we were seated (well over an hour later) it was no longer so crowded. But they have WINE ON TAP, so I was content. As for the food, we ordered the 3 cheese plate, the chorizo meat plate, the asparagus flatbread and the sliders. Being generally gluten free, I passed on the breads that arrived with our cheeses and meat, and the kitchen was (kindly) able to serve my sliders with lettuce instead of buns. Everything I ate was super tasty, and my friend enjoyed his flatbread too.

Just about everything here was fab; the decor was fun, the bar staff friendly, the servers attentive, the food yummy, the drinks flowing. I just would have liked to not have had such a long wait. Especially on a weekday (we didn't leave until almost 11:30). But you can't knock a place for being popular, especially when it's this good.
author: Allison B.

description: This place ass delicious, had a good atmosphere and a friendly staff!  They have about 200 types of beer and fantastic champagne!  Also, the food is fresh and the chef amazingly prepares masterful creations in a manner that was super yummy!  Thankfully we were able to walk in as they don't take reservations!  We got in with just a 25 minute wait at 6pm but the wait was much longer while we were slowing served!  SO DELISH!!!
author: Garrison S.

description: Maple bacon butter was amazing! Spicy Mac-n-cheese, too. Great atmosphere and service
author: Dawn H.

description:
"Fat angel" Yeah, stop thinking about cupid, and start thinking low-fi date nights,
That's what I think of it, this place is a great place to "wet your whistle"
which incredible 

Around happy-hour right before the sunsets it's kinda romantic in a smokey,
antique type of way with it's various wooden seats and cramped decor
which reminds me of the 1960's revisted, and place like this looks like
it deserves Whiskey, or some single-malt scotch in your glass.

I enjoyed the prosciutto flat-bread and the Macaroni and cheese
I split with my friend, she drinks more than I do, so the service called to her bidding, with thier Huge list of Drinks!

I personally, Had the Pinot Noir 
2011 Lupe-Cholet 'Comte de Lupe'  Bourgogne, France...
I can taste the lovely rasberries it has some bite to it and It was amazing with the Mac and Cheese!
 
Also there was this delicious "Pumpkin Like Porter" called
the "Imperial Chocolate Pumpkin Porter   Anchorage, Alaska  (651ml)"
In which tasted like "Pumpkin Pie".

I was astounded by the selection.
The service was pretty decent, but didn't really stand out,
(I guess they don't expect punk kids like Myself to have money?)

We made it in time for happy hour so our curiosity got the better of us...
I'd go back here when I'm craved an awesome list of Libation,
as far as service...I'll let you pass this time!

Just Because I think you title is a reference to A Jefferson Airplane Song!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9A7jM-7bNYs
author: Michael R.

description: This place has an appealing ambiance and countless varieties of wines, beers and bar-food. The cherry on the cake is the service. Our waiter was great, I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was attentive, a little hard to understand, English was definitely a second language for him, but he was very pleasant. I especially liked the Mac n Cheese, it was wonderfully creamy and rich. My friend had the trout and he said it was the best trout he ever had - well, to be honest I think it was the first time he had trout. If you are into trying different beers I suggest that you visit this place. The service is spectacular and the atmosphere is nice. We enjoyed our visit a lot. We hope to be able to go back soon.
author: Jillian P.

description:
I'm either too cheap or too poor to give this place a full five stars. Came here on a Saturday around 6:30 with four other friends. The restaurant is pretty small, so it took a while for them to be able to seat our odd numbered group. We had initially come here for outdoor seating, but the outdoor tables are best for groups of two or three so we just went inside, which was fairly loud because of the acoustics of the room. Sort of works for the vibe of the restaurant, just don't plan to have any intimate conversations here as you'll have to talk fairly loudly for your friends/date to hear.

We ordered the mac & cheese (yum), chicken pot pie (my choice favorite of the night), endive salad (delightfully huge portions), prosciutto flatbread (meh, kind of small and not filling but it'lll be hard to resist ordering one so my review probably won't mean anything to someone who's read this far), and a single cheese (this was the first item to come out and it's safe to say everyone in my group was disappointed at the size of the cheese and the bread). Personally, I was thinking that for $5 I could buy a huge block of muenster cheese and be pretty happy with that.

Overall, it was a nice place to try but I wasn't made into a regular. I feel like the food menu is overpriced by $2-3 for each item. But if nothing else, we did come to the conclusion that we should throw our own wine and cheese party at home, so I guess this place is good for getting the social creative juices flowing
author: Melissa T.

description: For a beer bar, this place has a soup-nazi like seating policy. They won't seat you unless your whole party has arrived, even if you party is of 2 people only. That is just inhospitable - they would rather see you standing there even if there are tables than actually sit down. Then again, hospitality is not a strong suite of the new generation of San Francisco hipster bars. For a much better and welcoming service (and live music) try Sheba Lounge round the corner.
author: Evg R.

description:
CUTE place. NICE wine but those barstools HURT your butt if you plan to sit at the bar for a longer period of time :) 

It is small so the layout is compact but I got there right at opening for wine with a friend. Bartender was super nice, and friendly.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Perfect for a drink and some appetizers on a weeknight. 

I had their arugula flatbread which was excellent. It's tad loud inside, but the patio has heatlamps.
author: Devyn R.

description:
I live in the East Bay and although it takes me an hour to get from home to Fat Angel, I find myself here more often than any other bar in the city. 

Their bottle selection is more extensive than any fan of craft brew could hope for, and their draft list is always inspired and brimming with something to suit all tastes and moods. 

Combing knowledgable beer servers, and a moody and intimate atmosphere, Fat Angel is the sort of place where one pint can quickly turn into four and a casual conversation can grow into a real friendship. It is a place like no other in San Francisco and should not be missed by anyone.
author: Mitch C.

description:
Last night on a spontaneous whim, we arrived at Fat Angel for the second time.

Got their Sangiovese by the glass and was recommended by Derek the bartender to pair it with flat bread. This was Heavenly!! 

Loved the combination of roasted red grapes, walnuts, really yummy prosciutto & gorgonzola (which was Not over-powering at all!) Cannot wait to try their other flavors.The flat bread itself was like a thin crust pizza.. perfect with wine or beer because you're not overloaded with carbs after!

Really excited to go back to try their Chicken pot pie (which sadly was sold out when we arrived!) .. as well as their spicy mac & cheese! Just writing this review makes me want to go back NOW! :D
author: Amber S.

description: Love it! Our waitress was super helpful and gave us some great recommendations. We tried two beers, bread with garlic chili / honey butter, and the mac n cheese. Everything tasted amazing and the portions were more than enough. Fortunately we got here ~15-20 minutes before the crowd started coming in; there's outdoor seating but I loved sitting inside enjoying the woodsy and candlelit ambiance. I promised myself I wouldn't try the same restaurant twice while I live in the city but I might just need to come back!
author: Jamie B.

description: Great spot for a date or to catch up with some friends. Atmosphere is cozy and warm. I tried the spicy Mac and cheese and one of their flatbreads, both of which were delicious. It's not out of this world mind-blowingly amazing, but I definitely recommend giving this place a try.
author: Charlotte P.

description: Very cute place, with a great selection of beer and wine. Can't wait to come back.
author: Max N.

description: I don't have much to say that hasn't been said already, but wanted to add my voice to that of so many others who are raving about this place.  Not only was the food excellent, but the service was amazingly professional and over-the-top friendly; we'd almost go back just for the service.
author: Richard A.

description:
The food is ok, but the drink menu is extensive. I tried the maple bacon butter, wild mushroom and truffle oil flatbread with pecorino cheese, and the chorizo meat platter. My favorite was the butter.

Service was ok - they forgot the meat platter. But the wait staff generally don't bother you - you could chat with your friends for hours, and you won't get kicked out.
author: Rachel H.

description:
I absolutely love it here. This is such a cute gem in the neighborhood that it is. It's small, so be prepared to wait on a busy night.  The decor and ambiance is great for a romantic date (after dinner or even before for light snacks and drinks), and it's great for a few friends just to hang out.  Completely low key but uber chic and cute.

The drink list is super intense, and quite extensive. It takes some time to navigate it.  i saw other people eating salads and they were huge. We got the mushroom flat bread which was completely divine. The mushrooms were fresh and so fragrant. There was the right amount of cheese just to give the salty and nutty taste.  We also got the sliders which I am still dreaming and drooling over.  They were the best sliders I've ever had. They were juicy and fresh. Love it!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Ohhhh, sweet darling Angel... you have wine on tap . Good wine. And every inch and ounce of this place is lovely!! Sweet, darling Fat Angel, will you marry me?

The wine on tap thing is a novelty that some bars will make you pay dearly for. Fat Angel offers up an affordable full glass. Never say cheap. I need not go on about the bread and butter you should order. By the way, I never *ever* say you should order bread and butter. In fact, I would normally never say the bread and butter that is given to you gratis in most restaurants is something worth filling up on. So, trust me on this one. 

What really made this place for me, though, is the hospitality. The place was packed and I walked in with a rather large group that would have flustered the best of 'tenders. I shockingly embarrassed myself (/sarcasm) by leaning on the wall and making the lights go from kindly dim to harsh and bright... I know, I know, how dare I? The lady bartender fixed the problem without issue (if it were me, I can't deny there'd be some snark involved). By the way, this same bartender told us that we were a beautify group. 

I might add that this was *after* the brightening incident. 

Fat Angel, you are, so so very fat...if by "fat" you mean generous in spirit.
author: Joi B.

description:
The mac n cheese and chicken pot pie are to die for! Hadn't come here in at least 2 years, so coming back to try my once favorites was a great reminder of how good the food is! These two dishes were so dense, that the prosciutto flatbread was just an afterthought. I would do without the flatbread next time. We all thought the Zinfandel was the best out of the Reds tasting.

Seating is random. We were told a 45 min wait but it ended up being 20-30 min. We sat at the bar. They are very particular about where you sit and stand when waiting for a table, so it's really hard to get a drink when you want it. I love intimate spots but it's a little too small for the demand of the place!
author: Jeanne C.

description: The best Mac and Cheese in SF.  Also incredible Maple Butter, make sure to order that as well.  Staff took great care of us.
author: Rob B.

description:
Overrated and overcrowded. No plans to go back. My gf and I just wanted a drink to figure out where to eat - maybe here, maybe elsewhere - due to getting shut out nearby. Drink menu is pretty robust, and our drinks were good, though not fast.

We checked out the menu, given to us by the bartender, but then...we couldn't order for 10-15 minutes. He'd literally talk to other people and not look at us. Should we have yelled, or made a scene? Nope, we just paid for the drinks and left. 

Pro move: arrive early if you want a table, especially if a show's playing later that night at the Fillmore. No reservations available and table management is suboptimal.
author: Mike H.

description:
Butter. They have multiple kinds of butter. And bread. And wine on draft. And those butters? They're flavored. Lemon caper sage, Garlic chili, Maple bacon, Chocolate cinnamon & Honey.

It's classy, it's sassy and the owner's easy on the eyes and hyperhospitable. It's a little fancier than your average bar but you'd feel comfortable here in something you'd wear to a nice dinner. No need for the little black dress thought it's a perfect date place. After all, if you find a dude you can eat straight butter with, he's probably worth keeping.

They also have cheese plates, fried capers and other apps that look outstanding. Pair them with a hefty pour straight outta the tap and your night is made. This is a place I find myself telling people about again and again. Dear Fat Angel: Please come to Austin.
author: Kelly S.

description: LOVED the fat Angel burger and prosciutto salad. They had happy hour before 7pm with cheap cocktails and pizza while still delicious. Venue is beautifully decorated with cosy and various choice of sitting and the 1920's music just makes the whole experience more glamourous. And you must try the Carvo (caramelised vodka) as dessert drink... Nothing like the usual cheap sugary drink you had when you turned 18... Had a great experience plus the bill was surprisingly cheap (less than $40 per person). The place is new and still building up their clientele but really worth a try. I'll definitely go back.
author: Amélie S.

description: I asked the barmaid to hold my credit card but not to run it. When I was checking out they ran my credit card. It pisses me off that they did this. Now I have to watch real closely because I really just wanted to pay cash. Watch out!
author: Alex A.

description:
I would like to give Fat Angel 5 starts but cannot. Matter of fact, 1 is pushing it. Being a bit of a hard ass, you bet. 

Scenario. Sunday night dinner date, in fact last night 3/16.  I've had only wine at Fat Angel with a GF and loved the space. Cute, charming romantic. I was out with my BF and wanted to take him out to dinner.  I wanted to try the food at FA but the stuff prevented that from happening. 

OMG, confusion and chaos. There where only 2 people handling the bar and tables. Serious mess, matter the fact, the male server said as much, he used the word confused.  We took 2 seats at the window and the same server questioned why we took those seat. We were standing for nearly 10mins, waiting for someone to smile and greet us but that never happened. As we began to walk out, we then caught the attention of the woman at the bar who asked, how many we said 2, she said take the window. Realizing that getting served was going to take some time, I got up and looked at the wine list on the wall hoping to get a bottle and chill a bit. That didn't happen. I stood reading the menu and was completely ignored. I tried to get the bar tenders attention, it never happened. I sat down, waited a bit more....we then decided to leave. 

Both the bar tender and only the server were struggling, communicate was lacking.

 Restaurants have off nights, people have bad days. There was no excuse for lack of service. We did not have an expectation of any sort; we didn't complain, or appeared to be entitled. We just wanted to sit down, have dinner and enjoy the evening. I'm glad it wasn't a birthday or anniversary night, that would've truly sucked.
author: Lorna R.

description:
Get the mac & cheese and the sliders! The mac & cheese is big enough to share and has a delicious breadcrumb/bacon crust and the sliders are so tasty! Perfect with the jalapenos. 

If you're a pinot noir fan, definitely try the Ministry of Vinterior pinot-- smooth and delish!
author: Chrissy L.

description:
Went in early evening on a Sunday. Three of us split mac and cheese, mushroom flatbread, and sliders. 
Service was great, ambiance pretty nice, many other customers seemed to be on Ok Cupid (or similar) dates.
Flatbread was more of a cracker bread thing. It was ok. Sliders and Mac and cheese were very good. If I go back, next time I'll get a salad because they looked really great and the portions were giant. If you eat what I ate here too often, you'd definitely be a fat angel.....
author: El B.

description:
This is the spot if you love good food and good beer. The bartenders are very knowledgable, I've loved every suggestion they've given me. The food is inventive, from fried capers (OM NOM NOM) to an excellent pizza I had with mushrooms and cheese. 

I love to stop there on my way to Sundance Kabuki, but I have to admit that I usually end up wishing I hadn't made other plans because I'm having a great conversation with someone at the bar. Also beware of huge crowds when there's a show at the Fillmore. Pick an off day, and you're all set.
author: Alison J.

description: Friday night drove by looked like Fat Angel had a good vibe. We went in and had great cocktails and the best Margarita pizza, lamb and polenta chips. Great service and great for date night x
author: Juliette B.

description:
For bar food, this spot is great. Try the butters, very yummy, I had the lemon and capers and it was delicious. My friends tried the bacon butter which looked liked foie, and they claimed was finger licken. I'd pass on the flat bread next time or try a different style, we had the mushroom and it was super oily. The Mac N Cheese was very good, not overly cheesy and very peppery which I like. The mousse was ok, bread pudding was more like a cinnamon roll or thick french toast and good. The fact that they have a large beer selection, dessert wines, and a large wine menu for a bar is a definite plus. The decor is hip, love the diverse crowd, it was getting busy when we left at 6pm on a Sunday. Can't wait to return. Hope to see more spots like this in the Fillmore.

Two drinks, a bunch of food, and tip ...3 people, we each paid $40. Could easily have a drink and share a salad and keep it under $30 for the total.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Cozy little spot that if I lived closer to I'd visit more.
Picked some nice wines and noted their great beer selection, I need to go back and try more beer.

Had assorted charcuterie and cheese selections and they were good- but the only problem was they didn't bring what we actually ordered. We ate for a few mins then asked the waitress which of the 3 meats was which and then she realized the mistake. The same thing happened to the table next to us w/ their cheeses and another table as well. The flatbread we had ordered came out much later than we had hoped- we almost forgot about ordering it. It was good though.

Not a big deal, but worth noting that they have some minor kinks to work out.
author: El T.

description:
Cozy is the best word to describe this place. Something about dimly lit restaurants that play just the right kind of music in the right volume level just makes you feel very welcomed. Either that or it was the *vast beer and wine (draft, too) menu that made me feel all warm inside, ha.

We checked out this place on a whim and though it was small -- and there was a wait, it was worth it. Tried the Spicy Mac&Cheese which was an absolute winner. Tried Finnochiona salami for the first time, loved it..

There's at least *2 pages worth of reasons to come back to this place, and that I'll do, hopefully sooner than later.
author: Av A.

description:
A decent wine bar for non-wine guys. but a great place to meet up with friends or go out with your special someone.

still, I think Amelie edges it out. Granted, you must get to Amelie earlier/during their amazing happy hour if you have a group of 4-6 while Fat Angel has a little more leeway.
author: Mike V.

description: I LOVED this place!  Everything about it, location is walking distance for me, the decor is inviting and well done, the extensive wine/beer selection and numerous wines on tap (ah-mazing!!), the food (totally my type of smaller bites and fresh salads/flatbreads), the service (the guy that kept coming over was literally the epitome of amazing service-friendly, attentive, funny, etc).  We came in earlier on a Saturday night (around 5) and by the time we left at 7 there was a pretty solid wait for tables.  I will 100% be coming back to grab some wine/bites with my girlfriends/boyfriend/solo.  such a great find!
author: Raina D.

description:
This place is really rad. I'm sitting here relaxing on a sunny and lazy Saturday afternoon. I was a little miffed at first that they only have snacks before 5pm. Some really awesome beer on tap helped smooth that over. And the pretzel was tasty. 

Now, I'm eating some of the best mac and cheese in my life and feeling like all is right with the world.
author: Monk F.

description: Ordered the tap wine blended red, well rounded with fruity notes: delicious; old stock ale bottled beer- if you love chocolate...whoa get this. Had our server pick out 3 cheese/meats- our favorites were the smoked prosciutto and bison salami. Maple Bacon butter= amazing. Overall small space, loud ambience, refined foods. So impressed.
author: Lauren O.

description: Great beer selection & delicious butters. However not a fan of the other food they have to offer. Also felt a little rushed. As soon as my group stopped eating the waitress brought us over boxes and asked if we wanted anything else. 2 of us (only 3 of us in my group) still had full drinks we were enjoying & we had only finished 1/3 of the 5 share plates we ordered. We only spent a total of 45 min at our table. I hate being rushed like that. If I go back it will only be for beer and some delicious butter. Will keep you posted (if I return) on the service. Hopefully this was not the standard for their service.
author: Ginger G.

description:
Seems crazy to pay that much for appetizers and beer when in Japantown. 

Another just ok place. The massive beer selection is pricey, and the appetizers are tiny.  We left hungry and without a buzz. 

Service was good, earning the place a 3rd star.
author: J. M.

description: Chicken pot pie, chicken pot pie, chicken pot pie!  The best ever!  Along with an outstanding beer list, delightful wine selections, cheese plates and charcuterie boards, this place is far, far better than the State Bird...seriously
author: Vince C.

description:
Went with girlfriends before seeing a show at the Fillmore. Loved the location, super easy to grab some bites and walk over to the show!

Loved the decor/ambiance. When we arrived, the tables were full, but the bartender told us to grab a seat outside and the next table would be ours. A waiter took our drink orders, and had them waiting at the table for us as soon as it was ready.

I had the sparkling chardonnay blend (REALLY good)
and chardonnay on tap (okay)

We split a few things family style - prosciutto flatbread (super delish), maple bacon butter (so-so), sliders (good!), and the waiter encouraged us to split one of the salads - we chose the pear/endive - and it was my favorite item of the night! (REALLY, REALLY tasty). 

be sure to double check your bill, after a couple of glasses of wine each, we nearly missed that we had 2x$19/glass of wine on our bill that were not ours. they quickly fixed our bill, but we nearly missed those pricey add-ons. 

the service had ups and downs, bartender was great, female waitress was great, expeditor/busser was great, but the male waiter seemed aloof and annoyed. 

still, i'd definitely go back, and have a feeling this place will be one of our go-to's for pre-concert drinks!

also, for some reason, looking at the restaurant on the map in the yelp app showed it around the corner from the Fillmore, however when I clicked in the app to have it give me directions via the iphone maps app, it took me a few blocks away. we knew where we were going so rerouted ourselves. but something was a bit wacky with that.
author: Kimberlee G.

description:
LOVE this place. small. dark. simple. a ton of beer selections. an easy menu that you can't go wrong with. cheeses, charcuterie, flatbreads, mac n cheese, and chicken pot pie. all things that pair well with beer, of course. 

the bartender wants you to drink something you enjoy and will talk you through their libations as well as offer you something different if what you've got isn't pleasing.

be prepared to wait some. at 815 on a wednesday we waited about 20 minutes. not too bad but i'll bet it gets worse at varying times in the night and on different days.
author: Regina C.

description: This is my favor spots to hang out with my frds, love the interior and the food! They get the best Mac-n-cheese! Also chicken pie! So bomb!!!!!!! They get a lot of beer! It's awesome! They also open a new place call stones throw! Check it out too！
author: Alicia S.

description: Love the place, the beer list, the rotating taps and the super amazing staff. And the food is pretty good too! It can get kinda busy during weekend evenings, though.
author: Marcelo V.

description: Fat Angel never disappoints. It's the perfect place to come and grab beer and wine on tap or sit down for a quaint meal. I recommend getting a salad and flat bread to split with someone. The salads are huge and scrumptious. Very well priced!
author: Caroline L.

description: Glad we found this place! We came by before a movie at the Kabuki, and we started with some wine and a little charcuterie and cheese plate. SO good, and large portions. Then we got a kale salad, and were presented with a mountain of it. We really could have ended our meal there, but I couldn't get my mind off some comfort food like their mac n cheese or chicken pot pie. Unfortunately.. the pot pie just wasn't good. It first came out lukewarm, then when they said they'd remake it, they def just microwaved it bc the "crust" then came out soggy. Sadface. That said, the server/bartenders are wonderful and make amazing recommendations.
author: Vivian H.

description: Had a really fun time here. The service was attentive and excellent, the beer and wine selection is great and there's titles to the different types of wine, helping you choose your match. The place is tiny but comfy. We only tried the pretzel and bread pudding foodwise but it was decent. A bit pricey. I would give it 4.5 stars but not a 5 so lets say 4 for now.
author: Mashav S.

description: This place could easily become a favorite of mine.  Great food, chill atmosphere, and friendly service.  Had the kale salad which was so good I would order it again.  It is also gigantic and absolutely for sharing, as is everything else on the menu.  The mushroom cheese flatbread was perfection and thin like flatbread should be.  The Mac and cheese was also delicious and had a nice kick to it.  They lose a star bc the bread pudding was not good and was clearly microwaved before being served to us.  Skip dessert and you're golden.
author: Debbie L.

description: Love this place! Great vibe. Beer list extensive! Food is good too. It will be hard if your in a big group (4+).
author: Sean H.

description: Love this local hangout; I remember when the place was empty and we were all thinking, "Gosh hope they pull it off." I guess they did because I couldn't even get a seat the last time I was here with less than a 75-minute wait. That's great for them, but I wish they'd remember the good old days and get me the same seat I used to sit in, on the old church bench actually, against the wall. Miss their great flatbreads, wine, apps, and epic beer. Congrats guys!
author: Brian J.

description:
We were looking for a place to eat before we caught a show at the Boom Boom Room.  After yelping it out, we settled on Fat Angel.

Got here around 9:30ish and panicked because we were super hungry and didn't see anyone with food!  However, we were assured we could order food and promptly ordered some flatbread and sliders.  Everything was excellent, including the wine on tap we just had to try.

Ambiance was great - just like the little corner restaurants that are nice but a casual hangout all the same that I love so dearly.  I could easily see myself hanging with my friends or hubby at a table and grabbing drinks.  Makes me wish I had a place like this in my own 'hood!
author: Patty M.

description: You walk out feeling like a fat angel (a mix of bloated, whimsical inebriation). Which I think is what they were going for. Great location and food to match!
author: Maggie S.

description:
My boyfriend and I were going to a concert at the Fillmore, and we wanted to grab dinner beforehand.  The options of Quickly, Popeye's, or Panda Express (all also within a block of the concert hall) were not tempting us, and then, hidden around the corner just off Fillmore we found Fat Angel.  We checked out the menu and it looked fabulous, and a quick look at Yelp showed us 4.5 stars overall.  We were sold. 

When we showed up at about 7:45pm on a Friday night, the place was PACKED.  Every seat in the house (even outside, where it was cold) was taken, and we put our name on the wait list.  We each ordered a glass of wine, and were seated before we finished them.  The staff seemed slightly overwhelmed by the number of people, but they did a good job of handled the chaos, were knowledgeable about the menu when we had questions, and overall we had a very pleasant dining experience.

My wine, a Syrah/Cab blend from N2, was delicious and complimented the food perfectly.  They also have a very unique and diverse beer selection, and I greatly enjoyed reading the humorous and informative descriptions on the menu.

Food we ordered for 2 people, and left stuffed:
- Smoked Trout Salad with Horseradish Vinaigrette: Could have used a few more pieces of trout, but was seriously good.  After devouring the salad, we had high hopes for the rest of the meal, and were not disappointed.

- Flatbread with Gorgonzola, Grapes, Walnuts and Prosciutto: Super thing and crispy bread was just thick enough to support the deliciousness on top.  The combination of flavors was amazing.

- Charcueterie of Duck Salami, Wild Boar Salami, and Sopressata (see picture): Served with warm thinly sliced bread and whole grain mustard, the meats were amazing.  We both agreed that the duck was the winner, but all were really good, and I thought about sneaking the mustard home with me, it was that good.  

We were too full to order dessert, but plan to come back soon and save room to try either the bread pudding or blueberry cobbler.  I only wish this restaurant were closer to home, as it was amazing.  In fact, it might very well be my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco, and those of you who know me know that I do not give that title out to just anyone.  :-)

Happy 1-year Anniversary, Fat Angel.  I wish I'd known about you sooner, but I will certainly be back for more!
author: Lindsay B.

description:
This place is way cool.  It's very intimate with no more than 10 tables inside, they have draft wine (say wha?!), a pretty extensive beer list, and great food.  The service was a little slow but it was probably part of the experience.

- The mushroom and white truffle flatbread was just delightful, I could come here by myself and chow down on that.  
- The mac and cheese was great but a little heavy, even for mac and cheese. 
- The cheese plate was fun and came with all sorts of cool jams but my party disliked more cheeses than not, no regrets though.
author: Alison L.

description:
At this point I've eaten everything on the menu at least twice. And I have plans to eat it all at least twice more in the near future. Perhaps the biggest way I can point out how much I love this place is just by the sheer number of check-ins you see above this review. In fact, Sir Nicholas and I had our picture taken and adorned on the "regulars' Christmas tree" over the holidays.

I think this might be love...
author: Tiffany N.

description: I am so glad I brought my family to this spot. Everything you can find at Fat Angel that defines  a good date are here: delicious food, wine options, and the ambiance. MUST TRY the CHICKEN POT PIE... DELICIOUS! A def must go!
author: Mary S.

description: I love this place. I've been coming here for years and it never disappoints. The food is amazing, staff is always helpful with libation recommendations and the ambiance is perfection. Beware- this place is in high demand and it's not very big. I avoid peak nights, but that goes for most places in the city. They've got a good thing going and I always look forward to coming back.  P.S.- The asparagus flatbread is heaven. I always get excited when I see it pop back on the menu.
author: Shawna Q.

description:
I don't get up to the city often enough, especially around dinner time, but when I do it takes some convincing to NOT go to Fat Angel.

Bajillions of beers (if you like that sort of thing). The best sliders I've ever had. Chicken Pot Pie to kill for. I'm starting to salivate.
author: Chris B.

description:
The food was just ok. The black truffle butter had zero flavor, the bread was burnt, and the duck salami (which was a pâté?) was super gamey. The soft sheep and the bacon kale salad were nom-a-licious, though, so our mouths were overall happy.

But...the beer selection was phenomenal!! 

My bf and I love sour beers and there is only a small handful to choose from, even at the most fancy places, in Dallas, where we're from. This place had at LEAST 30 to choose from! And that doesn't begin to scratch the surface of what they have to offer. Even the stuff on tap looked fascinating.

The waitstaff were super friendly hipster-types and know their stuff, too.

This place is a must for beer aficionados. Go!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Hands down my favorite bar in San Francisco. It helps to be friends with regulars, not going to lie, but even if we didn't have the inside scoop, I'd still like it here. 

They've  got it all, unique beers, wine, and delicious food. Speaking of food, I feel that at this point that I've tried most of the menu and it's all delicious, but the real stand-out is the smoked trout salad. Jesus tap dancing Christ, that smoked trout is the most delicious fish ever. I want to buy a case of that smoked trout and eat it everyday. My fiend described that salad as "an orgasm you don't have to work for". It's that good and it's SALAD.

Moving on....

Beer selection is top notch and changes regularly as does the wine but I think they have certain bottles that are always on hand. The decor is pretty cool too, they have a lot of pews from an old church, which adds a naughty element as you indulge in booze and rich food. 

My only criticism is that it gets really crowded and it can be hard to get a table as it's not a very large place. They do have some outdoor tables (with heat lamps) but it's nicer inside. They seem a little disorganized when it comes to seating as well, so if you don't want to wait around, I'd suggest coming early. Whatever though, I'd probably wait an hour for that trout salad. 

5 stars for the food, the drinks, and the fun I've had here 
3 stars for the organization/seating
author: Iska B.

description:
Fat Angel is one of those quintessential go to spots.

The spot you go to on a date.

The spot you go to - to catch up with a friend.

The spot you go to with some friends.

The spot you go alone to - to unwind.

It's darling in every way. From their warm, yet mellow lighting. To their homemade infused butters with flavors like maple bacon and garlic chili. To their wild mushroom and truffle oil flat bread. To their heavenly delicate Cremant d'Alsace Brut. To their great music. To their kind and helpful staff. To their charming booth seating. To their late hours.

Fat Angel is that spot. A reliable respite from it all. A charming haven for long gazes. Long talks. Even long card games.

Late at night - when you're with someone - or with a group of people - and don't want the night to fade away - hurry on over to Fat Angel, grab a seat and let the comforting ambiance and impressive drink and small bites list - carry you softly into the evening.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
So really FA gets a 3.5, but I rounded it up because the servers were very nice, and the inside decor is cozy cool (if you don't mind that there's a giant animal head, attention PETA/vegetarian folk - next to the lovely chandelier). 

Selection of beverages was wide and quirky, with various kinds of wine, beer and mead.Pours are small -- $12-15 for a 1/3 filled wine glass of mead... Note that spirits aren't served here. 

Menu is very ecclectic bar food. Food is pricey for what you get for the most part. Only salads are large, tasty and reasonably priced. Trout salad excellent. But spent $13 for 3 small sliders with maybe 1/16 pound of meat on each, with the thin patties charred to toughness -- also came out bone cold.  $5 pretzel was overbaked and bland. They don't serve chips, fries or beans or rice, etc. 

Outside is best on a warm day as the tiny heaters outside aren't strong enough to actually warm anything up, and there is no awning/side panel to hold in what heat there is. Will be back, but just for drinks and maybe some greens.
author: Kate A.

description: I never knew this place even existed.  It is nice and cozy.  They have a lot of beer options and French style cocktails.  The waitress was nice and we had a bar table in the front so we could people watch.
author: Chris L.

description:
This is a great spot to check out early, as in right after they open because it's small and popular, which means a long wait. We arrived about a half hour after opening and grabbed a spot in front of the roll up window. The service was friendly, but SLOW and during the time we were there, the place filled up to the point that the one waiter and waitress appeared to be underwater. 

The menu is small, but well edited and complements the ginormous beer offerings. 

The romaine salad with fried capers was huge, perfect for two. The caesar dressing packed just enough garlicky punch and the fried capers provided a salty tang. 

The assortment of bread and flavored butters was a nice change and not something seen on many menus. The maple bacon butter paired with Firebrand bread was sublime. 

Great little spot for beer enthusiasts who like to not just imbibe, but also eat well.
author: Lee H.

description: Awesome staff. Spilled wine on my hand and gave me a free glass she spilled on me. Really cool atmosphere. So many beers and wine and Mead. Yummy pretzels
author: Neal L.

description: Great gastropub/small plates and drinks eatery off Fillmore. The venue is not large so come early if you can. Great charcuterie and cheese platters, small plates, nuts, olives and nibbles. Many choices of good quality beverages - wine, beer, cocktails and coffee. Most of the food is high end comfort food. Definitely a new choice for us for small nibbles and a quiet drink with visitors. Limited choices in large plates/entree so maybe not the best for a date night scenario, better with a group of friends sharing. Service was pleasant and attentive.
author: Amaya B.

description:
Minus one star for being crazy expensive.

That said? Great food, great beer choices, and funny, kind, and helpful staff. I enjoyed the mac n' cheese immensely. My husband's chicken pot pie was good (he says) and my sister enjoyed her endive salad. My brother-in-law had the sliders and he seemed to find them agreeable as well. They had a wonderful selection of beers but it was just way too expensive for me to go for, so I settled on having one cocktail with dinner - the Pimm's cup, which was delicious!
author: Molly N.

description:
I loved the small setting and warm decor, except for how long it took to get seated or to get anyone's attention to order a drink at the bar. I ended  up only being able to get a drink when our party of 4 was finally seated after long wait because I just couldn't get a waiter's attention before that.

That being said, everything else was wonderful. My Duet IPA was delicious and served really cold, as it should be. The baby kale salad and flatbreads were fresh, innovative flavors, wonderful. Service was friendly if not super attentive. Would be 5 stars if not for the long wait with no drink service.
author: Molly K.

description: Can only speak for the drinks here.  Great beer selection and great place to kill time while waiting for your table at State Bird.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
HANDS DOWN best service I've ever had!

The BF and I had just got done biking the golden gate bridge... and we were craving some good food and drinks... put back on those calories we had just pedaled away. 

Of course SF was freeeeezing! But as soon as we got inside - we were warmed up! Not too hot, just perfect! We got lucky! The house was full - but a minute after we arrived a couple had just left so we scored some good seats!

I started off with the Riesling. A nice light fruity crisp wine. Yummy yummy. After 2 glasses I was definitely feeling warmer!

We ordered the Firebrand sourdough baguettes with cheese & meat. The platter came with spicy mustard, some fancy smancy jellies and sauces, and nuts. The server was so nice! I had no idea about the types of meats - I don't normally eat this type of food. But I'll definitely start! He gave us a break down of each type of meat, how it was seasoned and processed! 

We went with:
CHEESE: 
Vella Dry Jack   hard cow
Roaring Forties Blue   semi-soft cow

MEAT:
Salami
Hot Copa

AND on top of that! The server felt bad because our plate was accidentally given to someone else (we didn't even feel the wait was that long). SO he hooked us up with another cheese and meat on the house!

Chorizo
Truffle Tremor  soft goat

The Vella Dry Jack was my favorite! It was dry, but in a good way! The truffle tremor was good too! A bit strong, but very tasty! Especially paired with the yummy sauces  and the spices in the meats! I loved all the meat! It felt like so much food! But we ate pretty much all of it!

I was planning on this being a starter, but I was so full! We ordered the chicken pot pie as our main entree - and as soon as we got the dish I had to make room for it. A different take on the traditional dish. It was served in a bowl - so it had the appearance of soup - with a square shaped crust placed on top. But with a nice surprise! As you eat the dish - you will find more crust on the bottom and sides of the bowl! The crust is my favorite part, so I was happy! Yummy chicken - thick soups full of veggies, carrots, sherry, & tarragon.

Once we were absolutely full we hung out. Finished our drinks. It was really nice. The setting was perfect! I wouldn't have wanted to spend my last night any other way. I wish we had one of these places in Hawaii. Great for intimate settings - or just to hang out and catch up with the friends. Warm, cozy, clean, nicely decorated. Part of the drop ceiling had beautiful copper tiles with chandeliers hanging from it. There were lots of different types of lighting, 
chandeliers, candles, track lighting: the combo of all of them spot on!

I'll admit the drinks were a bit pricey. But not too bad & the experience I had made it all worth it. 

I definitely recommend it!
author: Megan R.

description: Solid spot to grab a glass of wine or beer (on draft!) and enjoy some appetizers. We opted for a plate of various meats/cheeses, one of the flavored butters, a salad and a flatbread. After about 15 minutes, everything had been devoured. Really enjoyed our experience, and can't wait to return for more!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Too expensive for average pilsner and lackluster service. There are way better, more fun and cheaper options. 

Now if you're crazy enough to want to wait out at Fat Angels while in 90+ mins queue outside State Bird Provisions (that's just around the corner), then this place is your only choice. 

Either way it's a lose/lose game. Ridiculous. No thanks!
author: Sam M.

description: GREAT bar if you're looking for something a bit different, during the day or for HH. Right around the corner from some great restaurants. Full bar but even better beer and wine on tap. They have seating outside and wide open windows when it's nice out. Their cheese plates and pretzels a great value. I haven't ordered much more but the rest of the food looks good. I saw a family waiting for food they had ordered once, which is always a surprise at a bar!
author: Wendy K.

description: Great beer and wine selection!   Super cute casual nice ambience. Local neighborhood spot. Food was excellent as well. Simple and yummy. Fresh.
author: CR L.

description: Really chill spot... Came here or hh at 5:30... O problem getting a table.. By 7:30 this place was packed! Started with their fried polenta fries... So bomb! Their Mac n cheese has a lil kick to it and it was soooooooo good :)  one of the best around! I'd definitely go back for the Mac ... Also try their flat bread n chicken pot pie! This is a perfect lil place for great food, wine n catching up with friends!
author: Stephanie C.

description: This little hole in the wall is spectacular! My boyfriend and came to San Francisco with high hopes and dreams,  but those dreams died when we realized how San Francisco is very dirty and smelly and most of all is anti-military!  You better think twice when Godzilla attacks. Anyway after walking for a good hour we ran into Fat Angels.  This place is so perfect from every piece of writing on the blackboard to the red thread wrapped around the silverware. The place was full of great food,  beer and fantastic service.  The flat bread and bacon butter was to die for! The place is very hipster, but it's worth it!  The place is small and could be crowed at times, but every place has a time of day when it's a little more quite.  Highly recommended.
author: Taylor W.

description:
Wandered in here on an impromptu date night. Atmosphere is great-- organ pipes, mounted deer head and a chandelier-- I'll take it. We didn't have a reservation and it was a Friday night. The hostess took our phone number and said she'd text in 30 minutes or so, when our table was ready. The "new beers" chalkboard almost scared us off-- $30 for a beer? But they have a lot of more affordable options among their extensive drinks menu. 

The place is small, very small, so if you're waiting for your table on a busy night be prepared to be in everyone's way the entire time. Or, stand outside like we did. Luckily, our table was ready in 20 minutes.

We squeezed into the corner table with our order already ready. A prosciutto flatbread to start, pork sliders and the chicken pot pie to share. We were expecting "fancy place" portions but were pleasantly surprised to find fantastically midwest portions. We stupidly filled up on the flatbread, leaving only enough room for 2 sliders for him and 1 slider for myself. We took the chicken pot pie to go and enjoyed it the next day for lunch. Absolutely delicious. Best I've ever had. Wine, beer, appetizer and two entrees? Less than $50 and enough for lunch the next day. 

We'll definitely be back!
author: Hazel J.

description:
Awesome neighborhood spot!
Excellent wine selections. I had a glass of the Carmel Valley Chardonnay and it was crisp and delicious.
The food is great too. I highly recommend the trout salad and the mushroom flatbread...yum!
author: Teryll H.

description:
I'm always a fan of great food, great beer and reasonable prices!
The beer selection is extensive, and everyone working there seemed very knowledgeable and willing to answer questions. 
The food was shareable, so we tried several things and really liked what we had.

We started with the polenta fries, which were crispy on the outside and soft and delicious on the inside. I liked the mayo sauce, but the herbed ketchup was a little strange. 
We also got the truffled mushroom flatbread, which was good, but I would've liked a little more cheese and a little less salt.
The sliders were simple and delicious. The meet was juicy and the cheese was melty.
Our last dish was the mac and cheese, which was also delicious. The cayenne added a kick!
I would definitely go back.
author: Cami J.

description:
I'm writing this review simply because I was blown away by the service. Derrick managed to find the PERFECT wine for me, even when I had a very specific request. Plus he was funny, so extra bonus for him. 

Plus, the beers were awesome, the mac and cheese was amazing and we just had an all around good time.
author: Jill C.

description:
I was so excited to try a new place but sadly I will not be going back.  The service was deplorable.  After my friend and I ordered food and one drink each, we never saw our server again.  Actually we did see him taking other tables' orders, he just never bothered to check in on us.  Didn't check to see how we liked the drinks he had recommended, didn't check in once we got our food, didn't notice our empty glasses, didn't notice our swiveled heads looking for someone to help us.  It was like our table had ceased to exist.

We managed to flag down a woman that i believe was the bartender and she happily got us another round of drinks.  As we were waiting for those to arrive, we wondered aloud why we bothered to stay for a second drink

The food was almost as unimpressive as the service...
We ordered the cheese plate and the sliders.  When it was delivered to our table (by someone other than our server) there was no explanation of the three cheeses on the plate.  They were yummy tho! The sliders were fine, but the meat was teeny tiny... lift the bun for a good laugh!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
What a beautiful place! Though it is tiny and you'll most likely end up in a line, this place charms you like none other.

LOVED the flatbread, mac n cheese, and salads. Chicken pot pie had a strange taste, which was the only disappointing part. Beers were good, and their "wine on tap" selection was good, too.

Go early to beat the rush!
author: Susie S.

description:
Fat Angel is a craft beer gastropub that is the perfect blend of artisan fanciness and casual garage grunge. It's difficult to describe, but very pleasant to experience.

The list of craft beers, both bottled and on tap, is phenomenal. Being an avid IPA drinker, I was blown away by the IPA selection here -- ordering three different IPAs and loving each one. I can't wait to try all of the beers here; challenge accepted.

The food is definitely better than your average gastropub, but nothing amazing.

--------------------
FOOD:

Flatbread w/ Mushroom & Truffle Oil: This is a dish that's excellent upon first bite, but gets progressively worse as time cools the cheese. I mean, you can't really go wrong with mushroom and truffle oil on anything, so the taste was definitely there. When the cheese hardens, however, it just tastes stale. Sidenote: I spread some duck liver mousse on it and it was incredible.

Pretzel: It was okay. I wish there was another sauce than mustard.

Cheese Plate w/ Duck Liver Mousse: The duck liver mousse was excellent. When spread upon the bread (or the flatbread), it gave me a faint glimpse of what I loved most about foie gras before the ban. 

--------------------

Fat Angel is an excellent joint for beer enthusiasts. If you love craft beers, then you really can't go wrong with this place. Even if you're a craft beer newbie, the knowledgeable and friendly bartenders here will lead you in the right direction. If you're not a beer lover and you're looking for excellent gastropub fare, you may be disappointed.
author: Roy C.

description: My friend and I grabbed a quick dinner here on a Sunday night. It was still pretty crowded, so we sat at the bar. I got the wild mushroom and truffle flatbread with pecorino and he got the mac 'n' cheese. The food was just okay--the flatbread was over-baked and too hard, and the mac 'n' cheese had way too much paprika or whatever was on top. The service was friendly but inattentive--we had to wait quite a while for our bill, despite sitting right at the bar. The noise was also a tad loud even with the windows open. Overall, glad I gave it a shot, but I think the greatness was lost on me since I didn't order anything to drink.
author: Josephine L.

description: MAC&CHEESE!! Ceasar salad!! Wine is great! This place is a hidden gem.
author: Kate M.

description: Great for drinks they have amazing wine on tap and small plates.  Great place to wait for state bird.
author: Ribec F.

description: Fat Angel is always REALLY crowded during happy hour. It is a really small place that cannot accommodate a lot of people and we had to wait over an hour for a table. They have a great selection of wine and beer and a unique food menu. I enjoyed the flatbread with tomato, spicy sausage, arugula and parmesan but was not a huge fan of the spicy mac n' cheese. I recommend checking this place out for drinks if you're in the area.
author: Nikitha R.

description:
This is a cozy spot with a handful of tables in addition to window and bar seating.   Contrary to other reviews, we arrived later and didn't have trouble getting a table.  I did seem to fill up and clear out in waves though.  The vibe was laid back and intimate.  It is a great place to relax with a drink and good company and conversation. 

They had an extensive beer and wine selection.  They also had wine on tap (!!!!).  It was reasonably priced and delicious.  The service was also very attentive and friendly. 

We didn't try the food but we certainly did a lot of ogling of others' plates.  We will definitely be back to try the sliders and mac & cheese.  And of course, more wine on tap.
author: A. M.

description:
Soo good. There's really not much I can add here that hasn't been said. Fat Angel came recommended to me by several different people. My roommate and I were just waiting for the right time to make our visit. We live in the area and were lucky to come in around 10 and get seated immediately at one of the tables in the corner. Contrary to some of the reviews here, I found everyone who worked there to be really laid back and friendly. One of the servers even stopped everyone during dinner to announce that two veterans of the establishment were recently engaged. The place is small enough that it's intimate but without seeming exclusive, which is probably why it manufactures so many regulars.

And of course, the drinks. Definitely the most extensive collection of craft beers I've ever seen: the menu had about 8 pages of beer and wine, one page of food, and then another page of wine. I wanted to try a beer from the Bruery but wasn't willing to splurge quite yet and opted instead for one from Pretty Things. I also tried a cheese plate and the smoked trout salad based on the reviews here and wasn't disappointed. 

Despite the quantity and deliciousness of the food, this is still a bar at heart, so it makes for an interesting inversion of your typical dinner. Simply by the way the menu is set up, you find yourself ordering drinks with a side of food, and butter with a side of bread. Next time I'm trying the chicken pot pie or the flatbread--just need to wait a while so I don't seem too eager.
author: Jacob S.

description:
Went once and will definitely go back.
What a great selection of beers!  The food was delicious as well.
Our table of five ordered beers off the beers on tap.  We were very happy with our selections.  My only feedback is, the menu location isn't the most central. From where we were sitting, it wasn't viewable and it wasn't made known that there was a beer on tap option.  Needles to say we were a little concerned at the price of the bottles since not everyone in our group enjoys the same style of beers to warrant sharing a bottle or two.

We also ordered the following food to share:
-  Mac n' Cheese with gruyère, cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, cayenne.  The spice was perfect and the texture was awesome.  
-  Flatbread with roasted red grape, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola.   Great combination of flavors!
-  Flatbread with tomato, spicy sausage & arugula w/ parmesan.  Again, great flavors, can't go wrong.
-  Chicken pot pie with roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon.  It was decent.  Not the best pot pie I had ever had but certainly satisfying.
-  Sliders with beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli.  They were OK but I'd defiantly try other menu items for some truly delicious food. 

Overall, I really was happy with my experience.  I would come back for the ambience, the outdoor seating option, the selection of pretty amazing beers and some delicious food.
author: Rachel G.

description:
WOW- what a gem! Cask wines and beers, in addition to several beers on tap! Cozy, intimate ambiance, super casual and hip. Was a perfect place to grab a beer before dinner at State Bird!

Interesting neighborhood...but I guess lower Fillmore is up incoming so that makes sense.
author: Meredith M.

description: I noted a severe lack of angels, fat or otherwise. Besides that, the food, wine and beer were all top notch. My girlfriend in particular was surprised at how good the mustard was. She actually exclaimed out loud.
author: Rodney Y.

description:
Cozy pub with amazing selection of beers. Don't let the pub theme scare you away; the food is great! There is limited indoor seating, some bar stools, and a few sidewalk tables. Service was pleasant and efficient.

We had the pesto flatbread. Cracker-thin crust is crisp and chewy - exceptional. Toppings were all excellent.

Chicken pot pie was good comfort food though I prefer the Liberty Cafe version

Enjoyed an Iduna Cru with the meal and look forward to sampling more of the beers.
author: Brad B.

description:
Romantic, delicious, rich, make-faces-like-you're-in-heaven kind of restaurant.
