description: Brilliant place. The beer selection rotates through but they often have some absolute gems. Love the flat breads and the mac & cheese. This is one of my gotos for a great beer and some good food.
author: Jim S.

description:
One word: Awesome.  In a city chock full of divey after work bars, this is my favorite happy hour place in the city.  

Love the vibe - unpretentious, interesting but not distracting decor, and always lively after work but not over-the-top rowdy.  Love the drinks - the ever-changing draft beer selection is always interesting (maybe 10 beers total - just tried the Hop Wallop, very nice), the beer and wine bottle list is pretty long, and prices are reasonable across the board. Love the food - try the flatbreads, fancy mac n cheese, and the olives - all varying levels of bad for you but oh-so-addictive.  

Only a couple gripes with this place - the location is a bit sketchy and the food menu, although pretty tasty, is short and never changes.
author: Rosers M.

description: The kale salad is amazing, and you don't need to add chicken (it's a little dry).  It was massive and enough for two people.  I wouldn't mind going here every day and sharing that kale salad with someone.  The chicken pot pie was good, "esp because of the tarragon" (quipped my very picky chicken-pot-pie-eating friend).  My wine was like a Pinot Grigio and excellent, they have "draft wines".  Great little neighborhood restaurant.
author: Terry K.

description:
Super small, but cute wine bar. 

Great menu, superb presentation on all dishes and even down to the wine bottles they serve your drinks in.

Excellent service and an overall cool vibe.
author: William C.

description:
Dear Yelpers, I know it's been a while since you heard from me but don't ask where I have been and why I did not write. I guess I just don't want to talk about it. It's not you - it's me. 

Maybe I would tell you more if you were to to take me to Fat Angel and ply me with one of the 10 percent micro beers or a couple of glasses of the surprisingly full and well-rounded wines ON TAP! 

After all it would seem as I write here that Fat Angel is the cupid that has brought us back together. She may be the new baby in my life. 

And if the liquor were to get the better of me and I found myself giving away too much, I could order from the fantastic cheese selection or warm olives or tangy asparagus flat-bread both to douse the liquor and my tales. 

But mostly, I would be telling you what a great "find" the Angel is - though from the excited chatter of the lively clientele, it would seem that others have found her before me. But I won't let that stop me from visiting her again - I am sure we will have a long healthy relationship as my go-to place for meeting friends on the way to the Fillmore and Yoshi's...
author: Kingpin X.

description:
Extensive beer list (quite impressed). Kickass bread pudding. 

I wish I had come here with a bigger appetite. My friends got the sliders which looked awesome, and they both seemed to devour it pretty quickly. They came with jalapeños, so that already is a win for me. I had just the bread pudding with a glass of red wine. Simple and delish. 

The environment itself is a charming little old school wine bar. Really not anything fancy, but the food speaks for itself. Will probably rate it 5 stars after sampling more menu items.
author: Syp V.

description:
Cool interior, 
Yummy food, 
Good beer!
author: Sophia Z.

description:
I was meeting a friend for some drinks and food and we planned to hit a few spots in her neighborhood.  We ended up at Fat Angel first for a glass of wine and a flat bread mushroom pizza.  Service was eh...something about the server girl slapping down our two menus on our table to start of our first impressions of the place.  I'm sure she didn't mean anything negative because she did slap them down with a smile.  

Our wine came off their tap, and the pizza came out quick and efficiently.  I can't complain about their food; it was delicious and a good start to our food/drink happy hour crawl.
author: Rosalind S.

description: The place was pretty small but cozy. Great beer selection. There had to be like 150 different bottles. A lot of different wines too, but I can't comment on those as I know nothing about wine. Small food menu but it's all pretty good. My only complaint is the pricing. Their beer prices were pretty high, and for some of the more rare beers, they had an even higher price increase.
author: Brett N.

description:
Loved the place, loved the food, loved the beer, very nice waiters too, never had to complain once. 
What I liked the least was the Host's (Owner or Manager) worst ignorant kind of attitude : not a "thank you" nor a "bye" nor the slightest appreciative smile as you'd leave, whilst he's the one making profit out of you! o_O Let your customers leave with a bad last impression is definitely not how you do business! 

I may give it a second chance, just in case he'd prove me wrong...
author: Exalt V.

description: The food was good, the service - not really. The server was snotty while we ordered, then got our order wrong. Since she never came back to check on it, we ate what she brought. It took three tries to get a drink. Their beer list is amazing, but I didn't get mine until my meal was nearly done. Our check arrived with the beer; we had to ask about a dessert, and it seemed an irritation to them to bring it. First time there will be my only time there. There are far too many places in the city to try for bad service a second time.
author: Sheila K.

description:
Stumbled across this gem on Friday after dinner at Dosa on the Fillmore. 

The name threw me off when looking for a spot on Yelp but once we looked into the bar, we need we would love it. The intimate space has a small bar, dim lighting and seating along the far wall and lined across the front windows. There was outdoor seating as well but being San Francisco, it was too cold to sit out there. We scored a random cozy table in the middle of the restaurant. It ended up being a little traffic-y as waiters and customers would have to walk past us to get in and out.

The menu is simple and conducive to sharing. Selections of cured meats, cheeses and breads are the primary items. I was cursing that we had a lackluster meal at Dosa just 30 minutes prior as I wanted to try some of the great cheese choices they had.

My brit husband was in heaven with their beer selection. When the barman brought over the book of beers, his eyes lit up. He ended up getting a craft draft beer which was offered as a 16 or a 22 oz. The wine menu looked good but I wasn't in a vino or beer mood. Upon the waiter's recommendation, I ordered the pimms cup and it was so refreshingly good. There are cute quotes on the menu and I like that they included 'hetchy hetch' priced as free on the drinks side. 

The crowd was a mix between girlfriends, first dates and married couples. I like communal/family style meals so the idea of ordering a couple of plates and sharing over some bottles of wine is ideal.

Perfect spot for date night, intimate snack/drink with small group of friends.
author: Seema M.

description: The spiced cider drink was good, the Shit that Killed Elvis was awful (as promised by the name I guess) and never got to eat...waited 1 hr 15 mins and bolted. Place needs more seats, or a cattle prod to get people to eat faster and turnover tables faster. Lame.
author: CJ D.

description:
Fat Angel did not fail to disappoint at all.  My friend kept raving about the food, the wine and the ambiance, and we hit the spot up after a light meal at Epic Roasthouse. 

The place is kinda small, but I like that--warm and cozy. The lighting is dim and has a candelit feel to it. They have windows that open up for air circulation or cooling down the place on a hot day.  Outside seating is available but impossible during the cold windy night I visited. 

The flatbreads, Cy's nuts, and maple bacon butter were solid.  I'm not a wine connoiseur, but one of the servers was extremely helpful with my other friends who wanted particular wines. 

Service is solid and delivered w/a smile.  As mentioned, servers were knowledgeable about the wino and offered great suggestions. Also, they always appeared at the right time and definitely checked in to see how our party was doing.  Bonus points in my book.
author: Michelle W.

description:
A first for me - 2 updates.

Thank you for serving brunch on Saturdays now because I always end up at Farmer's Market at noon:thirty not having had much more than water since waking up. So I buy all this food, but I am too hungry to walk 3 blocks home to cook it. And there's Fat Angel heralding to all with his trumpet that breakfast is served beckoning with door and windows flung open.

A few weeks ago I had the traditional Ploughman's lunch - meat, cheese, bread, pickles, mustard, fruit, and a beer. All I have to say is that what ye ask for, the universe shall provide. Last week, I had coffee dripped straight from heaven trickled through a Sightglass (sorry Blue Bottle - I still love you) alongside an egg baked over brisket. It's nice to chat with the bartendress at this time, too.

And you get to be serenaded by the strings of the live jazz band that usually plays during the market. All they need to do is add a harpist. 

I've also now had the desserts and just about everything on the food menu except for Cy's salty sweet Chinese nuts. Nope, I've never had dose nutz.

Which brings me to one of my favorite quotes about our fair city:

Most people believe the afterlife is one of eternal bliss. The only thing I've never understood is why my devout San Francisco friends are invariably so reluctant to get there.
                                                        --- Art Hoppe

If you knew me, you'd know I wasn't so devout in that sense, so while I'm aware of being on this plane, I might as well spend as much time as I can in places that bring me more bliss than I already feel just living in the city limits. Please forgive me for taking so long to give you the last star (if they even matter).
author: Myla A.

description:
The food was delicious, fresh, flavorful, and unique. We got a couple of cured meats (hot copa & dry chorizo) & a cheese (Pantaleo Italian goat), the roasted red grape, walnut, & prosciutto with gorgonzola flat-bread (!!), Mac n' Cheese (gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano reggiano -- a little spicy!), & sliders (beef, caramelized onions, bacon, cheddar, aioli). And, of course, a bottle of red wine--draft style. Quality surpassed my expectations, trendy (& loud) atmosphere, plus loads of drink options.

My only peeve: Got here at 6:45 p.m., left at 9:45 p.m., and not necessarily by choice. We didn't exactly have one server (more like 4) and honestly, we felt a little forgotten. Despite the lack of consistency and communication in terms of service, I will be back. Not the best choice if your intention is to have an organized dinner, but it's great for drinks & snacks.
author: Briana F.

description:
The food I had in Fat Angel was pretty good! I felt so lucky to have ordered chicken pot pie, it was incredible delicious!!! The crispy pie was filled with tender chicken, and creamy potato soup, tasted really good! The price came out reasonable too. 

The ambiance was good to people hanging at the bar as a group, but maybe a little bit loud to sit at the tables. But generally for the service we got, I'd give Fat Angel 5 stars!
author: Tina Z.

description:
Fat Angel? Love.

This little wine/beer/cheese bar is right up this gal's alley. Hearts... big time hearts.

A fantastic ambiance that didn't seem to be trying *too* hard. (Chill, dim, relaxed and cute without the whole "we're going for a thing" thing.) The bathroom? Spacious and clean and some kitsch and I really liked it. (Don't laugh... bathrooms are important, people!)

The wine offerings? Fantastic. I immensely enjoyed the Grenache/Mourvedre blend I had... and on tap, to boot! (Cooler than the other side of the pillow? Methinks so.) Brut Rose? Yes please. AND a pretty solid beer selection. You're doing it right, Fat Angel.

Maple bacon butter and bread? Yes please. 

If I lived in SF, I'd be at this spot more than I'd like to admit.
author: Rachel F.

description:
My husband and I stopped in on the way home from work and were pleasantly surprised! We knew to expect good things after seeing the glowing reviews on Yelp, but sometimes you never know.

We lucked out and got there just in time for happy hour! They have deals on wine, beer and their flatbreads. The beer/wine list is very extensive and quite impressive. There's definitely something for everyone!

The flatbreads are awesome. We went with empty stomachs, so one was not enough. We ended up with two! The grape/walnut/bleu cheese was pretty kick ass, the flavors all worked together really well. We also tried the olive/asparagus/pine nut one which was also really yummy. The crust was thin and crispy--just how it should be!

The interior is pretty small (but perfectly quaint!), so get there early to grab a seat! We were able to get a table, but I would have loved to sit at the bar. It was full, maybe next time.
author: Marit S.

description:
06.04.11

Cyrick = friendly, animated, and overall awesome.  Thanks for serving me the sauv blanc on tap even though I had my "fake" ID ;)

We had the chicken pot pie, mac and cheese, and the mushroom flatbread.  Each were wonderful in their own way, but the chicken pot pie is in a category of greatness by itself.  Throughout the meal I just kept exclaiming "this is the best chicken pot pie I've ever had".  No joke.

And wine on tap...what a concept.

I'm SO coming back.

Total damage for three: $63
author: Jenny L.

description: I don't think I could say enough good things about this place. From the stunning curb appeal to the 5 star service that awaits inside. Everything about this place screams "San Fransisco" and embodies everything we all love about the west coast: A great vibe with perfect ambiance,  a extremely knowledgeable and friendly staff, amazing food for vegetarians (and meat eaters, don't worry!) and by far the best sour beer I've ever had. By far my new favorite spot in San Francisco! Recommend to all locals and anyone passing through!
author: Elis R.

description:
Found this place when looking for a place to grab a bite before heading to see the Kooks at the Fillmore. Yelp came through for me with this place.
Awesome beer selection on Draft and epic bottle selection. Also the flatbread pizzas were delicious as we're the charcuterie plates! I'll be back!
It's a purty small place, so you should probably get a resy if you plan to go on the weekend. Our show was weds nite, so still busy, but no worries getting in just for 2 peeps.
author: isaias J.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised by the food at Fat Angel.  This is a great place!  It's small and intimate, but it wasn't at all noisy, at least not when we went there.  

It has a casual yet upscale vibe to it.  I don't get out to this part of the City much anymore, but If I were in the area and looking for a place to eat, this would be it.  Much more than 1300 Fillmore, or Yoshi's, etc.
author: Dave N.

description:
I had some of the best beer I've had in a while here last night called SOS- it was their Fat Tuesday special. Even better was that they served it to us in 23 oz dark plastic cups, which came in handy later. They also have a good looking wine list, that I definitely want to come back and try! I heard their food is yummy too, but I didn't get a chance to try any of it. The ambience inside is super cute, with a friendly crowd and a helpful bartender. 
This place is definitely a winner in my book!
author: Sonya D.

description:
I've never had the food here. I have however had a few different beers. 

Very reasonable prices for SF (6 USD)

It can get very crowded, which is annoying at times.
author: Abhi M.

description:
This place has become my favorite spot in the city for wine and hanging out.  We come here a lot before shows at the Fillmore or seeing a movie at Kabuki.  The staff is incredibly nice, and even though the place is always packed they sure do hustle to try and make things quick.  I don't know if I want to tell anyone the trick to getting a table, but just... go early.  Around 6:30, the place fills up and people stay for hours so you probably won't get a table unless you're willing to stand around for a long time.  

My favorites:
- Sauv. Blanc on draft - yummy and comes in at a mere $5.50 during happy hour!
- Mac and Cheese
- Chicken Pot Pie
- Happy boyfriend because there are so many good beers, which means that I get to go here more often and drink wine! (Seriously, I'm not sure why more places in the city don't cater to couples like us, where one is a beer enthusiast and the other a wine-o)
author: Erin B.

description:
Hi. 

The bf and I decided to stop by here before watching glamorized slaughterfest 2012 aka The Hunger Games at Kabuki Theater. It's fairly close, and you only have to walk about 5 minutes to get to Kabuki. 

We walked in and the friendly cashier girl motioned to some tables, but we opted for the bar so we could see their different pours. 

Now, the ambiance of this place is like the livingroom of a cozy cabin, deer head and all! I really liked it, and the patrons kept their voices at a minimal tone, even at an establishment that wasn't a speakeasy AND had alcohol! Amazing! The beer list is awesome. Actually the whole damn beer  and wine list is awesome. I mean if I had the tolerance of a Dartmouth frat boy (eeee) I would have tried a whole bunch of other shizz. However, Sundays are my hangover GTFOOMF days, so I opted for the Hef they had on tap, and the BF had some Retribution? Refraction? Redemption?...some apocalyptic sounding beer. Those were great!

For food, we had the mushroom truffle flatbread, which contributes to me docking down a star. For the life of me, I could NOT make out any truffle. If you slap the word truffle on it, I expect to ... at least smell it, if not taste it.  The warm pretzel was really amaze though (MORE MUSTARD THO), and perfect beer food. 

Overall, it's a great place to grab a bite and sit and chit chat before/after a movie at the Kabuki. I will definitely be back.
author: Christina L.

description: I loved Fat Angel!  Great happy hour food and wines.  The meat/cheeses and flatbreads were really good to share and of course pairs well with wine.  The place is small but it's cozy and well decored.  I can see myself coming back here with a small group of friends again.  It's no place for a large group.
author: Justin L.

description:
Sumptuous.  Humble.  Smart.

A hidden diamond in the rough of the Fillmo', upon entrance, Fat Angel could be mistaken for a lost Marina wine bar.  Upon closer look, however, you'll find two adorably scruffy males unpretentiously traipsing around, dispensing their genuine charm.  

The love and dedication of  pals and owners Cyric (?) and Jason is evident in their thoughtfully honest plates. Subtly sweet roasted grapes complement pungent gorgonzola pebbles on warm flatbread. 

Unsnobby wine snobs can finally be as cool as the beer kids and order a variety of wines on tap. Talk to Cyric or Jason about the science behind this madness. Cool!

Think up-scale hole-in-the-wall.
Great for splitting plates and second dates :)

~$20-30 for a good time/person
author: Jane L.

description: We had a fantastic experience. The service was great, the food came out fast, was super fresh, and the protions were not shy. We had the pretzel, a selection of 3 meats and 3 cheeses, kale salad and the mushroom flatbread. Everything was great and the kale salad may have been my favorite and it was HUGE! The also have an amazing beer list. I had the Mosaic Double IPA, I had never heard of this brew before but it was phenominal. Not super hoppy, which I dont mind, but more super smooth. It paired so well with our food as it was clean and crisp not terribly powerful. This place is great! I cant wait to go back.
author: Michael B.

description:
Came here before a show at the Fillmore. Advice: don't come here if you have anywhere to be, because 1. the wait takes forever and 2. you'll want to stay and appreciate the drinks, food and atmosphere for as long as possible.

We put our name on the list and a seat at the end of the bar opened up, so I sat and my boyfriend stood next to me at the corner end of the bar to wait it out. The bartenders are super friendly and helpful. They knew everything about every beer they had. It was kind of overwhelming just how many there are. Sounds like the rotate them out regularly. Also, the menu is printed daily, which leads me to believe the menu is also rotated, but based on previous reviews, it looks like they have some signatures. 

So, we decided to order at the bar. TRY THE SLIDERS. Literally best mini burger I've ever had. If there's even a chance you might not want to share, just add the extras for $3. Also tried the bacon butter (it was ok, my date loved it) and the capers (perfect alternative to mixed nuts on the bar). I MUST come back to try some of the charcuterie and every single one of the salads. We just didn't have time this time around!

Right as we were paying the bill, they called out name to be seated. They had said 25 minutes or less, which was obviously an optimistic guess, but it was ok because I was glad we got to eat there and weren't late for the show!
author: Jennifer C.

description: This was a little taste of Brooklyn in San Francisco, which is just what we were looking for! Awesome beer list, great bar snacks, and a fun atmosphere. Tight quarters, but again it felt like New York so we were totally comfortable. Will definitely go back! Flatbread and chicken pot pie were both awesome, as was the service.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Great food, great beer, terrible service.

Don't go with a large group.  Nothing over 4.  We went with 9 people and it took us 1:15 for us all to get our food.  Kitchen's just too small (according to the staff).

Seems like a nice neighborhood joint though.
author: Aaron B.

description: Love this place! Great beers (I'm not a beer drinker, but some of these have almost converted me) and wonderful wines. The menu isn't terribly vegetarian friendly, but they are happy to accommodate. The staff is very good at recommending drinks. There can be quite the wait for a table. But if you just want a drink there is usually a table outside you can camp out at, with great heaters.
author: Katie L.

description: Love the ambience, friendly & knowledgeable service and the extensive list of beers.
author: Kavitha L.

description:
Fat Angel is a great spot in the western addition neighborhood. Fat Angel is a cozy wine bar with that cool, dimly lit vibe. The servers are nice, and the wine/draft selection is pretty extensive. Their food menu is limited but that's pretty typical of a wine bar. Although food only takes up 2 pages in the entire menu, what they do serve is fantastic. We had the spicy mac-n-cheese and the smoked salmon salad. Salads are a good size and meant for sharing so that's a lovely starter, they do have several flatbreads that quite a few people ordered but we didn't get to it. If I had to choose one I'd pick the spicy sausage flatbread as that was our servers favorite. The mac-n-cheese was good and it's one of the dishes they're known for. 

Overall, the drink selection was great, food was tasty, the restaurant had a great vibe to it that you could show up for a date or be casual with a couple friends, our service was excellent, and the entire experience was reasonably priced. I'm a big fan and I'll definitely be back.
author: Ken C.

description:
I found this place on Yelp and took my out of town guests. I'm happy to say this place didn't make me look bad :). 

My friends are really into beer and this place has a great selection. Not only that, it seems like the staff is really passionate about it. My friends and the waiter got into a really enthusiastic conversation about one of the beers and the brewery that makes it. He was definitely very knowledgable. 

The food was also delicious! We ordered the garlic chilli butter to share and my boyfriend couldn't help but eat over half the butter himself. It was really flavorful. We also ordered the mushroom flatbread, the sliders, and the mac and cheese. My friends really like the sliders, especially served with the pickled hot peppers. The Mac and Cheese was probably one of the best I have ever had. The flatbread in comparison was just okay. 

Note that the place is small so you may have a long wait. We waited probably 40 minutes, but we really enjoyed our experience so I guess it was worth it.
author: Vrushali P.

description: Only came for a couple of drinks.  The atmosphere is great. Server was great.  And selection Wes perfect.
author: Lis M.

description:
I consider this to be one of my favorite neighborhood wine bars.  You'd never guess that this little gem existed around the corner from Jubili / Safeway plaza, and what a pleasant surprise it is!

Excellent selection of wines, friendly owners who tend the bar themselves, comfy seating, amazing flatbread and macaroni & cheese.  It's definitely a place I can spend a few hours lounging around.  I'm so glad it's within walking distance from my place!
author: Janet L.

description: Happy one year anniversary, Fat Angel!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Friendly service, fabulous music, incredible drinks list, terrific food, wonderful ambiance.
We were there Wed March 28 at about 6 pm with our two kids (ages 7 and 5) -- obviously this is not a spot designed with small people in mind, but our server was super friendly and patient with the girls.  We had only a couple of days in SF (on spring break from Chicago) so wanted to make sure we got in some real "we're on vacation" experiences, hence bringing our children to a gastropub -- but you know, it worked.  They enjoyed the atmosphere, the kitchen whipped up some noodles with parmesan just for them, we enjoyed the flatbread and HUGE caesar salad, and the drinks list was huge, beautifully organized, and irresistible.  A great and memorable evening.  Thank you, Jenny.
author: Karen K.

description:
+1 Charcuterie and warm bread
-1 Honey, cinnamon butter?  Weird, bland...I don't like it.
-1 Service taking forever, waitress ignoring us until the place cleared out, which probably led to an unnecessary half hour wait for the table and some other food issues (see below). 
+1 Delicious beer
-1 Cider out of a bottle costing $12.
+1 Salad, especially the trout salad
-1 Limited menu, but no pot pie available.  Also, sliders were tasty (steamed even) but a little bit pathetic looking and thin like half-sized McDonald's cheeseburgers
-1 Waitress blaming the 'Mexican staff' on Mac and Cheese that was too spicy for one of the diners (a supertaster who thought she was just ordering Mac and Cheese), but doing nothing to remedy the situation of inedible mac and cheese (i.e. taking it off the bill, offering an alternative)

Overall rating, 2.5 because I will probably come back but only for drinks and not primarily for food.  This place does not deserve a gastropub description if it only has limited bites and the limited bites are pretty darned expensive.  A more consistent and robust menu would probably improve my rating.
author: Liaty Z.

description:
I went here on Tuesday night around 8pm after finding it via Yelp.  I was on vacation with my husband and we were looking for a comfortable place to grab some food which had a good beer selection. Fat Angel did not disappoint!

When we arrived there was about a 1/2 hour wait for a table and the bar was completely full with people who were eating.  The bar area itself was very small and a little crowded as there were two other couples waiting for tables who had arrived before us.  Despite it being a little crowded, the bartenders were very attentive to us while we were waiting and constantly made sure our water and beer glasses were full.  

As were were waiting we good in the atmosphere- the chandelier hanging from the ceiling, the beautiful wooden bar back, and the dimly lit room with candles set a nice atmosphere.  We got some great beers on draft while we were waiting, some type of double IPA for each of us. They had a good amount of beers on tap and also an extensive paper menu of bottled beers.  For food, we started off with the cheese plate. Fat Angel had a list of cheeses we could selected from.  We had the Bella Dry Jack (based on Yelp reviewer advise), Spanish semi-soft cheese, and a Spanish soft cheese.  The platter was set up nicely and did not disappoint.

For the the meal I ordered the Mac & Cheese- and it was amazing!!! I am a big mac & cheese fan and regularly order it - and this is one of the best I have had!  I loved the flavor and the consistency of the pasta.  It had just the right amount of cheese to not be too cheesy.  My husband ordered the flat bread with the roasted red grapes, walnuts, and proscuitto.  I tried a piece of his pizza and it was very flavorful.  

Overall the service while we were at Fat Angel was great.  The service was outstanding and we felt comfortable throughout our meal. The waiter checked on us to make sure we had enough beer, water and everything we needed.  We enjoyed the food, good beers, and if back in San Francisco we would visit again for sure!
author: Erin G.

description:
I love this place. It's really small and quaint with a great atmosphere. It definitely sets the mood for either romantic night out or a relaxing meal with a good friend... the kind that reminds you why you moved to San Francisco. 

The menu is compact, but the flatbreads are a w e s o m e, and the salads are epic (and, this is coming from someone who doesn't usually like to eat raw greens). Also a great selection of beer. 

One thing to watch out for - it's not always easy to get a seat, since I don't think they take reservations and seating is limited. There's outdoor seating, though. 

Go, trust me. You'll love it. Your significant other will, too.
author: Kevin T.

description: Draft wine, giant salads, north coast brewery beers...can this angel get any fatter? The place is not slim on personality, either. Everything seems to be hand selected from consignment shops and flea markets. It's a labor of love for the owners and it shows.
author: Dan B.

description: The mac n' cheese, endive salad, pretzel with multi grain mustard, and maple bacon butter were all DELICIOUS. The atmosphere is so cozy, and the wine selection was great! I'll definitely be back.
author: Sarah W.

description: This is a great place if you are looking for a large selection of craft beer. The beer menu has beers grouped by type and the wait staff are very helpful with suggestions. The food is also very good and compliments the beer. The baby kale salad is excellent despite its simplicity.
author: Simon M.

description:
Classical Revolution was invited to play chamber music in this wine bar and I was performing a round of concerts with CR on the day we broke ground here. While I don't know if that will be a lasting relationship, I have to say I was still impressed with this establishment as a business of its kind.

I had not known of Fat Angel despite the fact that I live 4 blocks away. I hang out quite a bit on Fillmore street - more around J-town/Pac Heights area, but still, Fillmore street has everything my Webster street lacks. I was pleasantly surprised to be invited here one night and discovered that not only is this a "bar", it's a wine bar - WITH FOOD. Great food.

On a busy Sunday night there was one man running the show. He was behind the bar mostly making drinks. But he was also somehow waiting all those tables, cleaning up after tables (right away, too), and doing his job with such quickness that lacked the appearance of chaos. He didn't even lose his cool or raise his voice, NOT ONCE. The place isn't too big - maybe seats 25 people, max. But the place was PACKED. And it's easy to know why.

They not only have great wine and beer selections (I had some FANTASTIC IPA and more pinot noir, on the house) they also have wonderful fare. I had some of the best Mac&cheese of my life, a tasty and crispy flatbread, and the absolute best apple bread pudding of my life, served with a huge dollop of real whipped cream and vanilla bean ice cream. It was a large serving of desert for only 6 bucks, a portion large enough to go around between probably three people. I don't know what they put into the bread pudding - nutmeg? But it was killer, not like any other bread pudding I'd eaten before. It was perfectly creamy and eggy but there was something else about it I haven't found in other bread puddings. It was creamy, crispy , rich, warm, gooey, not too sweet, and subtly spicy in a way I can't describe, really. 

What an awesome place to hang out in the neighborhood. Furnished with a curved bench, individual marble tables and matching antique chairs, antique sconces, matching mirrors, and beautiful, dark mahogany wood and cherry blossoms, this was a great spot for me to enjoy a low-key night with good musicians and better friends. Since my roommate and I are on almost exact opposite schedules except about once a week, once she turns 21 I have a feeling date nights are going to happen here often.
author: Y K.

description: The pizza slices looked old like they had been sitting there for a few hours but It tasted better than it looked. Not a bad place to grab a quick bite but its nothing to rave about.
author: Yadira i.

description:
I came here with a group of four on a Saturday night. We had wine, beer and tried the pretzel, cheeses, and one of the pizzas. The food was pretty average and the bar area was a small space. However the service was very good. 

If you're looking for a fun, energetic crowd for a group then I wouldn't suggest this place. 

If you're looking for a place to drink wine with a significant other this would probably be ok.
author: Lauren P.

description: Ok I listened to you Yelp users and was a bit dissapointed. This place was just ok, it's hit or miss. This is my sober month so I ordered a fresh squeeze lemonade which was very yummy. Let me start with all the yummys: Sliders, Meat Platter. I'll pass food- Mushroom and Truffle Flatbread, tasted like store bought cracker not flatbread. Chicken Pot pie was very close to being a hit but there was too much salt on the top puff pastry and WAY TOO MUCH Taragon!! Woah heavy hand there. There was a good amount of chicken in the pie, a good thing. We shared 4 dishes between 3 of us and we all came out hungry.
author: Karen T.

description:
This is a perfect spot to grab a bite and a drink before a show at the Fillmore. Warm, cozy, and laid-back all at the same time. Large selection of beer and food that's perfect for sharing among friends - the food here is refined (think cheese and meat plates) without being stuffy (think mac and cheese and sliders). The space is small though, so I wouldn't roll here with 6+ people.

Their mac and cheese was out of this world! There's something in there that gives it a kick - mustard, maybe? Couldn't puzzle it out, but it was delicious!
author: Lisa W.

description:
De-licious. 

First off, the flatbread is the best. Especially the one with grapes. Sweet and savory is always a smart combo. The mac-n-cheese is also very good, but super heavy... definitely not just a snack, but great as a meal.

Secondly, wine on tap is the best invention since the snuggie. The shiraz is exceptionally good. And we tried a few. 

The decor is swanky and homey all at once. It's a tiny place, and probably not great for a large group, but the perfect spot to kick back with a few friends. 

Fat Angel is a little bit on the pricey end, but I think I'm just spoiled by all the places to get a cheap drink in SF. It's not the place to go for a cheap happy hour beer, but it's worth it if you're looking to linger and savor your food, drink, and company.

It's in a totally weird and unexpected neighborhood, but trust me, it will be worth the trek and the 45 minutes you spend trying to figure out how to get home in a wine induced stupor.
author: Kristen B.

description:
W(h)ine after work (clever happy hour ploy) is perfect at Fat Angel! Not a huge venue, but its coziness and warmth adds charm to this wine bar in the Western Addition. Their happy hour specials are decent--$1 off draft wines and draft beers and $2 off flatbreads. 

Never having tried wine on draft, my companion and I ordered a draft cabernet and a pinot noir, respectively. We both enjoyed them...enough to order another. In addition, we ordered the mac 'n cheese and the wild mushroom and white truffle oil with pecorino cheese flat bread. The mac 'n cheese, while was delicious, both admitted to having had better, as theirs lacked a richness. The flatbread was just the right amount of crispness, and ingredients were fresh and very present. I'd definitely order that again. 

Staff was friendly and attentive; coming by our table just the right amount of times where we didn't feel neglected nor annoyed. Wine list was extensive (by the glass and bottle), as was the beer list. Prices were moderate; glasses ranging from $8 (whites) - $13. Ambiance is chill and relaxing; perfect for catching up with a friend, a romantic date (lighting is dim), or group outing (though again, the venue isn't huge). 

I'm a fan, and I'll likely go again as I enjoyed the wine and food, ambiance and service. Great addition to the Western Addition!
author: Marie B.

description: We arrived early and waited for 2 minutes after the posted "open" time but it was still closed. We went for a walk and came back half an hour later and it was filling up. The menu had some food stains on it which was a little gross. The waitress though was great she was very knowledgable about the menu and was able to suggest things. The food was great too and tasted better than I expected. I had the mac and cheese and my friend the flatbread. We had some meat and cheese appetizer too which was very small for the price but good quality. I will make a point to come back again based on my first experience.
author: Tabitha T.

description:
This place is definitely one of the best places I've been to in the city. The location being in the fillmore district and the overall scenery is absolutely great. The place itself is a bit small but has a great atmosphere to it where you don't feel pressured to order more than you really want to and you can take your time catching up with friends.

My roommates and I came here after work one day and we just had a few drink, snacked and enjoyed fillmore street. The waitress was super nice and accommodating. Service with a smile is always appreciated.
author: edward k.

description:
Special spot - 

Loved the mushroom flatbread and endive salad. I want to try more next time! Happy to see it was packed!!
author: Sarah T.

description:
Awesome little hole in the wall, just off the main roads of San Francisco. Came here with a friend to try it out, was amazing, decided to come back with the girlfriend. Ended up coming here on a Friday night around 7:30 and pleasantly surprised that I didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes to get seated. Would've expected some insane wait time,  but the staff was super friendly and we got a drink while we waited.

Positives: Food was AWESOME, get the chicken pot pie. It'll fill you up and tastes amazing! Aside from that, all their little meat and cheese dishes are fabulously paired with jams and mustard to provide an incredible tasting meal. Ask the waiter for his/her opinion, and just trust them if you can't figure out what you want. Staff is super friendly, one of those small businesses where every customer is precious to them, and it shows. Atmosphere is romantic, great for a date.

Con: It's a bit small. There's something like space for 20-25 people, and the place can get a little cramped. But really... being a small cozy romantic restaurant can be a nice change of pace. Not going to take away a star just because their business is so good that it's a little hard to move around. Just know that it's going to be a little cramped if you go on a busy night.
author: Edmond H.

description:
Loving this place, desperately, though I should note that I went back a few times and discovered Angel's Share is no longer on tap (they still have it in bottles). Apparently, when they finish a keg, they replace the beer with something new. But that's life, isn't it? Out with the old and in with the new... ever on the quest to new human frontiers, the discovery of uncharted experiences to further the depths of the personal mind. The soul, unhinged by time and fueled by the passion of undying persistence, released into the bosom of the night...

I'm still talking about beer.
author: Keane L.

description:
Yeah I can't believe I didn't already write a review about my neighborhood wine/beer bar (and yes Fat Angel is both if you ask me).  The service is always great, the simple comfort food menu really hits the spot and the beer selection rotates and has quite a nice selection every time. 

I'm partial to the sliders and the cheese plates myself, but the trout salad is really good as well as the magical butters.  Ladyhawk loves this joint and pretty much the entire menu just like me.  See ya there.  No sweat,
author: Nicholas N.

description: The food was ok.  The server forgot to put our order in - honest mistake but it doesn't make up for the fact we waited too long for our food and she didn't even comp one drink.  I'm all about customer service, and to keep a customer you at least need an apology and offer to comp a small item - a cheap one for that matter.  On top of this the hostess said the wait was going to be 40 minutes - once again a fair assessment, but we weren't seated until an hour and a half had gone by.  Once again, not their fault, but they should know how they usually operate and give a better estimate.
author: Adrian E.

description: Great little place for good wine and apps. Way better than traditional wine bar food, and some outdoor seating. Go early as it fills up quick though!
author: Christina S.

description: This place is great. Went with my girlfriend for a drink and bite to eat. We shared the mac and cheese and kale salad. Mac and cheese was delicious and the kale salad was surprisingly big. Great selection of beers, although not many of tap.
author: Brian L.

description: The atmosphere was cool but it definitely wasn't a restaurant--more like a bar with hot snacks.  My boo and I came here at 5:30ish and it was empty but filled up quickly.
author: Olivia N.

description:
Excellent food prices (beer not so much) and friendly service

Stumbled across this place before going to Fillmore (Squeeze show) and can't believe I'd never seen it before. V. friendly tattoo-of-the-world server; we got a $10 salad that could have served three.

Incredible range of Belgian and Swiss (mostly) beers and I've tipped off the MeetUp beer crew.
author: Michael A.

description:
We stumbled on this place and will definitely come back thanks to its close proximity to our dwellings. 

Dimly lit, quiet, sort of a romantic ambiance.. I could see it as sort of a datey spot. We were there on a Monday night, but I get the feeling it gets pretty busy on other nights. Its sort of a diamond in the rough of the Filmore.

I liked it, but I didn't love it. I got the zin on tap- I was definitely impressed with the quality of wine on tap... I didn't even know wine could be on tap!

we got the chili garlic butter- and then a couple of salads and a pot pie. This place is definitely an order and share things type of place. But our waitress was a little weird and spacey and didn't really give us any sort of low down. The food was ok- I think my friends pot pie was the winner- I had some extreme order envy with my comparatively lame caesar salad.

We decided that we will have to come back and indulge on cheese and butter variations. In general I wasn't super impressed with this place- a little expensive for what it has to offer.
author: Veronica T.

description: Only had beers and truthfully did not remember leaving so that always gets five stars!!!! The Molotov cocktail IPA at 13% did me in in such a perfect way!
author: Shane A.

description:
Went there last night.  It was quite small, so not much room to squeeze in, but the staff were very friendly and the music was awesome!

It looks like they have quite an impressive list of drink options, but I actually got stuck on the champagne cocktail and liked it so much I didn't try anything else!
author: Chris G.

description: The food here is really good. Highly recommend the sliders and bread pudding. The salads are huge, beware.
author: Heather R.

description:
Yikes! Terribly (and I mean TERRIBLY) rude waitstaff; I have been here twice and both times witnessed the male server snap at someone at my table. Seriously, why the need for the major attitude? 

Giving it two stars only because they have wine on draft and a delicious mac & cheese. This place could be a favorite of mine if the service weren't so bad (and if it weren't so cramped and difficult to get a table).

Sadly I won't be back.
author: A P.

description:
So I've been here twice (three attempts). It was delicious. I was in a party of four, got a table after a 15-20 minute wait at 7 on a cloudy Saturday night. We ordered one meat, one cheese, and one butter (I kind of wish they had a set of one meat\cheese\butter plate, since we wanted to try one in each category). However, our server made some excellent recommendations for what to order. We also ordered the grape, walnut and gorgonzola flatbread, the sliders, the chicken pot pie, and drinks. I'd have to say, I was most impressed with the flatbread (I usually like lots of meat on my pizza, I mean, flatbread). It was excellent. The pot pie and the sliders were pretty darn good, too. It may sound weird, but I really liked the buns on the sliders. 

As for drinks, I got a nice MIkkeller stout, which was, as my server informed me, fruitier than stouts tend to be. Delicious, nonetheless.

I don't know if I came in on a good night, or if some of the reviewers came in on a bad night, but I thought the service was good. My party was pretty clueless as to order, and the server walked us through a lot\most of the menu. When they got busier, he couldn't stand around and wait for us to make up our minds, but that's understandable.
author: B Y.

description:
I am going to really hate myself to give away my local hang out but I have to review it because they are so AWESOME.   I been only bringing my close friends here because I am afraid that this place will soon be running over with people not from the neighborhood.  But I want this place to last so I am reviewing it. 

They have an excellent list of great wines, many of them are wines that you will probably never heard of and giving your taste buds a good tingle.  The food there albeit very limited is solid and accommodate with the wines that you might order.  The Chicken Pot Pie and the Apple Bread Pudding is to die for.

The owners of Fat Angel (the one I know better is Cyrick)  will take good care of you and understand what you will like to drink and they will remember you.  I didn't go there for two weeks and the owner who I order from only once remember me,  I was thoroughly impressed.  Now this place has now become my hangout place for wine.  

So if you are in the Fillmore area for date or a quick drink. This is the place to go!
author: Chris C.

description: Food is outstanding. Wine is wonderful. I would suggest asking for a recommendation for wine the first couple of times you go. The bartender will steer you into some nice wines! I'm sure the food can vary in success...what restaurant doesn't have it's weak moments? I've been here with a small party (4) and with a large party (10). Yes, they accommodated a large party and when you see the place you'll know why it was a major undertaking! It was a bit noisy, however. I've sat at the bar and at the tables and each time the noise-factor pretty much precluded big-time, intense discussions. I'll bet if I sat outside, it would be different.
author: Sarah P.

description:
After walking 1.5 miles we made it!! 

love the chicken pot pie and the mac n cheese. Will be back very very soon to eat it all AGAIN!
author: Mary M.

description:
I like angels.  Typically, I prefer them to be of the archangel variety (Michael and his sword of justice - come on, awesome) over fat little cherubs, but then again, I had never been served food and beer by fat little cherubs.  Until Saturday night.

Located right behind the Fillmore, this is a dark, cozy, upscale wine-bar-type-joint that is low on pretentiousness and high on deliciousness.  They play music, but it's quiet enough that you can actually hear your companions - which I appreciate (damn kids these days with their damn loud music and long hair).

Keane L. and I had pints of Angel's Share beer (aged in bourbon barrels, $6), and flatbread with prosciutto, gorgonzola, red grapes, and walnuts ($8).  I would like to marry this meal.  The beer is nothing short of awesome, and the flatbread was its perfect complement.  

The staff was very personable and didn't seem to have any problem with us spending 2+ hours there.  The crowd is mostly your typical 20/30-something Saturday-nighters, but there was also a 3-year-old and his grandmother hanging out at 9pm.  The three-year-old became significantly more chatty when he learned that Keane was not, in fact, my boyfriend.  Ah, they grow up so fast.

You keep pouring the beer and wine, Fat Angel, and I will be back to drink it.
author: Jennie K.

description: The kale salad is massive and delicious! Definitely recommend it. Plus a huge selection of beer and wine.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Perfect stop before heading to the Fillmore. Excellent beer and tasty food. 
Had a Hop Manna IPA and the smoked trout salad. It's the best damn salad I've ever had.
author: Wilder G.

description: Well-seasoned pot pie and delicious sliders. You are missing out.
author: Carl F.

description: Great chicken potpie, great mac n cheese, and great apple bread pudding. Such an extensive beer list! Very impressive.
author: Kellsie F.

description:
This place is amazing!
The food is delicious and the beers are unique. My favorite beer was the double chocolate stout! Smooth and Chocolatey!
If you don't know what to order just ask the owner. He is super passionate and always has good recommendations!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Was there this past Friday becoz we wanted to check out wine bars and Yelp listed this place under this category.  The place is small and cozy and the deer head (hope it's fake) hanging on the wall is quite 'out of place' yet eye-catchy.  the place was already full by 6:30pm and we just waited standing at the corner of the bar / also right at the entrance.  We took 2 white wines (delicious) and a salami/parma ham platter while waiting.  Groups of people kept pouring in and before you know it, the wait for a 4 person table, as the server said, was 1 hour. 

Menu was very simple and i liked the flexibiilty of choosing my own meat in the platter, and later the cheese (as many as 6 selections, I recall) in my platter.  The nice lady who was seated at the bar ordered what looked like a pizza and we asked her how it was "Very Good', she said.  I will definitely give that a try next time I visit.

So, our wines, salami platter and cheese platter was good.  Though the waitress couldn't tell which cheese was which.

We were seated facing the window after less than an hour, but was worth the wait, especially if you're waiting while drinking.

Oh, and there's this thing called 'draft wine'.  Strange but guess I'll give it a try next time.
author: M S.

description: Really really great selection and knowledgeable staff who are not snobby. Very helpful. Really good food.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: This place may be small, but what they offer is robust. Extensive beer offerings and employees with a decent knowledge of them. There isn't anything on the small food menu that isn't delicious. Perfect for a quick drink or a couple hours of lounging with a small group.
author: Eliza S.

description:
Good wine and food.

Great place to go or a late night drink and cheese platter. Very solid wine on tap.

I'll have to try more on the menu and update my review.
author: Alison M.

description:
I only got a chance to hang out at Fat Angel for about half an hour before last call (after stumbling in from Sheba Piano Lounge), but that half hour convinced me I need to come back.

This is a place I would love to be a regular at - friendly bartender, awesome decor (we added our picture to the tree!), large libation selection, and the food menu looked delicious.
author: Cathy Y.

description:
This place is a GEM.

First of all, totally inconspicuous on the outside, not to mention off the beaten path of Fillmore. I had no idea a place this cute and hip was even in this area of Fillmore!

They have tables outside, but it was too cold, so we sat inside at the bar. The decor is beautiful. The bar stools were made from old tractor seats, so they are heavy duty metal. They look really cool. The bar is marble and there is an awesome chandelier hanging over it. Additionally, there is a super cool moosehead on the wall too. Hunting cabin chic.

They have wine and beer on tap, in addition to many bottles of each. They don't appear to have liquor, although they had a Lillet cocktail (is Lillet a liquor?). We opted for a half bottle of the Cab Sauv on tap, which came it what looked like an old soda bottle. All the water bottles are reused wine bottles too--I love the green-ness!

Wine was so good we ordered another bottle! And they have delicious munchies too!

We ordered the mushroom flatbread with truffle oil and parmesan (I think it was parm...). SO good. We also ordered a cheese plate--$5 for one cheese and it comes with bread slices, honey/jam, and these salty-sweet nuts. Food was prompt and yummy. Too bad I wasn't more hungry--they had some amazing other dishes: other flatbreads, mac and cheese, and pot pie!

We got there around 5 and it was empty, but filled up quick! It was packed by 6:30. 

The two guys working the place (I think are the owners) were very attentive and friendly. You can tell they really love what they do.

I fell in love with Fat Angel...it truly is a gem in the Fillmore.
author: Shannon J.

description: My all-time fav. I used to live in the neighborhood and this was my favorite restaurant. It's so warm and cozy inside, with good energy and great decor. They serve amazing cheese and meat boards and they have a wonderful beer and wine selection. Love Love.
author: Sara N.

description:
The intimidate place was quite packed when we dropped in after visiting the Fillmore. The few tables were occupied but we were able to snag spots at the bar. 

Beers and wines on tap, and nibbles weren't too bad.  The cheese and meat platter held us over. I had a bite of the chicken pot pie and I think it's one of these best I've ever had (granted, I don't eat much chicken pot pie).  I'm usually not a big fan of bread pudding but the apple bread pudding here was really good- hot, fresh out of the oven, served with a side of whipped cream.  Only complaint is I wish they served it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream instead of the whipped cream.  

Something like they reuse their wine bottles and they are made with a different material in order to be more 'green'. I'm a fan of the low-pressure atmosphere here so I definitely can see myself coming back.
author: Lisa C.

description: nice wine and beer spot. not a huge menu but enough if you are open to what they got and not expecting a typical entree portion. we had great wines - on tap- and there are a billion beers. the flat bread and breads and butter were good too but i wish the portion for bread and butter was more sizable. nice servers and patio out front in winter afternoon sun.
author: B S.

description: My fiancé and I are in San Francisco for part of our honeymoon. Once we were settled in our b&b we went on the hunt for a place to grab a quick bite at 9pm on a Tuesday. We found Fat Angel quite accidentally and what a find it is. We both enjoyed our meals. He had sliders and I had wild mushroom flatbread with truffle oil. There drink menu is more extensive than there food menu. That being said I had a phenomenal cider called Finnriver Fire barrel Cider. $17 for 22oz was well worth it. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Mrs. M.

description: For a drinking establishment, this place serves up some killer food. Chicken pot pie is a must - taste very homemade and hearty. Sliders are a little light on the meat but great aioli. The flatbreads are nicely done as well. Prices are not cheap but you do get pretty decent quality bar food. They seem to have a good collection of wine and beer. Ambience is great - it is both casual yet moderately intimate.
author: Ed L.

description:
Excellent food and drinks, extremely attentive/friendly service & classy decor. Lots of neighborhood regulars. I'm trying really hard to become one. 

Update: Mission accomplished...

1.) They know me by name
2.) I got some free food
3.) They tested a new dish on me

Woohoo!
author: insipidphishie P.

description:
With wines made of unicorn tears, pixie dust, crystals and even one guaranteed to take you to Pleasure Town, how can you not adore Fat Angel? 

Love this new neighborhood wine bar nicely tucked away off of Fillmore - this tiny spot is great for chilling out with some friends, canoodling with a date or even hanging out solo and chatting it up with the super friendly owners Cyrick and Jason. Also a great place to grab a glass of wine or two pre- or post- concerts at The Fillmore or Yoshi's. 

Their wine list is rather diverse with hilarious little descriptions of the wine written by Jason, which actually is what drew me to certain wines over others. I mean how can you not want to try a Syrah that is "Proof that God loves us. This wine will take you on a magic carpet ride to Pleasure Town. Worth every penny. Funky, freaky, delicious." Right? The "Cosmic" Syrah will take you on a trip, and the Tempranillo is magical. For Spring-in-a-glass, make sure you get the Grenache Blanc, and the Chenin Blanc is lovely.

There are also bar bites, cured meats, cheeses, salads, dessert and BUTTER. Get the maple bacon butter - you'll wish you had a jar of it to make a MBB&J sammich at home. The angus beef sliders are crazy good. You'll want to up your order to 4 instead of 3 because they're that delicious. 

After several glasses of wine and nibblies, I walked out of here feeling a little bit like a fat angel. Btw, the name has a Chinese connection. My peeps and their silly names.
author: Connie C.

description:
WHY... of WHY wasn't this place open when I used to live at the Fillmore Center?  

I usually don't give 5 starts after just one visit, but I loved everything about this place.  The interior and ambience is relaxing and I immediately felt comfortable as soon as I walked in.   I loved that although there was a steady flow of people going in and out it never got very loud.  The staff (Jason) was very friendly and fast with all our orders.  If I had an opportunity to open a wine bar, I'd basically just replicate this place.
author: Daniel L.

description:
When settling in for a relaxing swirl, there are times when I want to be free from decision making. For an establishment that bills itself as a wine bar, there's a surprising lack of flights that would allow for just that. However, the beverge list is broken up into digestible bits: quaff, suds, wines etc that make browsing fun. They work with the cordial and wine license pretty well, offering a few specialty effervescent imbibes and several classics like the Pimm's Cup for happy toasting.

After a few rounds, I could imagine slipping into the gentle ease of the place, noshing on delectable cheeses of which there are a-plenty, and becoming anvil-ed to the church pews on the arm of a fella. I'd certainly go steady with this charming watering hole were I a denizen of the neighborhood.
author: Ligaya T.

description: Wine (and beer) on tap and delicious Mac and cheese, what more could you ask for! Small place, but super cute and everything was delicious. Great place for happy hour and would definitely come back again!
author: Lisa H.

description:
i had wanted to come here on fri night but ended up at maven instead.  when i was parking before dinner at state bird provisions, i ended up parking right in front of fat angel, and since we had to wait a while for dinner anyway, we came here to get a drink first.

their snack meal is interesting w/ a whole section on flavored butter to be eaten w/ bread.  my friend got the maple bacon one and loved it.  since we were slated to have dinner already, i refrained from eating anything.  instead, i had a glass of cava, and it was a generous pour. 

the space is super cute.  i can't wait to come back and have more drinks/food.
author: Helen T.

description:
I love this place.  A nice quiet bar to come and have a few good beers or wine on a Saturday night, and we finally got to try some of the dishes.  We came for dinner Friday evening, and though it was more crowded than we were used to, we were seated immediately and service was friendly and quick.  Jason and Cy are enthusiastic, friendly and quick to clarify the interesting and humorous descriptions listed for the alcohol selection.  Draft beer selection changes from month to month I believe, but you'll always find something you'll thoroughly enjoy.

To the food.  Up until last night we've only ever ordered the meat plate.  A large plate of assorted charcuterie with bread and mustard for 22 dollars makes a great accompaniment to a few beers or wine, as well as a tasty appetizer.  My girlfriend had the pot pie, which I was blown away by its size, and I had the baked macaroni and cheese, made with various cheeses, and sized just perfectly even for a big boy like myself.  Rich but not sickeningly so, cheesy and filling, I'd happily order it again, but not make the same mistake of having pizza for lunch.  And the pot pie, well I helped her finish it.  Flaky crust, hearty filling, makes me wonder why the heck I ever buy the frozen variety.  Prices are reasonable for FIllmore.  

It's nice to find that handful of bars and restaurants you know you can always go to and just enjoy the company of friends, talking and enjoying a few drinks.  Five stars all the way.
author: Eric P.

description:
Fat Angel has been on my to-go-to list for quite some time now, and I finally made it for a nightcap after my birthday celebrations.  This is the type of place where you feel comforted just by walking in the door (maybe it was the yellow lighting and christmas tree, but it worked for me). 

We sat at the bar and sipped on our beers for an hour or so, enjoying the company, admiring the tree, slowly fading into the end of our night after a long work week.  

Just thinking about it now with the rain outside makes me want to zip over for some chic comfort food and a glass of something swanky.  I like that their beer and wine selections are atypical, adding to their sophistication I suppose.  

Friendly bartender, calming atmosphere, lovely space.  I'll be back.  Especially when it's cold out or I'm winding down for the night, but not quite ready for bed.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
On Yelpers recommendations we tried the wine bar last Friday.  Didn't know what to expect/how busy on a kick off evening for Labor Day weekend.  By 6pm the place was packed.  

That being said, I guess I"m learning I'm a true wine afficionado.  Although Fat Angel had (1) great prices, (2) great nibbles, and (3) great service and ambience, I'm in it for the wine people.  I"ll be back for hanging out with friends and so forth, but I will remain on my quest for the best wine bar with good selections and prices. 

~ Ms. Ali
author: A W.

description: Great little spot hidden in the Filmore. Parking is fairly easy and meters stop after 6 which is becoming rate in this city. Nice selection of foreign wines and beers. The bread and infused butters are nice. The PotPie is something I'd order again and again!
author: Heather W.

description: If you're a beer fan this is your spot,  and also nice wine list. Flatbread was amazing and kept us from not starving waiting for our table @ the bird. I've had the sliders before and they make some of the best in the city, I'ts my fave in the city as well as there mac n cheese.
author: Chris D.

description: Very impressed with the food, service, and beer selection. I recommend the kale salad and mushroom pizza--you won't be disappointed!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Fat Angel is a fantastic spot!  My girl and I went here on a Thursday opened up the joint at happy hour.  We were enthusiastically and warmly greeted by the staff and explained the menu.  I had a local beer that I had never tasted and we dove into a plate of cheese and some bread and maple bacon butter.  Delicious.  

We then shared a giant and superb caesar salad.  Seriously, this thing is a monster and we devoured the whole thing.

Then onto the flatbread - wow!  We had one topped with prosciutto, walnuts, roasted grapes and gorgonzola and were totally blown away.  The crust was perfectly thin and crispy, a unique take on the flatbread which really allows the toppings to do their thing.  

A great spot, great peeps and fantastic food!  Can't wait to go back.
author: Matt S.

description:
Fat Angel is a great little nugget of a wine bar located just around the corner from the Fillmore. The wine list is well selected (though you really can't go wrong with the wine on tap) and the food menu small but well edited. Not only do they have your meats and cheeses but they also have a great pot pie, mac & cheese and a selection of butters. Yes, butters. Nothing wrong with some maple bacon butter to go with your pinot noir!

Service is friendly but can be a bit slow, especially on a show night. That being said, it's definitely worth the wait. Fat Angel is officially my new go-to venue for a drink and bite to eat before a show at the Fillmore.
author: phil h.

description:
Amazing beer selection -- who knew that there were great Belgian-style beers made on the Pacific Coast?!  PranQster is a new favorite of mine.

Great indie rock tunes and a friendly and outgoing barkeep.

That's everything you could ask for right there!
author: Adam Z.

description:
We moved into the Fillmore Center 3 years ago and witnessed the transformation of this empty space into Fat Angel.  I've brought my mother here post movie (Sundance Kabuki), my boyfriend for a romantic evening, and friends for after work drinks. It worked out perfectly for us each time. This is because the 2 owners (also the only servers) are knowledgeable and dedicated. I feel at home here, truly.

Yes, it is very, very dimly lit.  This suits the cozy atmosphere if you ask me. It reminds me of the many small wine bars I visited in Madrid and the South of France. 

The tables are a bit uneven, true.  Doesn't bother me enough to deduct a star though.

I really appreciate the thought they put into their menu. The section names and wine descriptions are clever. 

Love that they bring you a full carafe of water right away. The water glasses are pretty small so this is helpful as the small bar tends to get pretty warm when full. 

~Favorites~
FOOD
-Wild Mushroom Flatbread (love the sea salt), and love the wooden palate it's served on. Even asked the owner where it is from and purchased some for my home!
-Trout Salad
-Cheese Plate
-Any of the flavored butters
author: Annette M.

description:
Nice place, great for meeting a friend for some wine and perhaps a cheese plate. 

Its somewhat small, but seating is available both at the bar as well as small tables. 

The wine is priced decently, I think a glass goes as low as $8 for one of the Chianti's. I recommend getting the cheese plate, it is priced at $5 each or 5 for $21. Meaning for $21 you get a little plate with some crackers and five different cheeses. Not really a value, but its always nice when you can snack on some cheese over wine.

Not recommended if you are looking for a modern and spacious wine lounge with a group of friends. But great for a glass of wine ad some cheese on a mellow night. I would not recommend it for big groups, as seating is somewhat limited... i.e. finding two seats is one thing, finding six is an entirely different story.
author: Sam M.

description:
Here's something about me that may or may not surprise you: I grew up Catholic.  Not just church every Sunday, but Christian Bible Preschool and Catholic School for K-6.  I had nuns for teachers.  I had to wear an ugly uniform.  I used to have to read the Bible during class (we got to pick what we read, however, so usually I read the Book of Ruth.  It was only 4 pages.  Or Revelations, because it was cool).  I've completed the sacraments of Baptism, First Reconciliation, First Communion, and Confirmation (Mary Magdalene was my saint). 

Despite (or perhaps because of) having spent 18 years as a Catholic, I am what one would consider "lapsed."  I don't go to church.  I don't pray.  I call out God's name in vain all the time.  I am most likely going to whatever hell Catholicism believes in, even if I no longer do believe.

Although I am lapsed, there is something extremely comforting about entering a church, sitting on a cool pew, hearing the sounds of an organ wafting through, eating the wafer, and having some of the Blood of Christ.

Fat Angel is cool and comforting.  As part of a non-traditional St. Patrick's night adventure, a very cool friend (I was cool enough to come here by association) suggested we come here as a last stop.  He had mentioned that it was his favorite "local" many times so I was anxious to try it out, but hadn't the opportunity (meaning I'm clearly not doing a good enough job stalking him).

As this was the end of an already fun evening, I will definitely have to go back to gather more details.  Here's what I do know:

-The owner/bartender is awesome.  He probably thinks I'm less awesome since I was saying lame things, but people really should get used to me saying lame things.  Answered all my questions, even if they were completely random and not appropriate.  
-The decor is primarily made up of a church in Napa that was about to be demolished, complete with pews and the pipes from an organ.   It's a place where you can relax and have a soul-searching conversation with a friend, or have a first date.  This place is devoid of snobbery.
-Although they don't have a full bar (which I prefer, keeps me out of trouble), they have wine on tap.  I really like this way of doing wine, especially since they have tastes, glasses, half-carafes and full carafes.  I also got a sample of a unique beer.
-They have noms.  Really good noms.  An assortment of cheeses, accompanied by crusty bread?  Yummy.  A couple of salty meats?  Double yummy.  My cool friend?  Triple yummy.  Oh wait, he's not on the menu.  Tried one of the sliders as well, which I believe they said they could make without the onions.  

Bottom line?  This is my new local, even though it's nowhere near local to me.  I have fallen madly and truly in love with Fat Angel, which probably has Eros hidden somewhere.  Oh god.

Oh FYI, we're having a UYE here.  Soon.
author: Pam S.

description:
I know once I finish writing this review I am going to regret it. Reasoning is that this place is so amazing and once this place blows up like it should, I will never get a seat when I come here. But it is my obligation (as my friends reminded me last night) to tell you of this wonderful place.

This place is just what The Fillmore needs, and I am so pissed that I moved away from this neighborhood because 1. It was walking distance to my house, and 2. It's a wine/beer bar that is reasonably priced, has amazing food, and friendly service. Whoever thought of making a bacon butter or a chocolate cinnamon butter needs to patent that shit because those two butters were two of the most amazing parties I have ever had in my mouth. Adding it with their country bread was genius! Looking for a little more substance? Their sliders and  their Mac n Cheese were both delicious. While the Mac n Cheese was par, their sliders were some of the best sliders I have ever had in my life!

Their wine and beer selection is amazing. While I stuck with the wine side this time, I was extremely impressed with the variety, as well as them being able to cover a lot of regions throughout the world. The owner, who was serving us, was extremely knowledgeable and for my last glass, I made him pick something for me. He ended up picking a beautiful Portuguese wine that was big and bold and fabulous! 

The atmosphere is awesome. Small, quaint, perfect for that girls evening where you want to sit at a table and catch up, or for the predate drink where you are sitting at the bar. The owners also have an amazing taste in music, all his own collection. We made him promise that he would never change the music. The whole bar is made from a church organ he was able to snag from napa, and beautifully restored.

I am so glad my friend stumbled upon this and wanted to share it with myself and our girlfriends. We all had nothing but excellent comments about this place and decided this is probably going to be our go to spot when we want to get together for a drink and hang out. I cannot wait to come back here to hang out, have a glass of wine, and relax. 

Like I said, I'm already regretting sharing this place with my fellow yelpers.
author: Diana R.

description: The best kale salad and bread pudding that I've ever had in my life!! Going back this weekend to try more on the menu!! Can't wait!!!
author: Julie S.

description:
Ah...Fat Angel. My "Cheers". Where do I start about this wonderfully inviting, romantic, charming bistro/pub in the Fillmore District? 

Let's start off with the proprietors. Jason and Cyrick are super heroes who somehow remain jolly and attentive (with a super-human knowledge of good food and wine) late into the evening (and dealing with tipsy Asian chicks like me). Cyrick is one of the happiest people around -- and is really knowledgeable about good food/drink pairings on the menu.  Plus - he  really knows cured meats. 

The food -- the smoked trout salad with fennel and fried capers will turn any raging carnivore into a whipped vegetarian. It is THAT good. The sliders with the garlic aioli and spicy pickles are perfect bits of heaven. The chicken pot pie and mac 'n' cheese are consistently good. The tartufo salami is really tasty.

The wine -- Jason is like Pandora, but for wine. You tell him which wines you like, and he introduces you to new wines that he thinks you might like. He is usually right. 

The ambiance -- Fat Angel is soft, romantic and brooding. Girls - the lighting will make you look your most beautiful.  The music is never too intrusive, and it is easy to have a conversation here. 

It's a small place -- so don't go too often. You might take one of my tables.
author: Liz C.

description: Worst service I've seen in years. Forgot our entire food order for 4 people. Waitstaff even had attitudes about the situation!
author: Adam C.

description:
Fat Angel is a cool lil spot in the Filly Milly! For those who aint be knowin, that be the Filmoe! 

Now this spot is cool for a different style breakfast, I guess it is either english or irish style? I wasn't too sure, it is my guess! I dug it though, a bit pricey, especially for the 'Moe'! The portion of food I ordered was actually not bad! Especially for those who are watching they waist line! I would go there for happy hour to check out the spot for their wines, beers and such! Once again its pricey, they should check that, they may be around for a bit of time or not because of that very thang! Most are are doing bottomless mimosas for $15 bucks. Get it real ya'll, its the Filmoe, not specific whites, and keep it real cool! I may duck in there on a whim again we'll see what it do?!
author: Miguelito C.

description: Went here with my friend Courtney tonight and had the best time! There was a smal wait (15-20 mins) around 7:00pm but we were invited to get a glass of wine and it was easily transferred to our main tab once we got a table. The waitress had funky pink hair and was very cool, the wine was delicious and the food - omg! We got a cheese and meat plate, the apple/Gorgonzola/walnut salad (huge!) and the Mac and cheese (had to). All were great. The salad portion was gigantic (good for 4 people...) and we definitely filled ourselves to the rafters. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend :) the chef clearly has a taste for spicy foods as biting into the salad and the Mac and cheese definitely had a bit of spice - I loved it!!
author: Lillian S.

description: As the Fillmore area keeps going in flux, it's nice to see nice new establishments run by people who really love what they're doing. Came in here for a quick dinner before catching a show down the street. Had the Chicken pot pie, Sliders, and some charcuterie washed down with glasses of Chenin Blanc (Vouvray) and Grenache. The owners are always walking around and checking in with you and for such a small space it's pretty lively. In fact it was downright loud on a Thurs night with drinkers conversing all over the bar and dining area. Dig all the old artifacts they dug out of a Napa church to decorate the space. Obviously one must regard the cherub, aka Fat Angel that adorns the area above the entrance.
author: Kim N.

description:
The sliders are paper thin, drenched in garlic mayo and the buns are greasy and soggy.  What a disgusting joke!  The mac & cheese was greasy and way too crunchy.  More poseur food for the clueless.  I remember when SF was a foodie town.  Now we cater to morons from BFE with way more money than taste.  The flatbread was okay, but you really can't mess up something so simple, and it wasn't nearly as good as you'd find at Nopa.

The service was pathetic.  Our waitress actually went out of her way to be rude, as if she's too good for her job.  Bitch, puh-leeeeeeze!

Only redeeming factor was the extensive beer list, but the prices are ridiculous.
author: Lester B.

description:
WOWZERS! What an amazing find (yelp comes through again) for pre-Fillmore drinks & eats! And what a serious bargain for city dining! 

Everything was in our favor last Thursday evening.. one of those odd nights where hubster and I must have had karma and/or the gods on our side.. rock star parking on Geary directly in front of the Fillmore? Check. The last available (corner) table for two at FA when we walked in? Check. Being seated, ordering, & eating within about 40 minutes and getting to the show just as the lights came down? Check!

Contrary to reviews, service was FAST. And our waiter was super friendly and sincere. Instead of trying to upsell us, he discouraged us from each ordering a salad as they are GIGANTIC and also said if we weren't super hungry, we could probably share the mac n' cheese vs. each getting our own.
