We opted to each get our own anyway as we weren't ordering any other apps., but he was totally right, we ended up both leaving with a to-go box of mac (which then became our next day lunches!).  

As far as the food goes, everything was ridiculously tasty. The horseradish dressing on our arugula salad was super yummy, but the fried capers put it over the top! And the mac n' cheese was some serious comfort food- perfectly cheesy with an amazing bread crumb toasty top, baked in its own mini casserole dish.. yum. We had to use some crazy will power to stop ourselves from leaving in a carb coma.

Finally, the beer and wine is I think what people first & foremost come for; as they should. They have a terrific list not to mention some incredible and reasonable stuff on tap. Once again, our waiter actually suggested to me one of the least expensive wines on the menu, the $6 sauvignon blanc on tap (!) and had we had more time, I would have  loved to have shared a bottle. Super juicy and refreshing, easily one of the best wine deals in town. 

As a side note, to be honest, the name Fat Angel was a bit of a turn-off. I thought it sounded a little cheesy, especially after ogling the gold chubby angel that greeted us, hanging prominently above the doorway. BUT, don't be fooled, inside the decor is actually quite nice. I especially dug the gaudy in a good way giant crystal chandeliers and what appeared to be extremely large golden organ pipes behind the bar. The soundtrack was a decent mix of indie rock that was just loud enough to help mask the super loud and slightly rowdy conversations going on around our table. 

All in all, Fat Angel is definitely thee place to hang before a show at the Fillmore and if you happen to live nearby, this is sure to become a new favorite. You could easily split one of their $9 giant salads (which are presented at your table in a large wooden salad bowl) four ways with a group of friends. $2 for a quality salad? You heard right. 
Yummy beers, wines, eats and treats too, we were especially tempted by the bread pudding a la mode we saw being brought to a couple next to us.. next time I'm hitting that up for sure!
author: Callie K.

description: some places have delicious food. some places have inventive fares. some places have a great atmosphere. some places have great drinks. some places have generous portions. some places have affordable options. Fat Angel has it all.
author: Ruben K.

description:
Finally a place with an awesome beer selection on Fillmore!

Don't get me wrong, Pizza Inferno has good beers, but Fat Angel has amazing ones. Last night I had an Abt 12 and I almost went to heaven.

Their wine selection is also strong and fun, and the overall ambiance of the place is really stellar. The people who work there seem to be nice and the big windows give you a chance to stare out and enjoy...staring at people!
author: Paul C.

description:
In a city with too much sushi, I was craving hearty comfort food and Fat Angel's offerings hit the spot. The gourmet Mac n' Cheese with gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano reggiano was rich and creamy; cheese heaven where everyone-not just angels-is certainly fat. The sliders with caramelized onions, bacon, chedder and aioli are the most delicious bite-size burgers I've had and they just melted in my mouth. 

However, despite the great food, Fat Angel gets three stars for forgetting about their seated customers. While you are greeted upon entry, quickly seated and attended to for placing orders, once the plates arrived, we weren't acknowleged for a good hour+. Even though I had great company and sitting and talking is what I want to do when I'm out, I do want to be checked on too.  I understand this place has more of a pub/bar vibe going on, but it took an hour approx to flag down a waiter to ask for the dessert menu after finishing our meal and another 30 min to flag someone else down again to place the order (though, the crème brûlée was worth the wait). Finally, getting the check took some time as well. 

However, I would definitely go back and as long as you're not in a rush, you should go too.
author: Melissa D.

description:
5-7 happy hour with $1 off draft beer & wine; $2 off flatbread. 

Service was super friendly and attentive. We were greeted with a big smile and a carafe of water came immediately after we sat down. Always appreciated when embarking on a wine adventure. 

I sampled the draft Pinot noir and cab. Both wines were airy; I'm assuming this was from the fact that it came from a tap. There were lots of little air bubbles in the cab that made it seem relatively light for the style. Flavor-wise both were good although a bit on the expensive side for what they are. 

Also tried the flatbread with bacon, anchovies, goat cheese, and onions. It was huge, although since the bread is so thin, we managed to polish it off between two people. It was okay, but nothing extraordinary. The flavors were there individually but never really seemed to come together as much as I would have liked.
author: Monica C.

description:
All I can say is that I want this place to be my 'Cheers'. 

This is the perfect place to catch up with a friend over some wine. The service here is also wonderful. I really can't say enough great things. 

As for food, my friend and I had the goat brie with a kumquat marmalade and the Roaring 20s (a blue cheese) with honeycomb. Both were so different - it was fun to try such a range. Then there was the truffled mushroom flatbread. I would eat this every night if I could. 

*We also came here last week for my friend's birthday. There were about 12 of us. Every person in the bunch was a fan!
author: Jen N.

description:
This is exactly what Fillmore needed....what a cool spot if you are feeling: 

-Great bites & wine pre/post show @ Yoshi's 
-Intimate atmosphere before a dance-a-thon @ The Fillmore 
-That perfect cozy night that just makes you love San Francisco a little more... 

Organs, church pews, fried capers, Pinot, flatbread, and trout salad satisfied by soul....I'll be back again to experiment with their menu.
author: Charlene A.

description:
Wine: Sauvignon Blanc
Ambiance: Cozy, quaint, great choice of a playlist (;
Service: 1/2 of the ownership was managing the place the night I came in and he was incredibly quirky and very helpful. 
Selection: Their beer selection is pretty extensive. Their wines could be added to. I'm a big riesling fan and dude tells me that it's rather dry. I didn't understand until he gave me a taste test. SO DRY. Like a dessert IN YOUR MOUTH. Just kidding. 

Came back home to the bay for Spring Break and popped in here after Barrique closed at 10pm (why would ANY place that serves alcohol close at 10pm on a Friday night?). Awesome replacement. 

If this place has an actual sweet riesling or a moscato the next time I drop in, it's an automatic 5 star :D
author: Jeeae C.

description: Such a cute place! Its not as big as I thought it wouldve been, however it was great! From the bottle of wine we ordered to the food. Everything was amazing. The waiter staff was very attentive when they needed to be and very helpful. Will definitly be returning!
author: Sophia S.

description: The maple bacon and chili garlic butters are killer, but their beer selection is what I enjoyed most about Fat Angel.  It's a small intimate place that has a lively feel to it.  We had a great time and the staff really knew their beers.
author: Jay K.

description:
Would never have even noticed this place (which is just off of Fillmore in Western Addition) had my friend not lived in the building.  But thank God she did because this wine/beer bar is great!

Met the owner, Cyrick, who's a really cool dude.  Friendly, laidback ... type of guy you'd hang out with normally.  Except he just happens to be a guy who also owns a kick-ass place.

The decor is dimly lit with chandeliers and decorations that were formally part of a church.  The wine selection seemed pretty good (not much of a vinophile).  The draft beer selection (which I noticed much later and didn't get to try) is unique and quite interesting.

There's a small menu for nibbles.  The trout salad is huge and can be split among 3 at least.  The sliders were also yummy.

Great hangout place ... definitely will be back!
author: F. P.

description:
I don't write on Yelp. Ever. Well, I've got a few cheeky reviews of me being pissed off about restaurants or bars that suck, but never anything that I'm been particularly fond of. 

This bar brings warmth into the Fillmore, elevating the quality of venue you should have to survive in this neighborhood. I am extremely happy to have a place I can walk a few steps to and have a local beer. 

The first night I went in, I sat and talked to the owners Jason and Cyrick for about 3 hours about their restaurant, and they were not only happy to answer questions about the gastropub like hangout, but more than willing to share about how the bar was built (it contains the inside of an OLD church from Napa) and how they went about selecting a menu, beers, and wines. 

Big win. I just don't look forward to the day it's so packed here that I can't get a beer.
author: Dustin M.

description:
Living in the Fillmore district, Fat Angel is my go-to place when I just want to grab a drink(beer/wine) during the week and just want to relax and chill. It is a very nice intimate place which serves a good collection of wine and even better collection of beers. 

The place is tiny and generally fairly crowded. So, there might be a wait but the ambiance is top-notch and the staff is friendly and nice. It is a fairly expensive place but very good to go for a drink or two. 

P.S. get their fries!!!!
author: Abhishek S.

description:
Very cool casual-elegant lounge in the Fillmore. Wide and interesting selection of unique beers and wines on tap for decent prices with a selection of snacks like cheeses, salami, mac and cheese, sliders, etc. Not really a dinner place, more of an after-dinner/late-night spot. The wine list is written in a fun, accessible way.

Perfect for hanging with any amount of friends, whether it's catching up with one pal or filling one of the bigger tables and getting stuff to share. In my experience it's been crowded/full but we never had to wait... it's relatively noisy but that's to be expected where people are drinking, eating, and making merry :) In its way it kind of reminds me of an old fashioned tavern, though the decor is classy.

Servers are efficient and friendly enough, but not overly so.

This is more of a 4.5 review. The only thing I really had a problem with... and this is just my preference, at the time I went they had a lack of any quality "lighter" beers. For their entire list/selection, even after I asked the bartender, there was only 1 lager that was very cheap compared to the others. I really enjoy Belgian beers, wheat beers, etc, and from a place that aims to have an extensive beer list I wanted more of my favorite beer "genre" to choose from! Although... checking their menu now I see a Belgian listed called "Beer of the Future".... I MUST RETURN FOR THAT. Further scrutiny shows that more such beers have appeared on their list, so I guess I can give them a whole-hearted 5 stars next time!

Oh yes, and did I mention they have MAPLE. BACON. BUTTER.??

EDIT: They serve brunch now on Saturday (during the Farmer's Market in the Fillmore area) and have an unusual/different selection, although you could get "normal" items too (eggs, sausage, bacon, etc). I had a really tasty breakfast sandwich. My roomie got a pink mimosa (pricey but good) and the breakfast potatoes, which were seriously good and a pretty big portion for $4! My other friend got the "Ploughman's Lunch" which is a nice little salami/cheese/fruit plate that comes with a small beer (though he traded it out for OJ, ha). Overall it was enjoyable but getting any "adult" beverages hikes up the tab quickly. The food/normal drinks are reasonably priced.
author: Remi X.

description:
Gem. 

Cozy and masculine solid wine / beer-geek bar. Great nibbles. Great atmosphere. Great music. Never too crowded. Perfection.
author: Andrea S.

description:
Delish!  I adore this place for many reasons:  intimate with small plates so you can try a bit of many things:  We ordered some cheeses (the Goat Gouda) was amazing.  The flatbreads were superb: very thin,crisp and hot.  The cherry tomato's on top explode with flavor.  
The grape/gorgonzola/walnet...flatbread was memorable, to say the least!  Then came a fresh, complex salad with Endive, gorgonzola, walnuts.  It sounds like the usual gang of salad'fixin's but it is not!  Superb.
When the little cast-iron dish of macaroni and cheese arrived we abandoned all attempts at civility. Smooth and creamy with a mix of cheeses and topped with a smattering of crunchy crumbs.  We finished with the sliders - very good! and stumbled out to the street; drunk on the good food alone.  High thee to Fat Angel..
We stuffed ourselves for about $20 a head, with three beverages.
author: Lisa E.

description:
The wine and ambiance gets a total 5 stars!!!

I love the draft wine and had the Grenache blend and it was delicious at least it still was delicious after 3 glasses.  My friend had the pinot and that was pretty good.

The ambiance is awesome.  I mean the chandelier is sick and the setup of an swank almost Parisian speakeasy.  The cork rim around the back bar was cool and the organ pipes above were great.

Okay why isn't it five stars, well a couple of things.  The bar seats were very uncomfortable (they did have hooks which is a plus), and at 7:30pm the one person working the room was overworked and service suffered a bit (not his fault) since it was a packed room.

Also, they should be a slight bit more generous on the cheese portions, it seemed quite small for $5 per cheese.
author: J. S.

description: We got here while waiting for a table elsewhere, and had a great time sipping Belgian brews, a black IPA and smelling the amazingly looking flatbreads that other tables were having. Staff was friendly and helpful, and seating outside was convenient even as the pub was crowded inside. Will be back!
author: Pablo D.

description:
On the one hand, I want this to remain a hidden gem and not be flooded by hipsters who don't live in this neighborhood. On the other hand, the owners were awesome and I want this place to succeed so I can continue to indulge myself. So, I fight down my bad angel and write a five star review for Fat Angel. 

Wine by draft (who knew?) was good, beer selection was totally awesome and the food was GREAT. The owners were working the place and I just adored them. And lots of drinks and snacks for four people was well under the usual price tag for SF.

The owners are gonna know me and hubby by sight in no-time.
author: Sarcastic T.

description: Great beer selection and the maple bacon butter was awesome!
author: Anthony D.

description:
First time I ate here it rocked , now my 2nd time around and I must say wont b going back , messed up my order repeatedly was so annoying bad service bad service! Food wasn't right twice
And by the time my food came I was already full of crackers 

I'm so disappointed

I would put 1 star but I really enjoyed my deserts at least that's why Putting 3 stars
author: Michelle K.

description: Malbec on draft... Sign me up! Solid place but be prepared for a wait at times. A must-do spot, for the Fillmore.
author: Calvin G.

description:
They get 4.5 stars why the .5 you ask? 

 only two small reasons, one the place is too small (i wish i could bring my whole crew but we wouldnt fit and it might be too lively for this mellow chill zone), and the portion of cheese is (sometimes depending on how is cutting it in the back) too small I would like a larger piece of cheese more consistently with single serving orders i understand when you order the combo the slices will be smaller but if i order a single i would like a good size slice!  also the variety of cheese is not very extensive (same animal same type of feel to each cheese) they rotate everything with a passion (beer/wine) i would like to see a new cheese every night or every week featured "off menu" on the board of "all things good" (its in the back with the cool drunk quotes on it) me and my lady are cheese addicts and this is the closest place to get it and get it good!  

Ok now that i have my cheese complaint out of the way lets concentrate on the rest of the 4.5 stars!

First the owners are awesome, generous with samples makes me wanna buy more!  You can tell they love what they do ( i used to be in the industry and this is something you can tell! it translates into the whole feel of the place) they are passionate about their hand selected ingredients beer and wine.  They both have GREAT taste, i dont agree with all their choices but i respect their commitment to their unique style and flavor choices, setting them apart from the other "run of the mill" locally owned restaurants in the area.  The wine list is second to none having varietals that span from the most basic to the rare tasty varietals the distinguished pallet craves! 

 Food is awesome, hands down always made fresh to order the pot pie is off the chain! the flat beards get all the love but dont forget the mac and cheese and sliders as well! 

In closing no matter what you choose at the angel it is going to be "heavenly"
author: C. M.

description: Excellent service and the food was amazing.  We had trout salad, mushroom flat bread and the sliders.  It was a wonderful way to start the evening.  The beer selection is wonderful and the place has a great vibe.  We sat at the bar and loved watching the bartender mix drinks.
author: Yevgenia F.

description: Absolutely fabulous. Food was a 10, service was very accommodating and friendly. Wine on draft is a must have and their bottled beer list is very extensive. My wife and I left happy! Best flatbread and best SLIDERS I have ever had.
author: Ross B.

description:
This place is legit. Wine on TAP?! Genius!
In the newly vamped up Fillmore area, but still sketchy enough to have street cred, this place is just a great spot to grab some wine and snacks with friends and unwind. 

Decor can't be beat...an old church organ? Who thinks of that??!
author: Lauren G.

description:
Pros: delish food (try the smoked trout salad). Reasonable prices, wine on tap and great beer selection. Cozy, interesting decor and neighborhood vibe. Great location off the fillmore.

Cons: mediocre service, can get crowded on weekends, slightly cramped especially if you're in one of the side bench tables.
author: Lauren D.

description:
I finally came here! Been wanting to for almost two fricken years and always forget. 
Was not even a plan to come here tonight, but DOSA was not open when we needed and then it hot me! FAT ANGEL! We walked to two dirty blocks literally dodging wacky homeless people and some other very interesting characters. Definitely do NOT walk around this area after dark alone or with a group of girls and no guys or big lesies to protect cuz it gets real SKETCHY! This area was one of many SF former neighborhoods I lived in as an adolescent and early adult, so I know very well that this is not an okay place to be vulnerable in.
Aside form this we walk in with no resies and are immediately seated. Very small place for which I was shocked by. Smelled amazing and the place was not packed yet. My fiend and I were greeted by a super nice women who was helpful off the bat in describing everything for us. We decided to each get this PIMM's cocktail which was odd but unique. If you get this then STIR IT! It does not look like it needs to be stirred, but it does! The bottom is where the cava liquor is. 
Once we discovered that, it was super yummy!
We ordered the endive salad and the mac an cheese. NOTE about the mac: there is much more to it than shown on the menu. It is not a basic mac and cheese. It is spacey and filled with seasoning not typical of mac and cheese. I think it was a chipotle type seasoning so if that's a problem let them know in advance in case they can make it without. 
The salads are HUGE! Enough for 3-4 people. Far too much for us. There is a reason they are around $11 each.....because they are the meal!
At some point out waitress asked if we wouldn't mind moving over one table because this large group without a resie walked in. We had zero issues moving and as such, the owner gave us a large and super amazing creme brulee on the house! SOOOO nice and so sweet! We would definitely return. Service is stellar and food is super yummy. Got out of these for $42. Not bad at all!
author: Unicorn U.

description:
Wine list is great.  Beer list is great.  Ambiance is really nice - casual but not divey, pretty interior, not ridiculously loud even though it was pretty packed.  

Service was super friendly and helpful, and everything we ordered was really tasty.  The little wine descriptions are hilarious, too.  

If I lived in this neighborhood, I'd be a regular.
author: Stacey M.

description:
I rarely give 4 stars but Fat Angel is my local hangout.  I have introduced so many friends and family members to this place.  It has become my place to go whenever I want to relax and enjoy a glass of wine.

The owner, Cyrick, has definitely made the place a second home for many people.  When you're there, as often or as rare, you feel a sense of connection to the place.  It's extremely chill with good wine and food.  Since it's still hasn't been discovered by many people, the crowd is typically couples or just good friends catching up.  The music in the background is usually an eclectic mixture of music put together by Cyrick that definitely makes the experience that much more pleasurable.

I would recommend trying their mushroom flat bread to go with your wine or the for dessert, try the apple bread pudding.  Those two items are absolutely my favorite there.
author: Carmen C.

description: Mac and cheese + endive salad = life changed. what a gem to find! and totally impressed my mom who loves good wine and small places!
author: Kristina B.

description: Visited this place after lounging at Sheba Ethiopian Piano Bar: http://www.yelp.com/biz/sheba-piano-lounge-san-francisco#hrid:TUwexsShPlf1VA2Yy2YAPA.  Within walking distance and what an amazing find!  Quaint, unpretentious wine bar with an impressive grape selection.  Ordered a tasty cheese sampling with preserve accompaniments that topped off our wines beautifully.  Staff friendly, willing and able to converse in conversation.  Spoke with the owners and they mentioned that the bar was made from a gutted out pipe organ and surrounding wood reclaimed from an old chapel.  The dramatic chandelier was brought in piece by piece from Pennsylvania. Nice ambiance with just enough wood, low lighting and a marble bar top.  Seriously wish this was in my neck of the woods.  Relatively new addition and from what I gather a welcome injection into a burgeoning neighborhood.
author: Kalani C.

description: Fat Angel rocks. It's a total gem tucked just off of the main Fillmore Street drag. I came here with some friends and enjoyed everything: a great draft brew, delicious wine delivered via a keg-system, and some quite creative small plates. The trout salad and the beef sliders were full of flavor and a perfect size to share family style. The staff was extremely accommodating, especially considering that its a pretty small place.  Fat Angel is totally worth the visit!
author: Tim N.

description:
A GREAT BEER selection for Downtown San Francisco standards. My last two trips to San Francisco have really highlighted the lack of beer selection at the bars, pubs, restaurants, etc. Which I find SO hard to believe! This place is surrounded by incredible breweries (Lagunitas, Bear Republic, Moylan's, Russian River, Mendocino, etc). Are they shipping all their beer to us lucky ducks in Portland who already have an incredible beer scene??? Well I guess... Thank you! But I still want to find good beer in San Francisco. 
Thank you Fat Angel for providing me with my first great pint in the city. Fat Angel has 9 Beers on Tap, which vary from local and east coast breweries to beers from Belgium. They also have an elaborate bottled selection. The layout is a bit cozy when sitting at the dining room tables. I always prefer the bar, but they also have some lower bar seating thats right in front of their front window, which opens nicely to beautiful weather. Bartendars were Great and knowledgable. My friend and I decided to order the Wild Mushroom & White Truffle Oil w/pecorino flatbread which was discounted for Happy Hour and it was SO Good! Very thin crust and the mushrooms were incredible! If the rest of the food is as good as the flatbread, I gotta get back and try more of this menu! 

Thank you Fat Angel!
author: Windy S.

description:
We came here after walking a friend home to the Fillmore Center.  This establishment doesn't fit the norm of the other places in the neighborhood.  The neighborhood are a mixture of Korean restaurants,fast food establishments, Jazz bars & Yoshi's.  So it was a pleasant surprise to stumble upon this place

Nice choice of wines and beers.  Friendly knowledgeable staff.  The prices were right in line with other wine bars.  I can't comment on the food since we didn't order. 

Will come back.
author: John C.

description: Chill vibes...great beers  from Stone Brewery, Mill Valley BrewWorks, and everything in between (on draft).  Typically a ton of selection in bottle as well.  This warm, artisan hole-in-the-wall sits off the edge of the Fillmore District and is a nice escape from the day.  I'm not a huge foodie but check out the selection of cheese and selection of finely sliced meats to go with that Hopageddon Imperial IPA from Napa, CA.
author: H H.

description:
I absolutely love this place! The selection of beers is phenomenal, and the meat and cheese plates are amazing. They have one of the best bread puddings I've ever had as well. It's a terrific place for hanging out with friends, or just for a small, intimate get together.

The only thing is that it's getting more and more busy these days. You're better off going earlier in the evening, rather than after 9 or 10. It gets so crowded inside that you can't even move around. I'm happy that they're doing so well, but it does make it difficult to go there for a quiet drink late at night. Oh well, I still love it here! It's definitely our stand-by drinking establishment!!!
author: Amanda A.

description:
I have really wanted to love this place, but after a few visits I have only fallen in like. 

We went last night for dinner and drinks before a show at the Fillmore. We each had a glass of draft wine (cab for him, zin for me) and they were delish. Being draft doesn't seem to make it any cheaper than other glasses, except that it is a dollar off at happy hour. 

We also shared the red grape and prosciutto pizza, a cheese plate, and the sliders. The sliders were the fave but none of it was "i can't wait to go back and have it again" good. Our total bill was about $40 which i thought was very reasonable. 

I love the low-lit ambiance (I by no means needed a candle to read the menu... ). When we got there at around 6:30 there were only one or two other people seated at the bar. I was disappointed because the last time we stopped by, we were also the only ones.  It kind of kills the mood when it is silent and empty. It started filling up though by the time we got our food. The chandelier is awesome and I love the big old wooden bar and the corks lining the top. 

If I lived closer, I would love this place to grab a glass of wine and relax. I just don't know that it is worth the trek from North Beach.
author: Meagan C.

description: Just went here for beers before a show at the Fillmore. Small space but great selection of beers, servers/bartenders were super attentive and nice, and had a great vibe all around. Didn't eat here but definitely will come back so I can.
author: Kim M.

description: Great selection of worldly beers and yummy apps, however, I was disappointed that they didn't have Blue Moon. The area in which this bar/restaurant is located is not so great, but it does have cool ambiance.
author: Pina C.

description: The wine they offer is great , it a fun bar the bartender is nice and some people I meat was out of towners  and they were having a great time at this bar. They were just happy to relax at fat angel. They said  the will be back next week I told them I met them here. Once again the bar is like cheers and the people our friendly
author: Ted T.

description: I won't remember this place except the fat angel statue is kinda cool looking. The waiter totally screwed up our order.  He redeemed himself by giving us our food for free.  Stil...the appetizer was not good.
author: Byron L.

description: Love everything about this place. The wine, the service, the food (pot pie! and mac and cheese! and kale salad!). We moved to a new neighborhood, but still drive back here just for this place.
author: Maddy D.

description: Hung out here after a couple of drinks at Social Study. Love this place! Great food, and great service - low key but nice/helpful service. I will definitely be coming back here for light bites and good wine!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Sweet little wine bar in the Fillmore..

Arriving feels like showing up at rustic cabin in the Alps where there's a fireplace roaring, friends have cooked a warm, hearty dinner and just as you sit, vintage wine & olives arrive. Its a soothin' sorta scene, and momentarily, cheeks go rosy.

Besides a lovely list of grape n bubbly, nary an ill-words can be uttered with a menu section devoted to assorted butters?! At next visit, i'll also look to taste their smoked trout.
author: Rachel S.

description:
GREAT new addition to the Fillmore/Yoshi's area.  The flatbreads are delicious, the drinks creative, and the service more enthusiastic than any I've experienced in months.  Why?  Because the owners - a couple of young guys who used to live nearby - are serious and sincere about creating a spot where "you can just hang out," as one of them said to me.  

The vibe is casual and comfortable.  There is table and bar seating and a nice dim, candlelit ambiance.  The menu offers choices whether you want just a snack, dessert, or a full dinner.  

Thumbs UP!
author: Molly P.

description: Great beers, cool staff. They change out the tap beers frequently which is awesome but sad if you get attached to one.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
Woah there. Five stars is getting a little carried away. Not quite THAT amazing.

But they do have bacon butter, which is worth almost five stars alone.

In general, the food selection is limited, but they do everything well, and it's all delicious and high quality.

I also love that they have wine on draft - hope this trend catches on. Love the hilarious wine descriptions. It apppears like this is in a former church, which is also really cool.

Overall, this area desperately needs a place like this, and I hope it iwll improve the quality of life.
author: Mark A.

description:
Wow - reading all the reviews I feel like I have to go back and try this place again.  

I'll start with the good and end with the blah: location in the hood, extensive wine list, friendly service and the flatbread pizza.  I went here maybe during the first month Fat Angel opened, and both owners were really pleasant and took the time to go over the wine menu with me which is greatly appreciated.  The place is also reasonably priced, which makes it a good place to head to after a long day at work.

That said though, I don't know if I would come back if it wasn't 5 minutes from my house.  I ordered the fried capers and smoked trout salad.  BLAH.  The fish didn't taste right, the capers for some reason had an oddly fishy taste.  I tried the pot pie; I wasn't that impressed but then again, it was my first pot pie so maybe I just don't like that dish.

Another blah point is the decor.  Not a fan - the place isn't cozy, the ambiance feels off and the fixtures (molding, the corners) just doesn't look complete.  The lighting/coloring just isn't pleasant as well.  

Anyways, as it's close by and reasonable, I'll head back in the next month to try this place again and re-review if necessary.
author: Laura H.

description:
I like drinking wine but I am not educated and well versed on it so places like this scare me a little. Luckily my friends that were hosting me for the night come here often. Once we got settled I realized that this place is nothing to be scared of,  it doesn't feel pretentious at all!
One friend took the lead on ordering the bottles of wine just by reading their "creative" descriptions that have absolutely nothing to do with wine: one of our bottle descriptions mentioned a tranny's tuck job... hahaha 
Food is delicious 
the flat bread with mushrooms: yum 
sliders: amazing mayo spread with spicy pickles on the side (my fav of the night!) 
mac 'n cheese: ooey gooey greatness 
pot pie: ehhhhh, although my friends loved it 
I would have liked to try the draft wine just so I could say that I've had draft wine 
If I could get my bf to SF than I would definitely bring him here on a date!
author: Sheree B.

description: Fat angels? More like fat hipsters. I was showing some friends from out of town sf and used yelp to find this bar. Parking was limited so I had my friends park the car so that I could go in and grab a table. INSTANT DISCRIMINATION. The snobs who worked there (except the Hispanic waiter who initially greeted me) were horrible. I asked for a table for 4 and got seated at a two seater. They acted like I was going to dine and dash the entire time. I looked over the menu as I waited for my friends, and in that time almost every obnoxious waiter (especially the pretentious dbag in the jorts who looks like the guy from the mountain goats) Came over to me and asked me what I wanted when it wasn't even busy and said they were going to get busy hinting for me to leave. I was pressured into buying a $20 bottle of mead that was a fair price if they included a free bj along with it. After ordering I asked if I could switch to a bigger table and they laughed and said "maybe when you're friends get here" rolling her eyes. Long story short my friends got there we closed the tab and I left her money plus tip which I didn't want to give. (I was a waitress and I have never in my life treated any of my customers so rudely). Then jorts (jean shorts) and waspy hipster girl run after my friends and I claiming that we hadn't paid! They've got good brew at horrible prices, but the pretentious hipsters that serve there are what make me never want to come back.
author: Bela V.

description: Overheard a patron say "this place is WAY better than claim jumper!"
author: Chris I.

description: My friend and I were roaming around just bar hopping around the area.  I saw that Fat Angel was around and wanted to come here since I found out about it.  We went in and had a few beers.  Love that they had an eclectic beer list and wine list.  It was super late almost closing so we just decided to drink and have a good conversation.  I'd definitely go back just to try some of the snacks and such...Intimate small place good for a few friends and/or date.
author: Kim D.

description: The reviews for Fat Angel really deceived me because I thought the service here was relatively terrible.  We ordered some drinks and the cheese and meat plates.  When the cheese plate arrived, it was sort of just plopped down in front of us, with no identification of which cheese was which.  When we were done with our first glass of wine, it proved to be almost impossible to get anyone's attention for a second (or third) glass, which was pretty unacceptable given that we were sitting at the bar in front of all of the employees.
author: Jenny R.

description:
Incredible spot for a casual date or pre-Fillmore night out.  A small side-street off Fillmore, great indoor ambiance and outdoor seating, too.  We ordered red wine and the house nut + cheese platters, which were excellent on the warm night.

No-pressure service, unhurried conversation and relatively little street noise to interrupt the evening.  I left impressed, only $-2-0 lighter, without having a chance to try their unique craft/belgian beer menu...I will be back for sure :)

A little reluctant to write this review, and reveal my new secret find ;)
author: matt k.

description:
this is my second time going here and the food was sooooo good the mini burgers was yumy. The customer serves is the BOMB.... the wine list is cheap. This place is a place that you can bring a date if you are in a budget. 

HIGHLY recommended to everyone. 

AS GOOD AS IT GETS! above average.
author: Hanley C.

description: I loved this place so much that I am going to review it and give it five stars for food, service and ambience. The trout salad was awesome as were the sliders. Prices were reasonable and wine was good. A great place to stop in before going to a show at the Fillmore as it is right nearby.This review is not the opinion of anyone else but me personally.
author: Janet P.

description: Went here for the first time before catching a movie at Kabuki Sundance Cinemas. Our hostess, Jessica, was awesome! She recommended some really neat beers and we loved it. Beers were a bit on the expensive side but they have a great list to choose from. Food menu was limited, but the food was great. We ordered the sliders and the Mac n Cheese. Both were yummy. We'll definitely be back and if they expand their food menu a bit, we'll be back more often!
author: S B.

description:
The best chicken pot pie ever - grandma's recipe won me over !

Terrific service, thanks - you are doing a great job with this place, keep up the hard work - looks like it is winning people over 1
author: Kathy N.

description:
Fat Angel, you are too cute and a wine bar to boot. Love your cool chandelier over the bar and overall design. Just wish you would fix some of your chairs with uneven legs. 

Found Fat Angel on Yelp while searching for a place to go before the Fillmore. I tried the Sangiovese/Merlot/Montepulciano (super rich) and the Malbec and they were very good. For food we tried the two flat-breads on the menu. Both were delicious with the mushroom being the best. 

Next time I have to try the maple bacon butter which is a killer combo I have tried on a donut. Sounds great with a rich red wine. 

Service is OK but a little slow, so relax and don't expect perfect service. The location, interior, food and wine are worth a visit.
author: Eileen H.

description:
this place is GREAT !!! i realize the menu is limited... but the wine list is NOT !!!

AWESOME mac'n'cheese !

the butter is LEGIT !  ...awwww mannn!

the owners are SUPER humble !

LOVE IT ! LOVE IT ! LOVE IT ! LOVE IT ! LOVE IT ! LOVE IT ! 

TEN STARS !!!

crazy thing ... i don't even live in the city!
author: Tim M.

description: Been here twice - one of my favorites so far in the city and the best place to go to after a movie at the Sundance Kabuki. Sampled quite a few of the draft wines and tasted the cheese and meat platters - all delicious.
author: Anny P.

description:
fantastic beers and awesome friendly service. went there with 5 of us on a rainy night, and they were super cool and welcoming.

we had the basil marinara flatbread, meat and cheese plate, bacon butter, and fried capers. they were yummy, but thought the portions for the meat and cheese plate was a bit skimpy, but still good. 

i would definitely go back again soon to try more beers in the bottles!!

love this place.
author: Dot K.

description:
"people who like to drink light beer dont like the taste of beer; they just like to pee alot"

this is the first thing written on the chalkboard menu.

stopped by here the other night for a couple drinks and some bar food.

the venue itself is tiny. the place was packed and LUCKILY 2 people were standing up as from the bar as we walked in...

after grabbing the bar stools, we sat down and ordered drinks from their extensive beer list...and i mean UBER extensive...their beer list, although probably not as crazy as the beer "encyclopedia" at monks kettle, was very well organized...especially if you arent familiar with all the different flavor notes of different beers...

as we perused thru the food menu, i was a bit disappointed because there wasnt any "food, food" as i was hoping for, other than some mac and cheese...we opted for a charcuterie plate, a pretzel, and some of their overpriced butter (4.50 for a spoonful of house special butter in an array of flavors)

the pretzel was good. the meats (although nothing really stood out) was good as well.  my favorite part of the food was the dollop of mustard that they thew on every dish...great flavor and it really tied the saltiness of the cured meats with the different breads on the plate...

all in all, service was cool because we were sitting smack dab in the middle of the bar...bartender was nice and helpful...nothing great here but definitely nothing bad...very very chill wine/beer bar indeed.
author: Kyu L.

description: Went here with the parents and were sat almost immediately in the window. Lovely interior, great food, amazing beer and wine selection. The staff was friendly, prompt, and helpful answering questions. We ordered the charcuterie plate, pot pie, and the mac and cheese. The charcuterie plate was excellent even for those that were skeptical at first. The pot pie and mac was homecookin' goodness. Hip but not obnoxious a great laid back vibe. We will certainly be back.
author: Kim K.

description:
A rocking little wine/beer bar near the Fillmore. Tucked off the street, you really do need the sign to find the place. However, it's well worth the hunt. Delicious wines and beers on tap, plus numerous bottles. The bartenders (including the owner) are super friendly. 

I'll definitely be back when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Jenn G.

description:
To be honest I was pretty sure these reviews were padded because the owners are so sweet. One of them looks like Wesley from "The Princess Bride" (isn't that worth an extra star by itself?). The place is also oozing with heart. You can tell this place is someones dream come reality.   

My boyfriend and I have been keeping our eye on the place for a couple of months, since we live close to it and frequently walk by. Last night (Thursday) we decided to give it a go. 

I am proud to say I am a total food and wine snob and was very impressed. We got the Cesar Salad, Mac and Cheese, chicken pot pie and drinks. I tried the draft white, BF had the Casey Jones draft beer. The drinks were marvelous the food UH-mazing. 

So much so, in fact, that at 5:30 (AM!!) this morning my boyfriend and I were once again discussing the merits of Fat Angel! In particular, the Pot Pie; me, being an borderline alchie, was thinking about the draft wine, while nodding that the pot pie was most excellent. 

Fat Angel congratulations you deserve your 5 stars!
author: M B.

description:
I lived around the corner from this place and after a while mastered the "go-to" hours.. 
Perfect date-nite location, very small and intimate..
I was partial to the caesar salad with rotisserie chicken... yumm 
The mac and cheese is also killer..

This is the place where you go, sit and enjoy the ambiance. There aren't many of its kind left.
author: Taylor B.

description:
This place is so pleasant.  :)  I can't think of another word to describe it.  Mind you I get my eatin' done before I go out drinkin' so I haven't tried their food yet... but I love to have drinks here with someone I love.  :)

Their champagne with house bitters is delicious!  And I love to try out their exotic beers, pricey as they may be... it's interesting, and not a lot of bars have "interesting" beer  menus...

It's right down the street and around the corner from my other favorite place, Festa, so that's a star right there too.

Maybe I'm seeing this place through rose-colored glasses because I've only ever been here on dates... but I was dying to try it and when I finally did, I insisted date night includes a stop here... because we always end up at aforementioned Festa anyway.

Just a little side note; those bar stools have this weird lump in the croch area... so just watch out the first few times you sit in them.  Hahaha..!
author: Kitty O.

description:
I love Fat Angel. I cannot say enough kind things about this place. Such a charming & inviting place. I loved that the owner remembered us from our visit a year prior. A cool guy. You can tell he has a passion for wine, beer & good eats.

The wine & beer menu is attractive and everything on the food menu that we have tried has been a winner. This includes: The 5 butter platter (Who wants to eat butter by the spoonful? Not me, that is not until I sampled the Mmm, Butter! platter. Holy crap the cinnamon chocolate butter was insanely delicious. I have since internet stalked Mmm, Butter! so I can buy her butter by the tubs). The 5 cheese platter, awesome. The Sliders, simple yet really flavorful. Endive salad, decent & yummy. FA's Chicken Pot Pie, oh snap. Mac-Daddy's Mac & Cheese, sinful! The Apple bread pudding w/ Chantilly cream, so fantastic that I'm salivating just thinking about it. And lastly, the Blueberry Cobbler, YUUUM! 

It's a good thing I live 40 miles away from this place. Otherwise I would be a frequent visitor and I'd put on a bunch of weight.
author: Melody M.

description:
Fat Angel is a welcomed addition to the neighborhood, particularly if you're looking for a pre-show drink match up spot with your friends before hitting up The Fillmore.

Beautiful space, friendly staff, convenient location, available parking, delicious eats.... what's not to love?
author: Katie C.

description:
Snazzy. I got a Red Rocket beer; it was very red! And strong. And good! My companions both got wine, I think a Pinot recommended by the bartender. It's a cozy little place, on the upscale end, and perfect before a show at the Fillmore.

Apparently they have food as well, but I don't think I saw that menu. I will probably be back if I can remember the place; it's off toe the side on O'Farell.
author: Ken L.

description:
Genius idea I wish I'd had. Open a white boy comfort food joint in the middle of the asian ghetto, thus giving all the white boy asian fetishists somewhere non korean bbq to eat, and all the white boy loving asian girls somewhere to go below their apartments where they have a spectacularly high chance of seeing white boys. 

Been a couple of times and the food is solid if unspectacular. Had the pot pie which tasted suspiciously like it had come from somewhere else, the mac and cheese which was highly acceptable and something else I cant remember. Not brilliant, but certainly not rubbish. If I lived in the area I would probably be quite a regular, but then I am right in their target demographic.
author: Lager K.

description: I really liked this place... chill vibe...  kinda feels like a fancy neighborhood bar/cafe with a ton of beers... it's fun trying the different beers they have... bartenders were friendly and offered suggestions, descriptions, etc... they have a small food selection and we had already had dinner so all we got was the pretzel which was pretty good, but I'd like to come here to just eat and drink.... it's pretty small space, but I'd like to come here again.
author: Easter E.

description: Came here twice with some girlfriends.  A good quiet place to hang out if you want to talk and have some wine and food and they do have indoor and outdoor seating.  They have a pretty good wine selection here.  My favorite though is the meat and cheese plates....especially with their mustard...so good. Also, they have a good mac n cheese and I normally don't even like mac n cheese but next time I will have to come back to order their giant salad!
author: Allison T.

description: The pizza here is amaze!!!  I would recommend the classic peperoni or the vegie.  Service is fast and staff is friendly.  When you just need a quick bite to eat or need a pizza while watching a sporting event I would defiantly recommend Fat Angel.
author: Nina S.

description:
This is a nice new spot in the Fillmore. They have a great wine list, and have both wine and beer on tap! 

We stopped in last night before heading to the Kabuki Theater to see a movie. Food portions are more like tapas style (but American cuisine). There isn't a ton of variety, but we had a nice cheese plate, a LARGE salad with smoked trout, and a serving of homemade mac & cheese. The trout was delicious & fresh. The mac & cheese was very nice, but probably not worth $9.

It's a little on the high-end for it to become a regular spot, but it's a great place to come in for a drink and a bite to eat before going out in the Fillmore.
author: sam h.

description: Wine selection was okay ... I'm giving 3.5 stars for a great ambience and especially the presentation and taste of our 5 little mini appetizers. We had the chèvre, boar meat shavings, maple bacon butter, spicy chili butter, and some sweet jelly that was all laid out nicely on a cutting board with a bunch of precut bread slices - perfect to enjoy our mini appetizers with.
author: Brandon M.

description:
A super pleasant surprise! Deceptively cute and cozy inside even though it's in a weird apartment (?) building. 

Mac & Cheese = DELISH. Smoked trout salad on first try was very good but had a little too much dressing. Second visit we asked for light dressing and it was perfect - it's big too!

But the best part is that they have a great beer AND wine list! Including decent happy hour specials (with BIG pours on the wine) on both. I've been trying to figure out why the city seems to want to segregate beer and wine drinkers. Not at Fat Angel. Finally!

Plus, it's near the Kabuki theater and The Fillmore - two places near which I always struggle to find a place I like to grab a drink before the show. Yay!

Bonus: the staff is great. Really friendly, knowledgable and accommodating.
author: robin b.

description:
Inexpensive, but not that cheap. 
Good wine on tap, but not great wine.
Ok food, not amazing. 
The service was certainly not very attentive. 

I was there on a Thursday night, and there were some drunk 40-something ladies pretending they were the foursome from Sex and The City. Maybe this place is better for the happy-hour crowd. 

If you're in the neighborhood its work dropping in, but I would not plan a whole night around attending Fat Angel.
author: Halley B.

description: Can't wait to go back! I loved the atmosphere and loved the food. My friend and I had the Mac and cheese and chicken pot pie. Both to die for. Also, I usually don't like beer, but I loved the beer with pear flavors (forgot its name)- very light and refreshing!
author: Felicia F.

description: I've been here several times, and it's generally fine. I like the food, there's plenty of it, and the wine is decent.  It always seems a bit understaffed, but service hasn't ever been too bad. But my god was it bad on Friday night.  It was the worst service of any place I've eaten in San Francisco since moving here 8 years ago. The waiter forgot about half our order, didn't apologize, made no effort to make things better. I got some real attitude for daring to ask for a plate and a fork, and a knife, and napkins (I thought asking for a place setting conveyed well enough what I wanted, but these items came out at different times, only after specific requests).  Refills on water were not happening, despite requests. Finished plates weren't cleared as new items came out. It was almost comical how bad the service was. As much as I've enjoyed this place in the past, I doubt I'd take the chance of going again. And I definitely wouldn't recommend it to someone else, knowing how truly awful the service can be.
author: C M.

description: Delicious, lightly peppery zinfandel on tap that can be ordered by the half-bottle. Robust beer (!) menu. Cheese, flatbreads, and luscious butter as appetizers. What's not to love?
author: Laura C.

description:
I live in the neighborhood, and must have walked by this place a million times before noticing it!  Luckily friends that live further up towards the panhandle have made the trek and recommended my now new favorite local spot!

We had a party with about 9 people show up without reservations this past Friday.   The staff was great in seating people and then giving us the nook by the bar and window.  We passed around the flatbread pizzas and sliders and had many wonderful glasses of beer and wine - All reasonably priced (sooooo many wines by the glass!)

Highly recommended, and it's one of those rare spots that you really want to get back to as soon as possible!
author: Zachary B.

description: Love this place, such a charming neighborhood joint if you want an unpretentious to place to relax with friends over wine, beer and light food. I love the laid-back, friendly vibe.  They let you samples a little wine or beer if you can't decide.  The kale salad (add chicken) is so good (and big enough to split), I dream about it.  The mac and cheese is really good, as is the cheese platter.  Really friend servers/bartenders all around.
author: Rose T.

description: What's not to love about this gastropub?! (well except the hipsters)  Meat platter, cheese platter, sliders, mac and cheese and chocolate mousse?!  We crammed ourselves into the bar while we waited for a tiny little table to free up.  The bartender was awesome, our server was great and the food came out steadily and was yummy.
author: Poppy C.

description:
I contemplated my review for a few days after visiting Fat Angel - for a few reasons...couldn't decide if I loved it or not... 

Here are the pro's: 

-delicious, draft wine 
-SLIDERS - they are AMAZING 
-nice decor 

Here are the con's: 

-waited 60 minutes for a table after being told it'd be 15-minute wait 
-pricey 'house' wine - $11/glass 
-very small - not recommended for a large party 

I'm glad I visited - but not sure if I'd visit again, mainly because it is so small and hard to get service. As others mentioned, the more popular it becomes, the harder it will be to get a seat.
author: Heidi B.

description: Awesome drink selection and atmosphere.  Perfect place to bring a date for a drink and chat....  Bohemian style
author: Ryan T.

description: Lived across the street from here for a year, always brought my friends from out of town in, and I wanted to introduce them to my favorite place to grab a beer in SF.  Cy was usually my bartender, always able to recommend a good beer with a big hop character, and the apple bread pudding is to DIE FOR.
author: Cory B.

description: I've been coming here since opening day, I can't believe this is my first review of the place. I have loved it from the start, not too many places this close to home with such an incredible beer selection. They also have an awesome list of wines, my favorites being on tap. I have tried the flatbreads, mac n cheese,sliders, and the caeser salad, all of which were very tasty! The salads come family style, sharable 3-4 people. And delicious!! The vibe in here is cool and casual, with a beautifully lit ambiance from the candles and smooth reclaimed bar,equipped with brass pipes from an old church organ. On a warm night, drink/dine at one of the outdoor tables overlooking the Fillmore Center Plaza. From my long-winded review, I guess you could say I heart Fat Angel:)
author: Shelley M.

description:
Cute place.  Great wine - got the 'draft' pinot which was cheap and fantastic.  The downside?  The food.  Sliders: overdone and the buns were burned.  Badly.  The mac n cheese needed more better, stickier cheese and wasn't warm enough.

So go for the wine and atmosphere.  And go down the street to eat.

P.S. the flat bread did look really good but I did not get it.
author: Nate P.

description: More than a hundred beer selection, great food; but usually too noisy for any meaningful conversation; if you can find a seat (or a place to stand) and don't mind the noise, this is a lovely neighborhood germ.
author: Stacey F.

description:
I was torn between 3 and 4 stars. My friend can't get enough of this place because the Wine and Beer selections are so unique and plentiful. I guess for that alone most who want that should give it 4 or 5 stars.

I admit that the space is unique. I guess it used to be part of an old church or something because the remanents of an original organ is in there and there are some restored wood seating (pews?). 

It always seems to be happening, but it's just so tiny, it seems the other tables are always on top of you and when it's full it's hard to hear anything over the din. Some unique and decent food like Flatbread and Good Mac and Cheese. If it was a little cheaper, I'd go more stars, but a solid 3.5
author: Mike T.

description: Beyond delicious chicken pot pie, huge amazing salad perfectly dressed, incredible wine selection and unique atmosphere. All relatively affordable! The service was ok, a little slow...but my friend and I were in no rush so it didn't matter. Somehow we snagged a table as soon as we walked in the door on a Friday night around 7pm. Good stuff, I will be back.
author: D P.

description: What a great little spot.  it's cute, classy, and is the perfect place to start or end an evening with a beer made for sipping.  For such a small space, it does gets surprisingly loud inside, so if possible, snag a seat outside and ask to have the heater turned on.
author: Jenn C.

description: Love Fat Angel.  Everything is great.  People are super nice.  No, it's not French Laundry, but it's awesome.
author: Christopher B.

description:
okay so to be honest, I didn't spend a great amount of time here or intensely dissect the menu.  Nor am I a wine connoisseur (or any type of expert for that matter), but this place takes the cake for decor, attitude, service, and style.  of course the beer I had was superior to most others I am drinking, but even if I were downing a PBR, the charm of the place alone would have had me feelin' like a champion.  the flatbread was superb and the beer great too.  

tucked just off Fillmore and a little further down than the rest of lower pac heights, this place is a gem worth unearthing.  trust me - treat yourself to all that is the Fat Angel - you won't be let down!
author: Mason S.

description: I came here with a group of friends once and we bought a bottle of wine at the bar. This place is pretty small, so probably not the best for large groups. Superb service, the workers are always very attentive and friendly. I didn't a chance to try any of the food, but looking at reviews of this place, it seems that the food is delish! I will have to try it the next time I'm back!
author: Caroline L.

description:
I wish I could say that this place sucks and persuade Yelpers to not come here, but that of course would be all for selfish reasons... so that it wasn't so damn busy all the time I have a craving for their Textbook Cab and Endive salad! 
I must admit that I probably come here too often with my random dates. So I'm pretty sure the bartenders & rest of staff find that pretty comical, but hell if a guy asks me out and asks me for my suggestions, well Fat Angel is definitely on my list! 
It's a perfect date place. I love that it's not  huge or generic. The vintage cozy decor reminds me each and every time why I love living in the city. The cool inviting bar with the organ-like pipes way above, the enormous elk greeting everyone who arrives, and my favorite: the chandelier that reminds me of the one on James Cameron:  The Titanic. Oh I forgot the  charming dining area has actual pews from a church. The overall vibe and clientele is somewhat eclectic and granola, so no need to dress up, but who really does in SF unless it's a high-end sit-down dinner. 
Small food menu but amazingly delicious. My favorites as mentioned earlier is the Endive salad but also love the flatbread with mushrooms with truffle... yummmm:)
It's just beer and wine here... not  a beer drinker, but they seem to always have  quite a list. Wine... well another reason why i come here.  Jenny the sommelier has great suggestions; she's usually behind the bar. The only negative thing i have to say about this place is when it is busy, service can be painfully slow. So I try to come when it's not:)
author: Myra M.

description: Salads are huge and delicious.  The Charcuterie plate is rediculously small portions for the price.  I mean it looked like 1/2 oz of pate and about the same for the otehr items.  The Muchroom and truffle oil flatbread was dry and did not taste of truffle oil.  I think they might have put the oil in the mushroom past before it was cooked.  Truffle oil should be put on after it is out of the oven.  Great selection of bottled beers.
author: Mike P.

description:
While entertaining some friends from out of town, we were having trouble deciding where to go for drinks. Eventually some one came up with the brilliant idea of going to the first bar that we saw. Since I live quite literally across the street from Fat Angel, this ended up being our spot.

It was really cute and cozy inside and the wine list was extensive without being completely overwhelming. We shared a bottle of red wine that is made in somebody's garage or something and it was well received by all! The best part, however, would be the service. It's a small place, which I suppose helps with the attentiveness of the staff, but it seemed our server was always one step ahead of us. All in all, a great evening and will gladly return again soon.
author: Wayne F.

description: friendly staff, excellent duck liver pate & truffle tremor cheese to start us off for the wonderful evening.
author: Jordan H.

description:
I love this place. I love it so much I am afraid to post a review as I want to make sure I am able to get a seat when I go. The wines are always excellent and the food fantastic. The beer list is endless. Great ambiance and the folks who work there are amazing. How the manage all the people in such a small place is beyond me. I feel so lucky to have it in my neighborhood!

The flatbreads make for a fantastic bite to share along with your wine!
author: Kristen N.

description:
1. Great selection (see their website and make sure to check out the ridiculous descriptions) 

2. Friendly and knowledgable staff

3. Chocolate butter?! What? Love it!

4. Warm and intimate ambiance

5. Classy place for a date or friend meet-up
author: Kelly S.

description: Wow, this place gets a lot of reviews. The beer is overpriced, considering you can buy many of these in a well-stocked specialty store. The food, however, is delicious. I like that you can share easily with 2 or 12, and that the flavors and ingredients are unexpected but work well, like their pizzas or the salad with HUGE candied pecans, blue cheese and mixed greens.
author: Nur K.

description: Good beer, decent food, and good hang out.  Not great for kids because it does get a little cramped and loud.  Had the meat and cheese plat, mushroom pizza, and smoked fish salad.  It was huge - 4 of us had 2 servings each to finish it.
author: grace C.

description:
This fat angel is stripped down, raw and unpretentious~ 
 
The interior design has a subtle warmth that welcomes the casual person to the most scrutinizing client.   You can see that everything was well thought out and carefully selected for a casual wine tasting experience.  From the floors that are roughed up plank wood to the unfinished wall sconces and antique chandeliers you can see how deliberate their choices are.

Carrying the upscale casual feeling  even to the small menu that consist of simple items that work well with wines. The flat bread is out of this world and you will never look at sliders the same once you try this fat little angel's little yummies!

The service amazing, probably because were being served my one of the owners. He too, was warm and welcoming.  He took the time to share the knowledge he has regarding wine without taking to much time from us.

There are 38 wines and 2 on tap that rotate out... 

*** Oh Yah,  Did I mention wine on TAP?***

This is a new wonderful wine pub that I wish  the very best for them and hope they succeed... My friend was right when she said this place has my name written all over it... It was truly a great experience!
JOB WELL DONE!  A+  in my book
author: Pamela N.

description: I went here last week with my wife on a spur-of-the-moment date. It was a beautiful night with mild weather. We had to wait only a few moments before we were seated outside. Service was excellent and friendly. Food was tasty and drinks were good too. definitely recommend for a casual date or pre/post Kabuki snack stop.
author: Geoffrey H.

description: Great little establishment close to where we live.  Great for a small bite, such as their wonderful flatbread with different toppings, cheese tray etc paired up with a glass of wine - large selection or draft beer.  Prices are reasonable and perfect for that late afternoon, early evening "snak & drink" .
author: Beth P.

description:
Like most others in this review thread, I was delighted and surprised when I found Fat Angel tucked away in it's quirky little corner in the Fillmore.

The wine and beer menus were some of the best I've seen in the city. With its   healthy bias toward local producers, this joint quickly jumped into a high position in my "take out of town friends here to show off the SF goods" list.  

We had a sampling of food from the meats and cheese and very tasty salad.  As soon as we walked in, we knew we were going for a salad; those being served to the other guests looked too good to pass on.  The flatbreads didn't exude the same pull.

Great place for a few drinks and a casual meal.  I definitely plan on hitting it up before a show next time I have tickets to the Fillmore.
author: Adam C.

description: I look for traditional home-cooked food in SF and it's honestly hard to find. This place nailed it with the chicken pot pie- just like Grama's. Also the salads are huge and tasty! Well worth the money.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Super helpful staff! They helped us pick a beer that we loved! Had the pretzel with a side of cheese dip (OMG), and the very delicious kale salad!
author: Sophia D.

description: One of my limited number of 5 stars for anything.  I love it here.  It is what I would build if I owned a bar.  GREAT beer list.  Smart, knowledgeable, and comfortable.  Food is good and love coming here to hang out but come early for the best spot.
author: Doreen D.

description: I really really like this place. You can eat butter like cheese, great wine with even better descriptions. Food and service are tops. Fantastic place to meet up with friends.
author: William R.

description: What a gem this place is! It's right off of the main strip. It has a great, edited draft beer menu as well as draft wine, the wine I didn't get to try. The server/bartender was knowledgable about the beer, friendly and prompt with service. The flatbreads were tasty. And I even liked their whimsical menu.
author: Imelda M.

description:
The boyfriend and I started coming here because it's within walking distance from his apartment and he had heard great things about it...and luckily he heard right. And now we just keep going back!

Its pretty small but the atmosphere is cozy not uncomfortable. The servers aren't over the top friendly but they get the job done and are always cordial. We've tried the butter and several different cheeses, all delicious. My go to meal is the smoked trout salad - it's fantastic. Also great is the chicken pot pie. We didn't love the flatbread we tried, but it wasn't bad by any means.

They also have wine on tap - we only drink the various red mixes but they are always great and reasonably priced. They have a very extensive and unique beer list, as well. However, it annoys me they serve beer in Delirium Tremens glasses but don't actually serve Delerium Tremens.
author: Brittany S.

description:
- food: delicious comfort food
- atmosphere:  tiny yet adequate 
- staff:  mostly attentive
- price: fair

additional info:
- extensive beer and wine selection
author: J. B.

description: If only they weren't so busy. We used to come here about once a week for a kale salad, chicken pot pie, and an IPA I had never heard of.
author: Michael C.

description: Food is so delicious! I never liked Mac n Cheese, but I loved theirs. It gets really crowded and we had to wait for a hour and half to be seated but it was totally worth the wait.
author: Coco L.

description: My friends and I stumbled across this hidden gem.  If you are looking for it, you still may not be able to find it. Great wine and the berry cobbler gave me a mouthgasm. Wine suggestion: Textbook
author: Mahta P.

description: Great vibe, tasty small plates and fantastic wine selection.
author: Jodie B.

description: Fat Angel is a dimly lit, cozy bar with fun decor.  It has mouth-watering eats (Chinese nuts, various flatbreads, salads, MACARONI AND CHEESE!) and an extensive beer and wine list.  In my experience, the price point is more reasonable if you order a drink off of the chalkboard (i.e., on draft).  It seems to me that several of the drinks on the paper menu are fancy and pricier.  This is a great spot for a date, happy hour, or stop on your way to see a show at the Fillmore.  So glad it exists!!!
author: Amy B.

description:
The only reason why I would give this place anything less than 5 stars is because I selfishly want to keep this place to myself. It's an incredible addition to the city, and particularly the Fillmore. They have an impressive selection of wine and even more impressive selection of craft beers from around the world. I always ask either Cy or Jen for a recommendation and it's always spot on. Btw, Cy and Jen are awesome. Good people and great service. The food menu is short but you won't be disappointed with any dish you order. That's guaransheed for all my Rasheed Wallace fans out there. The atmosphere is beautiful. The owners purchased architectural components that previously belonged to a church - notice the organ above the bar, wooden benches along the walls, and golden "fat angel" hanging outside the front. If you're looking for a venue for a date, or low key dinner before going out, or a drink after work, look no further. Rumor has it the owners are looking to open a larger restaurant a half block around the corner on Fillmore. Hope it comes through, they're turning the Fillmore into one of the most desired neighborhoods to live in SF

My favorites on the food menu:
Chicken pot pie
Chicken caesar salad (comes with fried capers which are delicious and shredded roasted chicken)
Sliders (best you'll ever have, trust me)
author: Dave Y.

description:
Nice place. Looks rustic and a cool chandelier at the bar. I had a Belgian wheat beer, big 750ml bottle! Get the olives, it has a spicy aftertaste. The cheese was good too

All in all, a nice, calm place. Will frequent this one for sure!
author: Praveen K.

description: Not only is this my favorite neighborhood hang, but its also the best beer bar in San Francisco.  Love the rotating taps and extensive bottle list. Also, can't get enough of their homemade olives - good and garlicky! Great salads, great flatbreads, and yummy meat and cheese plates. A stand out, and one that I look forward to going to each week.
author: Megan W.

description:
i'm here often.  fantastic vegetarian food, and the wine is divine. 

the owners are lovely, it's like they're entertaining at home.
author: Noel J.

description: Great spot for apres-Yoshi's libations. Tucked away just off of Fillmore. Great beer selections. Cute atmoshere. Will visit again.
author: Allison C.

description: High quality cheese platters.  Excellent mac and cheese.  Delightful ambiance.  Friendly staff.  I just wish it opened before 5 on Fridays since I'm done with work at 4:30.
author: Nora S.

description: Enjoyed the grape walnut flatbread . The maple bacon butter was great! Good service and a fun low lit atmosphere.
author: eli m.

description: Why have I been avoiding wine bars for so long? Oh, right, it's because all the ones near me are jerk-saturated. Fat Angel, however, is not. This lovely little wine bar is sort of out of place in Western Addition, but it attracts an incredibly nice crowd of people. I was pleasantly surprised by how chill everyone was at this place. Definitely a refreshing change from the pop-collarey in the northern part of the city. Plus, the wine selection is quite extensive (as it should be) and the decor is comfortable. I'm definitely coming back here and ordering food. And more wine.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
Went there for the first time a couple of weeks ago.  Server was very knowledgeable and nice.

Beer selection is tops.  Wine is good as well.

Try the sliders and mac n cheese! They are freaking delicious.
author: Dan H.

description:
COMFORT.  Friendly, unpretentious service.....
Great atmosphere.....
Diverse wine and beer selection....
Cheeses....
Butters!
And to top it off....an old pipe organ and church pews.
Excellent.
author: Mark E.

description: Had to wait for a table in the middle of the week at a slightly later hour, which I hate, but the waitress/hostess was nice. I devoured 1/2 the menu since I was so hungry by the time we were seated. Although my excitement was partially influenced by beer and hunger, the food was awesome. Especially the mac and cheese.
author: A Z.

description: The name fits this place well. I left with a full tummy and felt like I was in heaven. My friends and I enjoyed every bite and drink. We started with a meat and cheese platter. The Spanish cheese, genoa and spicy chorizo were exceptional. We next enjoyed and devoured the mushroom w/ white truffle oil and pecorino flatbread. We even contemplated ordering one for each! We then ate the delicious mac and cheese, heaven! Lastly we ordered the chocolate mousse. It was the perfect way to end an amazing meal!
author: Karina P.

description: I like this place. It's kinda of small and has a nice relaxed atmosphere. They have a pretty good beer selection however a lot of it is in bottles. The wine though they serve off taps. They have a pretty good selection as well. Really kind and friendly service and just overall a chill place. My favorite thing about this place though ... the food :) It's like comfort food. mac & cheese, bread pudding, sliders? This is a wine bar? Sold! :)
author: Greg G.

description:
Nice place to hang out with friends after work.  This place is real:
-  Small by good wine list.
-  Friendly staff (would be a plus if they had a cute waitress).
-  They have good food in terms of a wine bar (... don't know how they make them... but the sliders were amazing... really....)
-  Cool atmosphere/lighting.
-  Doesn't have shitty music.
-  Again, I don't know how it works but it is a good place to have a good time with good wine and food.
author: fatfat w.

description: Vast beer selection. Utterly satisfying comfort food. Best mac and cheese.
author: Mikey S.

description:
My girlfriend and I checked this place out before a show at the Fillmore this weekend.  Perfect for pre-concert drinks and snacks.

We split a few dishes:

- Wild Boar meat dish (3 stars) - sliced very fine, and served with hot mustard and fresh bread.

- Smoked trout on greens with a horseradish vinaigrette (5 stars) - Great portion size, amazing flavor!!

- Sliders (5 stars) - these were sooo delicious!  Their home made garlic aioli sauce is extremely tasty!

- Mac & Cheese (4 stars)  - Very cheesy.  Definitely add the bacon & onion to the dish, it adds much more flavor!

The also have a great wine selection and a cool atmosphere.  This is a great new addition to the Fillmore district.  We will most definitely be back!
author: km k.

description: We showed up at Fat Angel for dinner last night. Were told there is a 45mins wait, which as I am beginning to realize is normal for SF. We stood outside sipping wine and were finally able to sit at a table outside to wait. But soon realized that the staff was seating other parties of 4 inside, even though they came after us. When we complained our server told us that he had called out our name a couple of times but no one answered, so they seated someone else. Wtf? He was ok bringing us wine outside but not coming to get us for our table when it was our turn. They would have gotten a 1 star if it were not for the owner who saved the night. He came and apologized for the server. Comp'd our dessert and even took a decent chunk off our tab. Kudos to the owner for great customer service. The wait staff needs to learn from him.
author: Aman B.

description: There's no better place to get fat than at Fat Angel! My girlfriends and I sneaked out of work a little early and got there around 4:30 so we had no problem getting a table. The server was super nice and very informative about the massive wine and beer list. I went with a dry-hopped cider and the girls had a champagne cocktail and a couple of the reds. We loved the selection of charcuterie and pate, served with grained mustard and copious amounts of bread, but let's face it, we came for the flavored butters. We had a hard time deciding which one to try and ended up with the lemon caper sage butter, which was delish! We also got the mac & cheese, which was very good but a bit spicy for me. I couldn't leave without trying the apple bread pudding (I can't leave anywhere that has bread pudding without trying the bread pudding), and it was absolutely amazing! I'm a bit of a bread pudding snob, and this was among the best bread puddings I've ever eaten. And it was HUGE! In fact, all of the portions were huge. We saw another table get a salad we were eyeballing, and it looked fantastic, so I'm looking forward to returning and trying some different stuff on the menu!
author: Amy B.

description: DISAPPOINTED!!! I went there last night with my co-workers to have a few drinks and get some dinner. We had 6 folks and 4 different checks, which they said was fine. I got my bill and was charged 20% gratuity for having 6 people even though my bill was for 2 people. No one else was charged for having 6 people. Not only that but the waitress just set it down and did not even mention it. I almost tipped her twice for service that was adequate at best. I feel that you should warn your dinners that the check has tip included and they they are the only ones at the table being charged the gratuity, even though people had there own bill. Its just poor business practices.
author: kari j.

description:
Wow, this place was great! I've been there twice; once for dinner and another time just for drinks. 

+ wine on draft? count me in
+ GREAT beer selection. One of the best I've found in the city.
+ Smoked trout salad was incredible.
+ Chicken pot pie. This dish...is...so...good...It's so good...Sooo goooood. *drool* 
+ Cheese plate was a little pricey, but really wonderful and worth it.
+ GREAT service. The bartenders are patient, funny, and genuinely sweet. The waiters talked us through the menu, answered our questions, and helped us decide without trying to upsell us. Totally unpretentious and no one rolled their eyes or acted like it was our privilege to be there (you know what I mean, San Francisco)
