- Fills up fast, so get there early. We arrived right as it opened so we had great service, but it was packed within 30 minutes.
-The flatbread we ordered was okay. It wasn't bad, but I had to think of a second thing to go on the "negatives" list...sorry flatbread, you really weren't bad at all. 


Yay, Fat Angel!!!
author: Katie M.

description: What a great little spot.  Food/drinks are always tasty, the staff is always helpful.  I will admit that the first time there i wasn't a big fan (was mostly due to the draft wine then) however after being there a handful of times, i really enjoy the place.
author: Dilly M.

description:
This little hidden gem is located smack dab in the middle of the Fillmore Jazz district at O'Farrell and Fillmore, http://www.fatangelsf.com/. Its swanky, stylish and such a find. A couple of friends opened up the place and it retains the unpretentious, intimate look irrespective of the surrounding neighborhood. My only gripe with the Fillmore district is that it's either 4-star expensive or 1-star and cheap and dirty. This place is a perfect balance for the neighborhood as it appeals to a wide range of people, young or old, professional or artsy type. It's perfect for me because I fall in between both those categories (in San Francisco definitions). 

The wine bar is well decorated with reclaimed, recycled and repurposed materials from around San Francisco. So boho chic. The decorating highlights are the stamped tin roof and the "99 bottles of wine wall", aren't they so creative! The prices were average for the city, food was a bit cheaper than expected with the cheese plate being only $5 per cheese whereas you can pay up to $10 for the same sliver of cheese at other bars. The fried capers were delicious and creative. They tasted like the little fried bits of popcorn you find on the bottom of the bowl chocked full of salt and buttery deliciousness. I don't know how they made them, but keep it up. There is a wide selection of house made butters with all sorts of fun flavors like maple bacon and flatbreads to fill the tummy's of those who have a hard time just grazing. The theme for happy hour is "whine after work" which we all need from time to time, $1 off draft wines and beers and $2 off flat breads. What is draft wine you ask? Its the barrel of wine directly from the vineyard hooked up to a tap system similar to how bars serve beer. It's a fabulous idea and quite entertaining to check out. I'd never had draft wine outside of a vineyard before but I'll definitely come back to try out every kind. That's just the kind of dedicated blogger I am. 

Fat Angel is my new favorite local spot! Plus the name is entertaining. It reminds me of the Lyle Lovett song, "Fat Babies Have No Pride" which still puts a smile on my face. Poor fat babies.
author: Alice S.

description: Um...well a bit Marina-eech-yuck! and Angels should be glamorous in my vision it's just ..too blah for my palate, but go there if you need an squeezy place to venture into I guess it caters towards the high rise clientele across the street that is in the mood for this type of place..
author: miriam b.

description: We had an ok bite to eat here before a concert at the Fillmore. Beer recommendation was a bomb--asked for a hoppy beer and got a floral girly beer. Nonetheless the olives were awesome and the sliders were to die for. The kale salad was just ok because of the goopy dressing. Would go back to try out the pot pie. all together, it was decent. Great selection of beers and wines--many selections not seen or found anywhere else. Give it a try.
author: pamela A.

description: The place was nicely decorated, but the service was horrible so we left before we even got to taste the food. Firstly we got a glass of clearly moulded wine and the waiter said it was just a French pinot with a 'funky' taste, and secondly we asked the waiters three times for a table but they let others go before us. After waiting for an hour we gave up and left and decided not to come back. The place looks nice, if only the service could match that..
author: Rolf M.

description:
spent so much money  here!!! but well worth it :)

wine list is extensive and DELICIOUS!

food is even more amazing... 
Trout salad was so flavorful and refreshing at the same time, definitely a must. 
Macraroni and cheese was a bit rich for my taste but damn good still...
Rabbit pate was served with gourmet mustard and super delicious. 
The truffle oil with mushroom flat bread was really to die for. It reminded me of the nopa flatbread :)

Service was excellent. The bartender hates iphone so i loved him a lot :) So i'm definitely coming back to try the chicken pot pie!!!
author: Emily T.

description: Very nice friendly staff (i think owners). Great wines, cheeses, meats and pizzas!  The atmosphere was perfect too, we went on a Thursday night.
author: jessie b.

description: This place is generally great in addition to being a great date spot.  My favorite items on the menu are the smoke trout salad and the meat/cheese plate.  The staff are really  friendly and willing to give suggestions if you don't know what you're in the mood for.  They had a delicious triple creme bleu cheese the last time I was there, but their cheese/meat options seem to change fairly frequently.  They have a good beer/wine list so it's a good place to grab drinks after work and then transition into dinner.  The decor is cozy and warm, but it is pretty small, so does get crowded.  I'd call ahead if you're going on a Friday/Saturday.
author: Tiffany C.

description: A wine bar is a wine bar is a wine bar. You're there to drink wine. And in my book as long as the wine is good, it's hard to go wrong. As a result, it can definitely hard to stand out among the many around. And yet Fat Angel flies high above them all. It's a bit off the beaten path of busy Fillmore but very worth the trek past Popeyes and the Brooklyn's clothing store. The have a very interesting and varied winelist plus really good stuff on tap. Who knew a zin could be so good when poured like a beer? Fat Angel's food shines as well. The meat plate is a little bit of sliced pork heaven and the bread to go with is perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The flatbreads are also delicious and worth the fire time. So grab a seat at the bar, chat up the owner, and enjoy a nice glass of vino after that long day of work.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
5 stars but too busy, so don't you go there.  everyone avoid this place.  it's mine.

in all seriousness, they only had 1 person working (2 called in sick) (ticket said his name was jason) and he was super cheery and nice.  better service than i'm used to getting at all the new "trendy" SF restaurants.  he gets 5 *s all to himself.
author: reza n.

description:
Definitely one of my boyfriend and I's favorite places to frequent.  The ambiance  is is one of relaxation, romance and quirky fun.  The lighting is kept dim, the furniture is vintage inspired, beautiful flowers decorate some of the corners while a great chandelier dangles from the slightly vaulted ceiling.  Laid back classy.  There is a great wine list with wonderful little descriptions to help you decide which one to pick and to have in the most beautiful glasses ever!  We always end up going with one of Jason's suggestions, as his recommendations are spot on for whatever your pallets mood is!  I love bubbles and wish there was a bigger variety, however, their food is pretty amazing!!  The flat bread is off the hook!!  One day we stumbled in here with some friends and had to make it a quick pit stop and requested the speediest food they could make... bread and home made butter!!  OH you have to try the chili garlic butter!!  It is out of this world!!!!!  It is spicy and savory!!  
This is a place I could come to after work every day to unwind!
author: blair k.

description: I cannot count the ways in which I love Fat Angel. As a NY transplant, I gave up on finding spots that have that special dark and loungy East Village vibe some time ago. Until one day I went to Fat Angel... They have the perfect combination of atmosphere, music, food, wine, and personable service. Every little detail is in the right place without pretense or stuffiness. Fat Angel is so good I almost want to keep it a secret. Shhhh...
author: Jeni K.

description: Fat Angel is deserving of its high ratings and it is a welcomed addition to the neighborhood! The space is cozy but not dark and coupley and I loved the large chandelier over the bar. My date and I shared the olives, sliders (so good!), grape and gorgonzola flatbread (yum) and trout salad (large portion but far from great, imo - especially since it arrived last). As everyone else has mentioned, they have an extensive wine list with cute descriptions for each one and the service was very friendly (but also very hands-off - we had to keep flagging them down).  I'll definitely be back!
author: Krystle S.

description: Very decent food, cozy atmosphere, small & quaint place! Do try the Mac & Cheese, and Chicken Pot Pie (not your typical pot pie)! I did not like the duck salami, my friends did, it tasted too greasy and "ducky" for me.
author: Juliee D.

description: Oh Fat Angel, I really wanted to like you.  Food & Libation...what more does a gal need, right?  You have what seemed to be a very balanced list of libations but you disappointed me with the food part.  Ordered the fried capers and the rosemary manchego.  The fried capers, while good, really how many can a person eat before experiencing high blood pressure?  Fat Angel you definitely gave more than expected which is what I wish you would have offered with the manchego.  Really, 2 thin slices of manchego and a handful of bread.  What am I supposed to do with that?  No, won't be visiting again even if you're a cute little spot.
author: Cece E.

description: Great place.  Love the ang out and the location.
author: David L.

description:
After seeing great reviews on Yelp my boyfriend and I decided to try out Fat Angel last Saturday. We arrived at the restaurant around 7:30 and we're told there was one party in front of us as we put our name on the list. Note, we didn't actually write our name down or watch a host write our name down, we just gave our name to a waiter who was supposed to be responsible for the wait list. I never actually saw our name or any other guests name recorded in any way.
Anyway, after putting our names on the "list" we grabbed a drink and stood near the entryway with a couple of beers. A few minutes later a couple came in and put their name on the list. Two seats opened up at the seat yourself bar so we sat down. Food menus were placed in front of us immediately, I told the waiter I would rather wait for an actual table, which he said was fine. A few minutes later I see the couple that came in after us being seated. I grabbed the waitress working that night and told her that we had come in first and asked why we weren't being seated. First the waitress tried to argue with me and insist that I must have just imagined to have stood next to them while they put their name on the list and that they probably came in earlier. When I insisted that no, we came in first, we were there when they put their names on the list the waitress rolled her eyes and told us that most people were fine sitting at the bar so the waiter handling the list had probably just taken us off. She then just walked away. I was shocked. She was just so rude. Instead of trying to rectify their mistake she acted like it was so ridiculous to expect the wait / host staff to do their job. I didn't catch her name, but the waitress working 5/19/2012 was probably the rudest waitstaff I have dealt with. I couldn't believe she just walked away, so I grabbed another waiter to try and get the situation resolved. The second waiter (named Sai I believe) apologized and offered to buy us a round of drinks out of his own pocket. Now, in retrospect he probably wouldn't have paid for the drinks out of his pocket the restaurant probably would (or at least should) have an allowance of food and / or drinks that can be comped when there is some sort of mistake on the part of the staff, but since he was saying it would be coming out of his pocket and since he was neither the very rude waitress I had just dealt with or the incompetent waiter who "put our names on the list" I refused the free drinks and just asked that we be seated at a table as soon as possible.
A while later we were seated at this little window - bar thing. I thought it  was odd we were being seated there since we refused seating at the bar and this was ostensibly the same or worse than seating at the bar, but at this point I was quite hungry so I just sat down. We ordered cheeses, meat, a salad, the mac & cheese, and a couple glasses of wine. The cheeses, meat, and wine were delivered quickly and were fine. The salad came out after we were finished with the cheeses and meat. The food was fine, not mind-blowing, but not bad. We were about two-thirds of the way through the salad when the check arrived. Both of us were sufficiently satiated so we didn't ask about the mac & cheese, but it was at this point that I decided I had to write a review addressing the subpar service at Fat Angel. The waiter who had offered to buy us a round came with a check that had taken the first round off the bill, which was nice but didn't really make up for all the issues with the meal. To me it seems like most of the waitstaff would fit better at a crappy dive bar, where you don't need to write things down because it really is much easier to remember a few drink orders than the names and order of people on a wait list or several tables food orders and you can be more surly with guests. 
In short although the beer and wine list seems extensive & interesting the service will keep me away.
author: Kelsey M.

description: I love this bar!!! We always go here on our way to the Kabuki. They have a fantastic beer selection for the fella and a lovely, diverse (aka not just Californian) wine selection for me, and the food is really good (although it could use a couple of veg-friendly non-salad options). The garlic aioli on the sliders is so good I literally lick the plate clean (although I usually use my finger-- I'm not THAT gross... usually). Knocked a star off for being closed between brunch and happy hour on the weekends-- stay open! We'll come in I promise!!!
author: Jamie H.

description: 4.5 stars, but I round up or down accordingly. We were waiting for a walk-in wait list phone call from SBP around the block so we had an hour and a half to kill. We found Fat Angel on Yelp. Sat at the bar and had olives, the smoked trout salad and some drinks while we waited. If I was local I would definitely make a habit of it. The guys behind the bar were super nice and the crowd was agreeable, we almost wanted to stay, even when State Bird called to tell us our "table" was ready.
author: Stelio C.

description: Love it..... Wine is tasty and you can get it on tap. There is also a few beers on tap that are decent. The decor is amazing; according to their website "Our restaurant was built with reclaimed, repurposed, and recycled materials from around San Francisco". It's completely not snobbish and low key. And for God's sake, they have butter on the menu! There is a parking garage next door but beware....they do not validate.  And yes it might be in the 'hood... but it is my 'hood so its all good with me. A little diversity never hurt anyone.
author: Jessica P.

description: Fun and yummy. Great wine. Great beer. My husband and I don't eat pork so he had the sliders without the bacon and I had the roasted red grape, walnut & gorgonzola  flat-bread without the prosciutto. They were both yummy. The atmosphere was very comfortable. We will be back!!!
author: E S.

description: Fat Angel is quite good. Great beer selection, great wine selection and a real knowledgeable and friendly staff. The place is a little small but it gives it more personality.Try the sliders!
author: R M.

description: I am fortunate to have stumbled in and out of this wine bar.  The decor, vibe, service are all outstanding.  And I am thankful after several visits to have finally ordered food.   I have no idea how they prepare in the small space but I crave their offerings.  The trout salad, cheese plate, the pot pie are all stellar.  So glad I can walk to this place!
author: Beth M.

description: Classy yet relaxed atmosphere... unexpected for the location. Wine on tap! Tasty sliders! The biggest ceasar salad I've seen in my entire life! Take a seat and enjoy...
author: Kari B.

description: Maybe gastropubs aren't my thing, but I didn't think too much of Fat Angel. I had a nice glass of bubbly. It was sweet and light. I enjoyed it. We also got the macaroni and cheese, 3 cheeses, and 3 meats. The meats were far much better than the cheeses. Blue cheese was one of the cheeses I had ordered and it was far too strong for my liking. I would come back again to try something else on the menu.
author: Jackie M.

description: Best smoked trout salad ever. Truffle oil flatbread is another favorite. Excellent wine & beer choices. Good prices.  Good service. Really small place with limited but easy bar seating and friendly vibe. Dessert was unimpressive, but I will be back for the salad!
author: christine h.

description: My review of F.A. has been way overdue.  We've been coming in for months with our friends and always our little baby.  We've probably been in 12 times.  We consider F.A. our go to neighborhood haunt.  We always feel welcomed and we always leave satisfied.  The thing that separates F.A. from other bars is the little things.  The sweet little accompaniments to the cheese plate are so well paired, and the meat plate always puts a smile on my face.  The sliders are off the chain, and the mac and cheese is sinfully delicious.  WE LOVE FA
author: ari b.

description:
my friend suggested to have dinner here after reading the great reviews on yelp and i'm so glad that we chose to come here!
found a parking spot in front of yoshis, a block away - score!
a group just left and we got a small table for 3 right away score! (the place is small and we came on a monday evening around 7pm and it was pretty packed so i would imagine on other nights there would be a wait!)
we sat down at 6:56pm and they let us take advantage of the happy hour (till 7pm, $2 off flatbreads and $1 off beers and wines on tap) - score!
i got a pinot noir on tap - really good
my friend got an Inception Triple Voodoo - really good Belgian ale.
3 of us shared a wild mushroom and white truffle oil flatbread, the sliders, the macncheese and the chicken pot pie. Everything was really solid, although a bit on the heavy side - but hey - it's really good comfort food.
in order, i liked the chicken pot pie the most, then flatbread next, then the macncheese and then the sliders
would definitely go back!
author: Eleanor C.

description: Love the food. Noise level is insane. I can't believe don't whistle and ask the crowd to stop yelling and start talking. The noise level kills this place. It;s a shame. I had to read lips to hear the people who were sitting very close to me. We ended up leaving to a different place
author: Emmanuella A.

description: I have found a new love here in SF. I loved it so much that I returned to dine here 2 nights in a row. You must be patient to come here. The wait can be long, approximately 1 hour each time I came, but definitely worth it. Grab a drink at the bar while you wait and make sure to bring people that will make good conversation or you can always stand at a table giving dirty looks to hurry up and get going. Anyway back to Fat Angel, great selection of beers and amazing bites. You would definitely have to come here a few times to try all the items on the menu. The menu itself is quite small but you definitely want to try it ALL. For appetizers they offer their flavored butters (yum), cheese and meats (yum yum). They offer salads, flat breads, mac n cheese, sliders ( a must try!!! you will die for the sauce), and chicken pot pie. They also offer items for dessert but the 2 times I dined I was way to stuffed to get to that part of the meal. I will definitely have to leave room next time. Great place for a dinner date or small party. Definitely a place I will have to come and visit when in town. Totally in love with you golden chubby lil winged angel. Till we meet again.
author: Arlene C.

description: I have been here twice, and both times my experience was fantastic.  Although the place was packed, my boyfriend and I got seated within 20 minutes.  The service was friendly and attentive, and the food and drinks were to die for.  I highly recommend finishing your meal off with some of their great coffee.
author: Victoria R.

description: My daughter and I came for some wine and cheese but we ended up with true love.  The champagne to start, the wine to follow and some cheese with honey butter and bread then we moved on to order a salad for her and the pot pie for me.  The owner said it was his grandmothers recipe........it was the best pot pie ever...melt in your mouth light fluffy crust and the sauce had tarragon in it that was magnificent!
author: Kathy P.

description: been here once and loved it! almost went again the other night, but we got on a different path. great wines, fun atmosphere, delicious food and just an overall fun vibe! will definitely be back.
author: Miss T.

description:
I am really bummed to write this review.  I've been to Fat Angel twice.  First time was to scope out the place, try the wine, and a few of the appetizers and see what I would need to do if I was bringing a semi-large, free flowing group through on a Friday.  The first experience was divine!  Great wine and champagne plus a delicious cheese with honeycomb (my favorite)!  i was sold and hooked.  After devouring my experience, I touched base with the house manager/wait staff/jack of all trades about possibly making a reservation.  He stated this wasnt possible.  They dont take reservations.  But if I got there early I could take over a couple tables and he'd make it work.

The invites were sent, I was talking up the place and people were excited.  I arrived before 5:30 on a Friday to snag my two tables.  When I arrived I spoke with the same guy who informed they had two reservations totaling 35 guests.  I am expecting an additional 20.  We tried to make it work at Fat Angel.  Then it became increasingly more difficult, so I took my party elsewhere.  Saddened and dismayed this decreased my 2nd experience at Fat Angel.  

Be up front with your customers about what you can and what you cant do.  Either you DO take RESERVATIONS or YOU DONT!  Drinks, food, quaint and adorable space...not good for groups.
author: Liz W.

description: service was awesome; however, the food is OVERhyped!  I make better chicken pot pie & adult mac&cheese.
author: Karen P.

description: I love Fat angel! It is an excellent atmosphere, fantastic beer and wine selection, and those sliders...forget it. I have a hard time ordering anything but, the sliders when I go even though I know there are some other really great options, I think it's the aioli and sauteed onions that do it. If you are looking for a small but fun place to bring a group of friends, this is the place. Love it!
author: Jamie P.

description: Love this place and I'm so glad it's here! A neighborhood gem. Must try:  the sliders (pickles are homemade), bread pudding, chicken pot pie.
author: Sandra P.

description: Fun, kind of eccentric place with a church pew! Great wine, good prices, love the indoor/outdoor feel. I went there with a girlfriend, but now want to do a pre-date hang out with the boyf there too.
author: Ali G.

description: Really cute place hidden in a semi-ghetto part of lower fillmore.  Amazing wine list and yummy cheese and charcuterie selection.  It's nice and cozy inside with a bit of front patio seating.  Fun and mellow for happy hour (a bit pricey though)..
author: Tara H.

description:
A delightful, unpretentious wine bar with a very friendly staff, excellent lighting, gorgeous bar (made from an old church organ) and an all around lovely menu.

Can't wait to go back!
author: Emily L.

description: Came in here after a show at the Fillmore. Wine on draft was good. Will be back for food.
author: Johanna W.

description:
Stopped here for a drink after a show at Great American Music Hall. It's located in Japantown, within walking distance to the Fillmore and just a short drive from GAMH. Sy (sp?), the owner, was closing because it was slow but opened back up for us and let us hang for an hour. Excellent beer and wine selection. The kitchen was closed so we didn't get to try their food. My wife had a Klinker Zinfandel from Lodi.
They have six beer taps, all California beers. Here's what was on tap last night:
Anchor Brekles Brown Ale
Lost Abbey Red Barn Saison
Lost Coast 8 Ball Imperial Stout
Bear Republic Ryenasty DIPA
Ale Industries Peche Sour
- can't remember the last tap. I had the Ryenasty and the Peche Sour. Both were very good.
They have a bottle of RR Toronado 20th Anniv. that they're selling for $399. That may be sitting there a while longer. Anyway, really nice little beer/wine spot with nice ambiance.
author: William H.

description:
Basically I agree with everyone else. My experience included the following pluses-- 
Great service--we got there early to avoid the rush and glad we did, the place got packed. But the two servers remained super attentive. Our wine glasses were never empty without them offering more. 
Great Cheese plate--nuff said 
Great wine list---had some off the glass list, but I also tried the Cab on tap. A Preston wine...it was superb. 

The proximity to the Fillmore was simply the icing.
author: Kevin C.

description: Been here several times. I would give it a 4.5 if i could.  Love it.  The owners are friendly and personable.  They have a great wine & beer list and are very helpful in making recommendation. The small bites also have never disappointed. The decor is just my style: Warm,  simple and no frills.  One of my favorite cozy spots to go for drink and a light bite. For a local spot- this place is perfect. The only downside is that the place is a bit too small to have a large group. But perfect for an intimate date.
author: Sun M.

description: Pretty cool place...Came here when I was visiting SF and had a good time.  The service was prompt and they had some nice wines too go with a chill atmosphere.
author: Nadeem H.

description:
I love this homey and cozy place! FA is close to my place so it's convenient for me to hang out with my friends there. I've tasted almost all their menu and i still want to go there every week. Thinking of their foods makes my mouth watering already. 

All foods are awesome. But please be sure to try their mushroom flat bread, organic Angus beef sliders and chicken roman heart salad!!!!! You will be surprised by their salad's portion (the biggest salad portion I've never seen before like this price) and the beautiful truffle smell from the mushroom flat bread. 

Love their friendly service and relax atmosphere. I don't want to write the review for FA because it's getting more and more difficult to get a table there. Love it!!!
author: Camille C.

description:
a very nice, broad selection of wine. nicely lit, pretty cool decorations inside. very friendly owner.

anyway, i tried the malbec, a negrette, a riesling, and some kind of dessert wine. they all were pretty good choices -- the negrette was a bit too heavy for me, and the dessert wine was too sweet.

the bread pudding was pretty good, and the cheese platters and the orange honey butter were pretty delicious too.

will definitely be here a lot.. doesn't hurt that it's right outside my doorstep either.

edit: place is really chill. i always try and bring people here now.
author: Simon C.

description: Our regular Happy Hour spot!!  Very friendly and attentive wait staff.  The last time I was there I tried the garlic chili butter, it was great!  a great place to relax and get a drink.
author: Karie M.

description: Yum. Cheese plate, Mac n' Cheese, Sliders (with melted delicious cheese)...Fat Angel is decadent  and delicious!
author: Amy W.

description: Was here for the very first time this weekend (had been meaning to check it out for a while, though), during the Fillmore St Jazz Festival.  Popped in with a friend, to escape the crazy crowds & have a nice glass of wine.  While there, we decided to nosh on a bit of food.  I was going to go for the Wild Mushroom Flatbread, but I saw the Mac & Cheese on someone else's plate, and it looked pretty darned good, so I decided to give it a go.  And I'm glad I did: The Mac & Cheese here turned out to be one of the high points of my weekend (and it was a rather FULL weekend)!  I have not been able to stop thinking about it - trying to figure out how soon I can get back there for some more!  I'd have to say that this Mac & Cheese is giving Luna Park a run for its money, and that, my friends, is a very big statement, indeed.  They just got everything right: Nice combination of cheeses, not TOO cheesy, nice choice of pasta, lovely breadcrumbs on top, and there's something spicy in there...  Gives it a bit of character.  I love it.  I want more, in fact.  Gotta have it...
author: Eric H.

description: Friendly and unpretentious, it's a great addition to the neighborhood!  Food is good and affordable and the selection of wine is terrific.  The flatbreads and olives are particularly yummy, and the sliders are just amazing.  I've been there 4 times since it opened, and always had fun.  Will definitely become a regular.
author: Michael M.

description: Delicious little gem hidden in Lower Fillmore! HUGE selection of artisanal beers from all over the world, great food including soft pretzels, flatbread pizzas, mac and cheese, etc.
author: Lina L.

description: Tables are too close together and small. Service was slow. Flatbread with mushrooms was really good though.
author: Katherine O.

description: BEER HEAVEN. Decent food judging by my experience, the only downside was the stale bread and not super great meat in the sliders. Otherwise delicious!
author: Christina V.

description: Excellent food and awesome service.  My friends and I stopped by Fat Angel after seeing a movie at Kabuki Cinemas.  We will definitely be back for more delicious food and wine.  Be sure to try the chicken pot pie and the mac and cheese.  The best I ever had!
author: Lon T.

description: Tried this place out with a friend Friday night. They are still working out the kinks but overall it was a great experience. The owners are super friendly, the wine and food excellent and the overall atmosphere (although not finished) still pretty cozy. This is a great place for a glass of wine and a small bite before or after a show at The Fillmore. I highly recommend the flat bread with a glass of the Sangoviese. I will definitely be back to this place. I am sure it will be a lot more crowded next time.
author: Jim S.

description: Fabulous!  What a little gem.  Wine on tap, tasty cheese plates and a great staff.  I think I have now tried everything on the menu.  All fantastic dishes!
author: Carrie H.

description:
so this is my first yelp review and i just HAD to write a review for this place. :) 

so i went here thursday with a friend n her friend n this place is completely awesome!!!!!

loved the cheqered past and the pale ale cy suggested. :)

maple bacon butter was to quite delicious along with the mac n cheese. DEFINITELY get bacon with it. :) and the sliders... dude... we got two orders of it and i finished 4 of them all to myself. haha. had the proscuitto and that was yummy too. i will definitely drag my friend back here again after a long day at school. :)
author: Anne H.

description: What a cute place! I walked in, thought it was a coffee bar, did a double take and realized I was in the right place. Very intimate with some really sweet bartenders/waiters. I had the GSM and the Zinfandel on tap. Both were great, although I think I liked the Zinfandel more. They also have an amazing cheese plate that disappeared pretty quickly among five friends. It was a great start to a fun and random night :)
author: Lizette R.

description:
This heavenly boîte tucked away in the Fillmore Center is a recent discovery, having been recommended by a foodie friend of mine who loves FA's mac & cheese.  Yummy!  For me, what stands out about FA's mac & cheese is that it's made with Gruyère, topped with toasted bread crumbs and comes out sizzling in a cast iron casserole.  The portion is large enough for two, so one can try other things on their limited menu.  I was in a group of 4 in my first visit and along with the mac & cheese, we had their sliders, flat bread and a nice bottle of reasonably priced red wine.  All of us had a wonderful time!  On a return visit with a friend, we sat at the bar had very good wine from the tap and shared FA's chicken pot pie and a frisée salad.  The salad could easily have fed 4.  The pot pie portion was huge, too, but both of us agreed that it was too heavy.  It's more in the style of a shepherd's pie--too thick and potatoey.  I much prefer a creamier pie that one can spike with a shot of sherry.  The Big Four still ranks as my personal favorite for pot pie.

The Fat Angel, having just celebrated their first anniversary, attracts an attractive, young, hip crowd probably more into FA's very good beer list than their wines.  I find the decor very attactive--done up with the fixtures of an old church.  Organ pipes line the wall behind the bar and pews serve as banquettes.  Sit long enough at the bar with a few glasses of wine and one can easily think of Christine Daaé being serenaded by the Phantom!
author: Alex M.

description: A 3 star is the average between my husband's and my review. He had chicken pot pie and sliders, he loved the chicken pot pie. I had the mac and cheese which was extremely SPICY! When telling the waitress she simply said that the kitchen staff is from Mexico and that's why it's spicy.... ??????? Never heard such a thing B4. Wines were good but service was non-existent. After seating at a table for 15 minutes we had to get up to order at the bar. When they brought us the food there was no napkins, silverware or water until we got a glimpse of the busboy and asked him for those items. Even to ask for another wine and the bill we had to go to the bar, but a group of girls next to us had a waiter coming to them all the time... Would not recommend.
author: Amanda T.

description: I usually don't give 5 Stars, but I love this place.  The atmosphere is cozy and classy with a wonderful selection of small meals and great wines that make for a wonderful evening.  I've only been here 4 times, but I've been pleased every single time!
author: Darrell R.

description: I Love this place! I live super close so I frequent Fat Angel.  They have wine ON TAP! Yes, ON TAP! The Syrah on tap is my favorite. But the wine isn't what makes this place so great...try the Food! They actually have Butter on the menu...different flavors of butter served with bread.  And the Mac and Cheese is sooo good.  It's kinda close to 1300, which gets undeserved praise for their mac and cheese and Fat Angel's is way better.  I've also ordereda salad there and it was big enough to feed me and 2 friends...Great place!!
author: natalie l.

description: I didn't know that the 'hood had been praying for a fat angel, but if it wasn't - it should have been because this place rocks.  The decor is perfect, not trying to hard and filled with quaint touches.  The wine list is nicely edited with amusing descriptions and the food is awesome.  Mac and Cheese is always a hit as are cheeses and flat bread.  I had a goat brie here that I can't stop thinking about, which is incredible because I hate goat cheese and I hate brie.  Who'd have thought that they'd combine to perfection?
author: She-Ra ..

description: I was really excited to check out this place after reading the reviews. And for the first half an hour, I was not disappointed. We ordered some mushroom and truffle flat bread and it was delicious. The Pinot Noir on tap was not bad but I didn't expect much from tap wine anyway. Then things started to go downhill after I ordered a glass of Bordeaux. I swear that bottle was opened more than two days ago. There was no fragrance left. The wine was really bland. My bf also ordered a glass of another red wine which turned out the same as my Bordeaux. So 3 stars for food and atmosphere. But seriously, taste your wine before you serve it and throw away the old bottle please.
author: P. L.

description: I really liked this place.  5 stars mostly because it really exceeded my expectations.  The wines on tap were a great deal (we even made it just in time for Happy Hour so $2 off a half bottle!), the food was excellent and the staff was laid back and helpful at the same time.  We had the mushroom flatbread (also $2 off for HH), maple bacon butter, 2 meat selections and ceasar salad with roasted chicken.  surprisingly the salad was my favorite.  Don't get me wrong, butter that tastes like breakfast was fantastic, but the roast chicken was cooked so perfectly and the homemade dressing and fried capers really took a typical salad to another level.  I want to come back to just geek out on the wine and beer selection some time!
author: L P.

description: I love this place but it gets too busy so I never go back here. Also every time I go here, the female waitress is a little rude and not the nicest person.
author: Milly C.

description: Draft wine?  Delicious and ecofriendly, gotta love it. The Free Flow sauvignon blanc was light and very refreshing and just what I needed after my bike ride to the fillmore district.  I convoluted my order and received a glass instead of a bottle of the wine, and the owner immediately comped my glass. Then we moved to a table and shared the wild boar and some maple bacon butter and bread to top the experience off.  The table service was fantastic and the decor is phenomenal.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Kate N.

description: Yet another visit to Fat Angel proves me right about this little gem of a wine bar. The small plates are excellent, the service is awesome, and the servers knowledgeable about every wine and beer on their menu. Whenever I am unsure where to go, I always head to Fat Angel.
author: Miss P.

description:
hnmmm, i'm a bit torn....this place has some potential...and the fact that the owners seem really nice, i'm gonna give them the benefit of the doubt that my experience was first week (or so) jitters.

the good:
1) orange blossom butter...oh yeah!  
2) excellent cheeses.
3) huge-ass salad
4) cool venue that offers something a bit different in that area

the bad:
1) i missed amos lee's and brett dennen's performance at the Fillmore that night (okay, that was my fault, not theirs!)
2) spilled glass of water on my friend....well, at least it wasn't wine or something...the tables are a bit small, which makes placement of food a bit awkward.
3) they added bacon to the mac 'n cheez...which wouldn't be an issue for me, but since my friend is a vegetarian...
4) some stuff was stuck on the bottom of some of the bread (assuming it was just on the cutting board....but it took awhile for us to figure out it wasn't mold or something)
5) could do with a bit larger portion of the cheeses (try this: less salad, more cheez!  works like a charm.)

anyway, i will definitely hit this place again....hopefully they will work out some of the issues by then.
author: Miss P.

description: OK, im obsessed with this place and the fact that its IN my apartment building makes the temptation to go here like every night for a tasty brew with roasted capers, flat bread and glass of vino etc makes for some very difficult decisions when Im trying to go to the gym. Damn you Fat Angel and you're 20s style embiance, tasty beer list and all around awesomeness. Cheers to the staff for knowing there stuff too.
author: chris k.

description: Unusual draft beers and solid selection of draft wine.Friendly, attentive barmen. Low light AND low music, so you can actually carry on a conversation.  Easy going crowd. I don't want to see the place get packed, but the guys running the place deserve the five stars.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
This is a new favorite spot for some guilty pleasures.

Really good mix of old and new world wines by the glass, about 25 total.  Also have arguably the best beers on tap (pranqster, La merle, etc..- all small batch stuff), and tons of good belgian beers in btl.

I dig the infused butters they make, totally original (the bacon-maple was excellent).  And just a good all around mix of cheeses and salumi.

If you're down to just snack on stuff for dinner and geek out on a few different wines and brews, this place is the jam.
author: Nick H.

description: Friendly staff. Bartender explained the beers on tap..good beer but a bit expensive for me. Strangers were recommending the chicken pot pie, but I'm a vegetarian, so I'm forwarding the recommendation on to you.
author: Jenny K.

description: (Like) a real Belgian bar / bistro! Ok, a bit more clean :). Delicious food, the flatbread is amazing! And the beers are rich and flavoured. Nice crowed, perfect!
author: Lars J.

description: Yummy Getman beer. Tasty cheese nuts and small plates.  Cosy atmosphere and friendly helpful staff.  What's not to like?   Close to kabuki so good place to hit before or between movies.  Go early.   Does get crowded .
author: Darren P.

description: Yay! I am so happy to see that Fat Angel is getting so many good reviews. I LOVE this place. I live a few blocks away and it is exactly what you want your neighborhood restaurant to be, only better because there are chandeliers, a witty menu and great prices. My bf and I are the wine and appy type and every time we go out we end up paying 100 bucks for a few glasses of wine and some bites. Not at Fat Angel...we had amazing food and wine, service was great and the bill was like $50!  I couldn't believe it. The quality of food is so good I was expecting it to be higher. This is a great spot and we will definitely be back soon!
author: H S.

description: This place just opened about 8 weeks ago and is a real find!  Based on the BACON MAPLE Butter, the PotPie, the Sliders, the BEER! , the Flatbreads, it's just yummmmmmmy!  6 of us went and basically ordered some of everything and shared.  We went at 6:30 on a Thursday night and the place became (by 7:30) packed and hopping.  Knowledgeable staff/owner and good service. We WILL be going back. Oh Yaeh   MAAAAC and CHEEEESE. was good also.  Sliders Rocked!
author: Glen B.

description:
I've been to Fat Angel a handful of times and each experience is better than the last!  My first visit was just for wine- which I love having on tap!  The guys behind the bar have great taste and make fantastic suggestions.  Second visit was with a small group and the fun, casual vibe of the bar was perfect.  Third visit was for my birthday and Fat Angel took great care of us.  We were able to snag a few tables and they were attentive, helpful and festive.  Everyone adored the place.  The extensive beer list pleased the dudes and the wine list suited all of our varied tastes.  Bonus, this was the first time I tried the food.  So so good!  Even my pregnant best friend wanted to come back for the pot pie-- and she can't even enjoy the great wines and beers!  Most recently, I tried the bread pudding.  How did I not know of this before!?!  It took four of us to finish it but it was easily the best bread pudding I've ever head.  It's going to have to be a rare treat, though, or I will start to resemble the bar name :)

Fat Angel is perfect for girls night out, small birthdays, dates and... well, any excuse you can come up with!
author: B M.

description: This place is awesome. The beer selection is great, and I love the wine on draft :). The food is not your typical entree style; it is meant to share - and SO good! Duck salami, smoked trout salad, and their butter selection is ah-mazing! Try the garlic chili one - yum!! And they are not stingy about the bread they give you with the butter - so good!
author: Suzie P.

description: Ok wow. Decor from an old church. Wow. What an atmosphere. The server was so very helpul. The food and wine were amazing. Will go back next time i'm in SF.
author: David S.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!

I may have just fallen in love. And it wasn't with my boyfriend. It was with this bar... the owners, and their passion, are worth falling in love with.

Wines on tap, amazing beer selection on tap, great bites to eat, wonderful vibe, and best of all there is a story behind every single detail in the space.

I just love this place, and they can consider me a fixture in the bar until we move.

Having just left my job a couple of days ago, Im stoked to have a place so casual and comfortable that it feels like I can hang out and read novels while enjoying the vibe and the company during my time off.

And to the owners: I wasn't kidding when I said I would help you build the rest of that chandelier! Just call the number I left :)
author: Morgan Z.

description: I love the delicious food and variety choice of wine. Especially, their comments for the wine serve with cheese. If you do not know how to oder your meal, just ask them.
author: Kelly C.

description: This place is so cute and cozy that I didn't want to leave. The lighting and decor is so inviting and festive! They have a pretty good wine list which I was happy about.... their beer list is a good too for you beer lovers out there. The service was great and I was glad to see that the staff had some wine knowledge. Too many times I've been to wine bars and the staff have zero knowledge about their products! We didn't have any food so I really can't comment on that, however, I saw some of the food coming out and it looked GOOD!
author: Lexi S.

description: Hands down my favorite place to relax and eat amazingly delicious food in SF. The owners and staff are super friendly and helpful when choosing beers and wine. Even though every table is filled (even the ones outside... yea people love it so much girls will eat in 45 degree weather)  you are treated as if you are the only customer at the bar. It's that great! I would recommend it for groups of 4 or less. I also recommend the Tempranillo and Sliders. Best sliders ever! :)
author: Tricia K.

description: I recently moved into the city from the North Bay and landed at the Fillmore Center.  I have enjoyed getting to know the neighborhood and was especially excited to discover the newest addition, Fat Angel.  I stopped in last night after work and was greeted warmly by the owners and proceeded to have a wonderful evening enjoying samples from their interesting wine list, fried capers (amazing), sugar coated nuts and an a great ceasar salad with shredded chicken served in a wooden bowl.  Overall, it was a great evening and I believe the other patrons who stopped in enjoyed it as well.  I highly recommend Fat Angel as the best new addition to the Fillmore neighborhood!
author: Laura M.

description: This is a hidden gym! You won't just run into this place you have to look for it. My boyfriend brought me here before we headed to a movie at Kabuki for my birthday. He is more of a beer guy than wine so this place was perfect for us!  I had prosecco while he had casey jones beer (which he loved). For dinner we shared a cheese and meat plate. Our favorite was their flat bread, which has asparagus, ricotta cheese, and pine nuts. It was perfect! We both keep talking about how amazing it was. I'll be back here soon, but next time with my girlfriends for our monthly wine night!
author: Sarah R.

description: i was excited about trying out a new spot - fat angel had a promising wine list (in variety and price), fun food options, and a cute neighborhood spot... but my optimistic outlook took a turn when an unruly patron was seated next to us.  he was clearly drunk and largely incoherent, and yelled at his date in between taking swigs of wine and slamming his glass onto the table.  i have to admit, his abrasive presence tainted our experience.  and the management didn't seem to mind - i think he might have been a friend, but it really detracted from the atmosphere.  in any case, the wines were decent (one of them, a chocolaty red was actually quite delicious), and the flatbread was tasty.  however, the cheese plate was rather scant, and the fried capers were greasy and burnt.  service was very friendly, but overall experience was rather disappointing.
author: melita s.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have been waiting for this place to open up for months. It was worth the wait. We went there last night for a late dinner, and were quite pleased. They are still getting their bearings and need to work out a few minor kinks, but the food was wonderful (pulled pork over polenta, mac 'n cheese), and the owners were friendly and helpful. I can see this cozy little place being my go-to for a relaxing glass of wine and small plate at least once a week after work.
author: Wendy B.

description: I went with a group of friends for a Friday happy hour.  It felt warm and intimate. The staff was fabulous.
author: Christa R.

description: A new Fav get sliders insanly good, flat bread and huge salads are great as well.
author: jordan n.

description: It's a year later. Fat Angel just gets better and better. If you have not eaten here, go tonight.
author: angela j.

description: best place to kick back with some nonpretentious wines and their friends...
author: Sarah N.

description: maybe it was all the beer and wine i drank before eating anything, but i loved the cozy boozy atmosphere of this place. it's tiny, but we scored a fun little marble topped table and bench to fit the four of us. shared an apple dessert that was absolutely huge. the "draft wine" (sauv blanc) was drinkably delicious, and service was friendly.
author: emmeli p.

description: Really fantastic. Great wine (price range is fair!), and delicious food! We shared a bottle of Reisling ($34) and an amazing plate of mortadella, hot coppa, and brie! mmmmm ($5 each or a plate of 5 appetizers for $21)--the service was very attentive and the ambience is wonderful (love the chandeliers)--a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Lauren Q.

description: Went here for the first time last night.  Great spot for a date or a catch up with a friend - even a small group if it's not a busy night.  Pleasant music, great decor and the lighting is perfect.  (I personally think this is key for a wine bar - I think there are too many places that are too brightly lit).  I'm delighted to have found a new neighborhood spot.  Nice selection of wines and enjoyed everything I sampled.  I'll be back.
author: Jen K.

description: So, I was given the task of finding a place to go for dinner/drinks before going to see MGMT last night at the Fillmore. I searched around on Yelp for places in the area so we could just park one time and walk over to the show afterwards. I found this place on here and saw the good reviews so we decided to try it out. We got here around 6 p.m. and sat up at the bar. The bartender was very attentive and nice! The place became very crowded as the evening went on, probably because of the show at the Fillmore. It was fun, classy and overall a stellar time! It was a place to go for food, wine, good beers and you can laugh in there without the whole place noticing even though it is a smaller place. We ordered the boar salami, truffle oil mushroom flatbread, a bleu cheese, maple bacon butter, lemon caper butter, bacon macaroni and cheese, sliders and chicken pot pie. This was more than enough food for four very hungry people!  All of the food was very good with the only disappointment being the chicken pot pie. The pot pie was only luke warm and very bland. Next time I would opt for a salad because they were huge and looked amazing. It seemed like the kitchen was a bit disorganized if they were busy but I am sure that will be worked out in time, they are fairly new. As for the drinks we ordered the Pinot Nior on tap, Pranqster beer, a specialty bottle beer and a glass of each of the two Pinots. The 2006 Carneros Pinot was out of this world, highly recommend it. The highlights definitely were that Pinot, maple bacon butter, macaroni and cheese and the truffle oil flatbread. I definitely enjoyed the atmosphere and experience and will go back soon, even when I am not going to see a show at the Fillmore.
author: Deseray T.

description: This place is a great asset to our neighborhood. Jason is super friendly, the food is good and the selection of wines is really fun. You can tell that these people have poured their heart and soul into getting Fat Angel going, and I plan to support it with regular visits.
author: Kryss A.

description: it was yummy and absolutely adorable and cozy inside. great for a cold evening. the mac n cheese was delish,  the mushroom flatbread was scrumptious and the flavored butter out of this world. I just wish my pimms cup was larger!
author: sarah s.

description: First off, my boyfriend picked this spot out and I had minor reservations. What to expect from a place called Fat Angel? No girl ever wants to eat at a place with the word fat in it unless it is spelled with a P.H. When walking in the restaurant I wasn't sure how the night was going to play out because it was packed with only 1 seat at the bar, our odds were not looking good. Our home town friendly bartender made us feel confident and right at home when he said that it will only be a few moments. Literally in a "few moments" the best seat in the restaurant was available. We like to people watch. There we were sitting at a window seat looking over the charming vibe of Fillmore and O'Farrell. was more than we ever expected. Great conversation surrounding us as we ordered delicious wine and waited for our handcrafted ceasar salad to be made. Our flat bread pizza was thebomb.com. DEELISH is all i have to say. We topped it off with the best sliders. Just ask Dianne for the "mini goodness", she knows what's up. Overall...a quaint setting with incredible service. Whether you are taking your gal, your friend, your brother or cousin you will for sure have a good time. Thanks Jason.   I'd go back because it was a chill, open environment . You could have private conversations in the place and not feel like others were listening to you. It was crowded but calm and quiet. What made it cool? Everyone was in their own world.
author: Bella p.

description: What separates Fat Angel from other wine bars in the city is the unconditionally friendly service from the owners and their thorough descriptions of the wines. They emphasize wines that are not from the CA region (which makes me happy, since I am a wino for Spanish and South American varieties) and they are willing to spend a lot of time talking about the flavors and your personal preferences. They also offer tastings if they think they have a great suggestion for you. It is San Francisco, so the prices reflect that (7-14 dollars per glass) but their 7 dollar glass is of a higher quality, in my opinion, than at most other wine bars. Fortunately, they do not have the all-too-common SF wine snob approach. They have been very good to me every time I come in, and this very quickly became a favorite spot.   Lastly, as someone who avoids places like the Marina and the Financial District at all costs, it needs to be said that I've been in this place on the days when I've been sloppy and scrambling for loose change and on the days when I just bought a pretty new dress and wanted to make an afternoon of it.
author: Annemarie G.

description: so glad this place exists and in its location which is low key yet up and coming. totally unpretentious vibe, great food, very freidnly service and cool enviornment. a great addition to our neighborhood and city. its douchebag free which is alwasys a plus. the food is simple but superb. the pizzas are delish. their mini sliders are the best burgers i have had in my entire life, hands down!!!!!! i crave them on a daily basis. my only suggestion would be improved music.
author: A M.
